content:

a smoking dish―a steaming dish

(potatoes) hot from the oven
卒業したてのホヤホヤだ
He is fresh from school―fresh from college.
あの西洋人は来たてのホヤホヤだ
He is just from abroad.
出来たてのホヤホヤだ
It is bran-new―brand-new.

content.content: なにをボヤボヤしておるか、ボヤボヤしていてはいかん
Look alive!―Look sharp!

content:
ほゆう〔保有〕
〈名〉Possession; retention:(=する) to possess; to retain

content.content: 天佑を保有し万世一系の皇祚を践める大日本国皇帝は忠実勇武なる汝有衆に示す
We, by the grace of Heaven, Emperor of Japan, seated on the throne occupied by the same dynasty from time immemorial, do hereby make proclamation to all Our loyal and brave subjects.
保有地
a holding―a tenement
保有物
tenement

content:
ほよう〔保養〕
〈名〉Preservation of health:(病後の保養)recuperation:(=する) to take care of one's health; to recuperate (oneself); to recruit (one's health)

content.content: 彼は保養のために旅行している
He is travelling for the good of his health―for the benefit of his health.
転地はご保養になります
Change of air will be to the benefit of your health―Change of air will do you good.
温泉へ保養に行く
I go to the hot springs for my health―to improve my health.
彼は逗子で病後の保養をしている
He is recuperating―recruiting―convalescing―at Zushi.
病後は身体の保養が大事だ
You must take good care of your health after an illness.
目の保養をする
to feast one's eyes on wonders
保養地
a health-resort
保養所、 保養院
a sanatorium―a sanitarium―a convalescent hospital
保養散歩をする
to take a constitutional (walk)

to boast―brag―stretch―bounce―talk big―blow hard―draw the long bow―turn on the gas―vapour―pitch it strong

content:

〈名〉A prisoner (of war):(古文体においては)a captive

content.content: 捕虜にする
to take one prisoner―take them prisoners―(古文体においては)―lead one captive―lead them captives
捕虜になる
to be taken prisoner(s)―be captured
捕虜を交換する
to exchange prisoners
捕虜交換(条約)
exchange of prisoners―cartel

delivery of prisoners

to intern prisoners
捕虜収容所
the prisoners' quarters―an internment camp

the prisoner's intelligence bureau

content:
ほる〔掘る〕
〈他動〉
1. To dig (a hole); to dig in (the ground); to dig for (coal); to delve (the ground); to grub up (bushes); to cave (a rock); to excavate (an ancient mound―a tooth for filling); to bore, drive (a tunnel); to sink (a well or a shaft); to mine, dig for (gold)

content.content: 穴を掘る
to dig a hole―dig a grave
蟹は甲羅に似せて穴を掘る
The crab makes a hole suited to its shell―“Cut your coat according to your cloth.”
地を掘る
to dig in the ground―delve the ground
砂を掘る
to dig in the sands
蛤を掘る
to dig for clams
石炭を掘る
to dig for coal―mine coal
金を掘る
to dig for gold―mine gold
金銀は山から掘る
Gold and silver are dug out of the bowels of the earth.
井戸を掘る
to sink a well
トンネルを掘る
to bore a tunnel―drive a tunnel―through a mountain
歯を掘って埋める
to excavate a tooth for filling―plug a tooth
流れが河底を次第に深く掘る
The stream wears the channel deeper.
野猪が鼻で土を掘る
The wild boar muzzles the earth.
掘り出す
to dig out―(死骸なら)―disinter a body―exhume a body―(宝なら)―unearth a treasure
荒蕪地を掘り起す
to dig up waste land
掘り返す
to dig up the soil―turn up the soil
掘り下げる
to dig down―delve in
掘り抜く
to dig through
鉱脈を掘り当てる
to strike a lode
兎は穴を掘って住む
A rabbit burrows.
根堀り葉堀り聞く
to be inquisitive
根堀り葉堀り聞く人だ
He is an inquisitive person.

content:

1. To carve; to engrave; to chisel; to inscribe; to sculpture; to sculp

content.content: 印形を彫る

像を彫る
to carve an image
立像は大理石に彫ってある
The statue is carved in marble.
象牙に彫ったもの
a carving in ivory
金板に名を彫りつける
to engrave a name on a plate―(よりも第二構文が普通)―engrave a plate with a name
碑に碑銘を彫りつける
to inscribe a monument with an epitaph

content: 2. (=文身する)to tattoo

content.content: 彼は背中に龍を彫っている
He has a dragon tattooed on his back.

content.content: あの店はちとぼる
They ask exorbitant prices at that shop.
ひどくぼられた
I had to pay through the nose.

a Portuguese

a Portuguese

content:
ほれこむ〔惚れ込む〕
〈他動〉To fall deeply in love with (a person); to take a fancy to (a person or thing)

content.content: 僕は君のところの庭に惚れこんだ
I have taken a fancy to your garden―Your garden has caught my fancy.

ほれさせもんく〔惚れさせ文句〕
〈名〉Endearing expressions

ほれっぽい〔惚れっぽい〕
〈形〉Fond (nature); soft (heart, etc.)

content:
ほれぼれする〔惚れ惚れする〕
〈形〉Charming, enchanting, bewitching, captivating, fascinating, ravishing (figure, etc.)

content.content: 老人が見てもほれぼれする
Age can not look on her with indifference.

content:
ほれる〔掘れる〕
〈自動〉To be hollowed; go grow deeper

content.content: 河底が掘れる(いつ掘れるともなく深くなる)
A channel grows deeper―wears deeper.
雨滴で石が掘れる
Falling drops will wear a stone―“Constant dropping wears a stone. ”
地が掘れる
The ground is hollowed out.

content:
ほれる〔惚れる〕
〈他動〉To fall in love with (a person); to become enamoured of (a person); to become attached to (a person); to take a fancy to (a person or thing); to lose one's heart to (a girl):(女が男に惚れる)to fix her affections on (a man)

content.content: 君に惚れた
I love you―You are dear to me―You are not indifferent to me.
彼は細君に惚れている
He loves his wife―He is attached to his wife.
二人は互いに(深く)惚れあった
They fell (deeply) in love with each other.
二人は惚れた同志だ
They are lovers.
惚れた同志の結婚
a love-match
彼は自分に惚れている
He is in love with himself―enamoured of himself.
僕はこの絵に惚れた
I have taken a fancy to this picture.
彼は彼女に首ったけ惚れている
He is deeply in love with her―over head and ears in love with her.
よく見てよく惚れる
Look well, and love well!
惚れ過ぎる
to love one to distraction
彼はあの子にぞっこん惚れている
He is taken with the girl―gone on the girl―He has lost his heart to the girl.
男嫌いの女が男に惚れる
A man-hater shows a soft heart.
彼女は男に惚れているのじゃない金に惚れているのだ
She love him for the sake of his money.
男に惚れているのだ
She loves him for his own sake―loves him for himself.
彼の気前に惚れました
I love him for the sake of his personality.
親切に惚れた
I love her for her kindness―Her kindness attaches me to her.
あれは惚れて貰った細君だ
He married her for love.
彼女の学問に惚れて貰ったのだ
He married her for the sake of her learning.
僕はカーライルの思想に惚れた
I like Carlyle for his ideas.
惚れられる、惚れさせる
(女になら)to win her affections―(男になら)―make a conquest of him
惚れられたのが身の詰まり
He was beloved to his ruin.
惚れた病にゃ薬無し
No medicine can cure love.
惚れた欲目
Love invests its object with perfections not its own―Love sees no faults―“Love is blind”
惚れた眼にゃ
When one is lost in love's sweet dream,
あばたも笑窪
A pockmark would a dimple seem.
惚れて通えば
Love laughs at distance, Love!
千里も一里
A thousand miles is one to love;
会わずに帰れば
But when I can not meet my love,
又千里
A thousand is a thousand, Love!

content.content: 母衣を負う

galloping with a flowing hood

content.content: 幌をかける

content:
ぼろ〔襤褄〕
〈名〉
1. Rags:(=の) ragged

content.content: 洋紙はぼろで製す
Foreign paper is made from rags.
子どもらはぼろを着ている
The children are (clad) in rags.
ぼろを着た奴
a ragamuffin―a tatterdemalion
ぼろ着物
ragged clothes
着物がぼろになった
The clothes are reduced to rags.
昨日のぼろは今日の錦
A pauper is transformed into a prince.
昨日の錦は今日のぼろ
A prince is transformed into a pauper.
ぼろを隠す
to conceal one's poverty
ぼろを隠すのが一番に辛い
The endeavour to conceal poverty is its sharpest sting.
ぼろを隠そうとしなけりゃ貧乏も辛くない
If you do not try to conceal your poverty, you will not find it hard to bear―“Have the courage to appear poor, and you disarm poverty of its sharpest sting.”
ぼろ隠し(外套)
a wrap-rascal―an overall

content: 2. (=欠点)faults; defects

content.content: ぼろを出す
to expose one's defects―expose oneself―show one's true colours―betray the cloven hoof
ぼろを出さぬようにしろ
You must keep up appearances.
ぼろが出た
He has exposed himself―He is exposed―unmasked―caught tripping.
どんな善い人でもその行為を厳しく調べるとぼろが出る
The conduct of the best men will not bear scrutiny.

content:
ぼろい
〈形〉Easy (gain)

content.content: ぼろい金儲けができる
You can make easy gains.

〈名〉(=襤褄隠し外套)A wrap-rascal; an overall

ほろばしゃ〔幌馬車〕
〈名〉A carriage with a top; a covered carriage

content:
ほろびる〔亡びる〕
〈自動〉To go to ruin; to be ruined; to go to wreck; to be overthrown; to be destroyed; to perish; to fall

content.content: 国が亡びる
A country goes to ruin.
身代が亡びる
A fortune goes to wreck.
牝鶏時をつくれば家亡ぶ
When the hen crows, the house goes to ruin.
平家は壇の浦で亡びた
The Tairas were overthrown at Dannoura.
ローマ帝国亡びて現今の欧州列強となった
The Roman Empire fell, and broke up into the modern European states.
驕る者は亡ぶ
“Pride goes before a fall”
我々が成功しなけりゃ国が亡びる(という意気でかからなくてはならぬ)
We must succeed, or the country is done for.

content:
ほろぶ〔亡ぶ〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: ほろびる〔亡びる〕

content:
ほろぼす〔亡ぼす〕
〈他動〉To ruin (a man); to destroy (a nation); to overthrow (a house); to wreck (one's fortune)

content.content: 身を亡ぼす
to ruin oneself
彼の大望が身を亡ぼした
His ambition ruined him―wrecked his career.
ぜいたくをして身代を亡ぼした
He wrecked his fortune by extravagance―His extravagance was his ruin.
敵を亡ぼす
to destroy the enemy―overthrow the enemy
敵のために亡ぼされた
He was overthrown by his enemy.
国を亡ぼす
to ruin a nation
そんな経済はかえって国を亡ぼす(亡国的経済)
Such economy is ruinous to the State―It is ruinous economy.

content:
ほろぼす〔滅ぼす〕
〈他動〉(=罪を滅ぼす)To atone for (a crime); to expiate (a crime); to do penance; for (one's sins); to make amends for (a fault)

content.content: この罪を滅ぼすには死ぬよりほかは無い
Death is the only atonement for this crime.
罪を滅ぼすために難業苦業をする
to do penance for one's sins
善行をもって過去の罪を滅ぼさん
I will atone for my past by good works.

content:
ホロホロ
〈副〉In drops

content.content: ホロホロと涙をこぼす
Tears fall in drops.

content:
ボロボロ
〈形、副〉In rags; in tatters; in shreds; in ribbons

content.content: 着物がボロボロに切れている
His clothes are ragged―worn to rags―worn to tatters―in tatters.
(船が暴風に逢って)帆がボロボロに裂けてる
The sails are torn to tatters―torn to shreds―torn to ribbons―The sails hang in tatters―hang in shreds―hang in ribbons.
字書をボロボロに切らした
I have worn my dictionary to tatters.
ボロボロの着物
ragged clothes―tattered clothes
ぼろぼろの車
a ragged ricksha
(岩石などが)ボロボロ崩れる
A rock crumbles―crumbles to dust.
こすると垢がボロボロ落ちる
If you rub the skin with a towel, the dirt comes off like vermicelli.
子どもがご飯粒をボロボロこぼす
The child drops the rice like rain.
ご飯粒がボロボロこぼれる
The rice drops like rain.

content:
ポロポロ
〈副〉In drops

content.content: 涙をポロポロこぼした
The tears fell in drops.
ポロポロ落ちた
A few drops fell.

ほろほろちょう〔珠鶏〕
〈名〉The guinea-fowl

content:
ほろよい〔ほろ酔い〕
〈名〉A slight intoxication; elevation; mellowness

content.content: ほろ酔いになる
to be slightly intoxicated―slightly flushed with wine―elevated―mellow
ほろ酔い機嫌
elevation
花は半開酒はほろ酔い
Flowers are at their best when half-open, and wine is best when one is slightly intoxicated―Moderation is the soul of enjoyment.

content:
ほろりと〔ホロリと〕
〈名〉In a drop

content.content: ホロリと涙
to drop a tear―A tear stands in one's eye.
あのいじらしい様子を見るとホロリとする
I can not but cry to see the pitiful sight.

content:
ほろりと〔ホロリと〕
〈名〉In a drop

content.content: ホロリと涙
to drop a tear―A tear stands in one's eye.
あのいじらしい様子を見るとホロリとする
I can not but cry to see the pitiful sight.

content:
ほん〔本〕
〈名〉
1. A book; a volume; an author

content.content: 本を開く
to open a book
本を一枚一枚開ける
to turn over the leaves of a book
本を閉じる
to shut a book
本を綴じる
to bind a book
本を読む
to read a book
あの人はなかなか本を読んでいる
He is well read―a well-read man.
君はこの本を読んだか
Have you read this book?
君はこの本を持っているか
Have you a copy of this book.
本が間に合うだけあるか
Are there enough copies of the book?
彼はたくさんの本を持っている
He has a large library.
この本は誰でも持っている
The book is in everybody's hands.
本を読みこなす
to digest a book
本を通読する
to read through a book
始めどんな本を読めばよろしいか
What sort of books shall I read in the first place?―What sort of books shall I begin with?
僕のところへ来れば本は読み放題だ
If you come to live with me, you can read as many books as you like―you shall have the run of my library.
僕は読み切れないほど本を持っている
I have more books than I can read.
この本を読んで裨益するところがあった
I have read the book with profit―The book has done me good.
この本は文章が平易で初学者にもわかる
The book is written in such easy English as beginners can understand.
この本を誰かに教わったか
With whom did you read this book?
この本は独りで読んだ
I read this book to myself.
この本を五年級に教えている
I read this book with the fifth-year students.
本さえ読んでいれば飯を食わなくともよい(本は飯より好きだ)
I forget my meals in reading―Books are meat and drink to me.
酒と煙草は養生に害ありと本に書いてある
We read in books that wine and tobacco are injurious to health.
ある本にそう書いてあった
I read it in a certain book.
本を著わす、本を書く
to write a book
本を出す
to bring out a book―publish a book
本が出る
A book comes out.
愛読の本
a favourite author
折り目のついた本
a dog's-eared volume
珍しい本
a rare volume

content: 2. (=本にするの本)book-form

content.content: 本にして出す
to publish in book-form
筆記を集めて本にして出版した
The notes were collected and published in book-form.
講義が本になっている
The lecture are in book-form.

content:
ほん〔本〕
〈接頭詞〉This; the present; the current; the main; the head; the real; genuine; regular; legal; full (etc.)

content.content: 本校
this school

this country
本官
the present official―I
本年
this year―the current year
本協約
the present agreement
本店
the head office
本通り
the main street―the high street
本隊
the main body
本艦隊
the main squadron
本線
the main line―the trunk line
本名
one's real name
本会員
a regular member
本会員の資格
full membership
本妻
a legal wife
本物
a genuine article
本件
the matter in hand―the case before us

content:
ほん〔本〕
〈接尾助数詞〉

content.content: 筆一本
one brush
鉛筆三本
three pencils
白墨五本
five pieces of chalk
ビール六本
six bottles of beer

content:
ぼん〔凡〕
〈形〉Common; ordinary; mediocre:(名詞に用いれば)an ordinary mortal:(総称すれば)the common herd; the common run of men

content.content: 凡を抜く
to rise above the common herd―be raised above the common run of men―to be out of the common

content:
ぼん〔盆〕
〈名〉A tray:(金属のは)a salver

content.content: 盆に載せて出せ
Present it on a tray!
盆を覆すような雨
a downpour
覆水盆に帰らず
“It is no use crying over spilt milk.”

content: 〈固名〉The Feast of Lanterns

content.content: 盆暮、盆と正月(に相当するは)
the four-quarter-days
盆と正月がいっしょに来たよう
We are as busy as if the four quarter-days had come together.

content:
ポン
〈擬音詞〉
1. Pop

content.content: ポンと口を抜く
to draw a cork with a pop
口がポンと抜ける
The cork comes out with a pop.
ポンと背中を叩く
to slap one on the back
ポンと膝を打つ
to slap one's thigh
ポンと財布を投げ出す
to toss one's purse

content:
ほんあん〔翻案〕
〈名〉An adaptation:(=する) to adapt

content.content: これは仏文小説の翻案だ
This is an adaptation of a French novel―This is adapted from a French novel.

content:
ほんい〔本位〕
〈名〉
1. (=標準)a standard

content.content: 本校は生徒本位です
We have the interests of the students at heart―We make it our chief study to satisfy the students.
この字書は熟語本位だ
The dictionary is complied with a view to the explanation of idioms―It is an idiomological dictionary.
弊店は顧客本位をもって主義と致しております
We make it a rule to please our customers before everything.
自己本位
egoism
あの人は自己本位だ
He is an egoist.
国家本位
nationalism

content: 2. (=貨幣本位)the monetary standard

content.content: 本位貨幣
the standard coin
金貨本位、銀貨本位
the gold standard―the silver standard
日本は金貨を本位とす
Japan makes gold the monetary standard.
単本位
a single standard
単本位制
a single-standard system―monometallism
単本位論者
a monometallist
複本位
a double standard
複本位制
a double-standard system―bimetallism
複本位論者
a bimetallist

content:
ほんい〔本意〕
〈名〉One's will; one's intention; one's purpose

content.content: 本意を遂げる
to accomplish one's purpose―effect one's purpose
本意ならずも訴えた
I went to law against my will.
人の値打を落とすなどいうことは決して僕の本意ではない
Nothing can be farther from my intentions than to detract from others' merits.

ほんいつ〔奔逸〕
〈名〉A scud; a scuttle; a scurry; a scamper:(=する) to scud; to scuttle; to scurry; to scamper

content:
ほんえい〔本営〕
〈名〉The headquarters

content.content: 大本営
the Imperial Headquarters

〈名〉The Bon dance (a sort of carnival dance)

content:
ほんか〔本科〕
〈名〉The regular course

content.content: 予科を卒えると本科に入る
When you complete the preparatory course, you enter the regular course.
本科生
a regular student

content:
ほんかい〔本懐〕
〈名〉
1. (=宿望)a cherished desire; a cherished object

content.content: 本懐を遂げる
to obtain one's cherished desire―attain one's cherished object
本懐を遂げぬのは男の恥
It concerns a man's honour to fail in attaining his object.
恥を忍んでも本懐を遂げるのが真性の勇気
He has true courage who can put up with wrong and contumelies to attain the object of his heart.

content: 2. (=満足)satisfaction; gratification

content.content: 事成就して本懐の至り
I am deeply gratified to see the success of my plan.

content:
ほんかいいん〔本会員〕
〈名〉A regular member

content.content: 本会員の資格
full membership

ほんかいどう〔本街道〕
〈名〉A main road; a trunk-road

content:
ほんかん〔本官〕
〈名〉
1. (=雇に対し)a permanent office; a substantive appointment

content.content: 本官になる
to be appointed to a permanent office

content: 2. (=現官職)one's present office

content.content: 本官を免ぜらる
to be relieved of one's office

content: 〈代名詞〉The present official; I (used by an official)

ほんかん〔本管〕
〈名〉A main

content.content: 送水本管
a water-main

content:
ほんがん〔本願〕
〈名〉A cherished desire

content.content: 本願を立てる
to cherish a desire

My wishes are fulfilled.

ぼんがん〔凡眼〕
〈名〉An unprofessional eye

content:
ほんき〔本気〕
〈名〉
1. (=真面目)earnest; seriousness

content.content: 彼は本気でそんなことを言うはずは無い
He can not have said so in earnest.
冗談に言ったことを本気に取ったのだ
What I said in fun, was taken seriously.
本気になればできるよ
If I set about it in earnest, I shall be able to do it.
相手は本気だから油断はできぬ
The other party means business, so we must be on our guard.

content: 2. (=正気)one's right mind; sanity

content.content: 本気の沙汰でない
He can not be in his right mind―in his senses.

content:
ほんぎ〔本義〕
〈名〉The true meaning; the first principles

content.content: そのような政策は憲政の本義に反する
Such a policy is contrary to the principles of constitutional government.

content:
ほんきちがい〔本気違い〕
〈名〉
1. (=本当の気違い)raving madness; stark madness

content.content: 彼は本気違いだ
He is raving mad―raging mad―stark mad.

content: 2. (=書狂)bibliomania:(人)a bibliomaniac

ほんぎゃく〔叛逆〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: はんぎゃく〔叛逆〕

ほんきゅう〔本給〕
〈名〉Full pay

content:
ほんきょ〔本拠〕
〈名〉One's headquarters; one's stronghold; one's base of operations

content.content: 君は本拠はどこだ
Where is your headquarters?
英国は自由の本拠である
England is the stronghold of liberty.
彼は新聞を本拠にかまえて政界に活動した
Making a newspaper his base of operations, he took an active part in politics.

content:
ほんぎょう〔本業〕
〈名〉One's principal occupation; one's business

content.content: 本業を勉める、本業を守る
to attend to one's business
各自本業を守るべし
Let each man attend to his business―“Let the cobbler stick to his last”
彼は穴探しを本業としている
He makes it his business to find faults in others.

ほんきょく〔本局〕
〈名〉The main office:(電話のは)central

ぼんくら〔凡くら〕
〈名〉A blockhead; a dolt:(形容詞に用いれば)good-for-nothing

content:
ぼんくれ〔盆暮〕
〈名〉The “Bon” Festival and the year-end:(に相当するは)the four quarter-days

content.content: 我が国では盆暮には贈答品をやりとりする慣例になっている
It is the custom in Japan to exchange presents at the “Bon” Festival and the year-end.

ほんけ〔本家〕
〈名〉
1. (=宗家)the head family; the main stock
2. (=製造元)the original manufacturer (of a patent medicine, etc.)

ほんけがえり〔本卦返り〕
〈名〉Completing a cycle (of sixty years); the sixty-first anniversary of one's birth; the grand climacteric

〈名〉The original home (of anything):(人なら)the first originator (of anything)

content.content: 英国が自由の本家本元だ
England is the original home of liberty.
欧州大戦の本家本元はカイザーであった
The Kaiser was the first originator of the Great War.

ほんけん〔本件〕
〈名〉The matter in hand; the case before one

content:
ほんげん〔本源〕
〈名〉The origin; the source; the fountain

content.content: 事物の本源を究める
to study the origin of things
本源に溯る
to retrace the source
本源に溯って習慣の由来を尋ねる
to trace a custom to its source

The Crown is the fountain if honour.
信用の本源をからす
to poison the fountain of trust

content.content: 翻刻を許さず

a reprint

content.content: 本国へ帰る
to go home
大使は昨日本国へ向け出発せり
The ambassador left for home yesterday.
植民地は本国をしのぐ勢いだ
The colony nearly outstrips her home-country.
本国政府
the home government
本国語
one's mother tongue

ほんこん〔香港<ホンコン>〕
〈固名〉Hongkong

content.content: 本妻に直すがよい
You ought to make an honest woman of her.

content:

〈名〉A mediocre genius; a mediocrity

content.content: 凡才無くば秀才無からん
Were there no mediocrities, there would be no geniuses.

content:
ぼんさい〔盆栽〕
〈名〉A dwarf-tree; a potted plant

content.content: 盆栽は木ぶりを賞す
A dwarf-tree is prized for its grace.

ぼんさい〔梵妻〕
〈名〉A Buddhist priest's wife

ほんざん〔本山〕
〈名〉The head-temple (of a sect)

ほんざんする〔奔竄する〕
〈自動〉To run away; to fly and hide

content:
ほんし〔本旨〕
〈名〉The main object; the true aim

content.content: これが教育の本旨である
This is the true aim of education.
教育の本旨を誤る
to mistake the aim of education
本会は英語を練習するを本旨とす
The object of the society shall be to practise speaking English.

content:
ほんし〔本紙〕
〈名〉These columns

content.content: 本紙に既載の如く
as has been noticed in these columns

yesterday's issue of the paper

〈名〉A Chinese character (as opposed to a Japanese syllabary)

ぼんじ〔梵字〕
〈名〉A Sanscrit character

content:
ほんしき〔本式〕
〈形〉Regular; formal; square; business-like:(=に) regularly; formally; squarely; in a business-like way; in style

content.content: これこそ本式の海岸の別荘だ
This is a regular “cottage by the sea”.
君のやり方は自ら順序が立っていて本式だ
You method of procedure is business-like―You go about it in a business-like way.
どうせやるなら本式にやろうじゃないか
Let us do the thing in style if we do it at all.
詩を本式に読むのを聞きたいものだ
I should like to hear an English poem read in style.
本式に食事をすることがめったに無い
I seldom make a square meal.
本式に申し込む
to make a formal application

content:
ほんじつ〔本日〕
〈名、副〉This day; today

content.content: 外国行郵便物本日締切り
The foreign mail closes today.
本日休業
Closed today―Closed for the day.

〈名〉
1. (=分社に対し)the head office; the main office
2. (=この社)our firm; we

content:
ほんしょ〔本書〕
〈名〉
1. (副書に対し)the original; the text:(写しに対し)the script

content.content: 本書と副書
original and duplicate

content: 2. (=この本)the present volume; these pages

ほんしょう〔本性〕
〈名〉
1. (=ほんせい)one's true character

content.content: (悪党の)本性を現す
to show one's true colours―come out in one's true colours―throw off the mask
悪魔の本性を現す
to show the cloven hoof―betray the cloven foot―show one's horns―shoot one's horns
酔って本性を現す(生酔本性違わす)
“The heart is seen in wine”―“There is truth in wine”―“Wine reveals the true man”―“The true man comes out in drink.”

content: 2. (=正気)one's senses; one's wits

content.content: 本性を失う
to lose one's senses
あまりびっくりして本性を失った
I was frightened out of my wits.

content:
ほんしょく〔本職〕
〈名〉
1. (=本業)(one's)business, profession

content.content: 彼は本職は医者だ
He is a physician by profession.
本職よりも文士としての方が偉い
He is a better writer than physician.
彼は(身に相応した)本職を得た
He has found his place―found his proper sphere of activity.
君のやり方は自ら順序が立っていて本職らしい
Your method of procedure is business-like―You go about it in a business-like way.

content: 2. (=本職の人)a professional

content.content: この手際なら本職もはだしだ
The performance would shame a professional―put a professional to the blush.

content:
ほんしょく〔本色〕
〈名〉One's real character; a characteristic

content.content: 本色を顕わす
to show one's real character―show one's true colours
この一言にその人の本色が現れている(いかにも言いそうなことだ)
The remark is characteristic of the man―It is just like him to say so.

content:
ほんしん〔本心〕
〈名〉One's right mind; one's better feelings; one's heart; one's senses; oneself

content.content: 本心に立返る
to come to one's senses―One's better feelings return
本心に立返ると己が行為を悔いた
When my better feelings returned, I repented of my action.
失敗して本心に立返った(悪夢が覚めた)
Failure brought me to my senses.
本心を失う
to lose one's mind―to be beside oneself
彼は嬉しがって本心を失っている
He is beside himself with joy.
彼は滅亡が眼前に迫らなけりゃ本心にならない
He is not himself until ruin stares him in the face.
彼が本心の時によく話しておこう
I will talk seriously to him when he is himself―when he is in his right mind.
本心から言うのだ
I speak from my heart.
酒は本心を表わす
“The heart is seen in wine”―“There is truth in wine”―“Wine reveals the true man”―“The true man comes out in drink.”

ほんじん〔本陣〕
〈名〉
1. (=本営)the headquarters
2. (=往時の大名の旅館)the chief hotel (of a post-town)

content:
ぼんじん〔凡人〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ぼんにん〔凡人〕

content:
ほんせい〔本性〕
〈名〉The original nature (of man, etc.)

content.content: 人の本性は善である
Man is born good.

content:
ほんせき〔本籍〕
〈名〉One's domicile

content.content: 僕の本籍は仙台にある
I am domiciled in Sendai.

ほんせん〔本線〕
〈名〉The main line; the trunk-line

content:
ほんせん〔本船〕
〈名〉
1. (=短艇に対し)the ship

content.content: 本船を乗り捨てて短艇に乗り移った
They abandoned the ship to her fate, and took to the boats.

content: 2. (=この船)our ship; we

content.content: 本船は香港に寄港してしかる後日本に赴く
We touch at Hongkong, and then proceed to Japan.

ほんぜん〔本膳〕
〈名〉A full-coursed dinner; a square meal

content:
ほんぜん〔翻然〕
〈副〉Suddenly

content.content: 翻然悔悟す
He suddenly repented of his past.

content:
ほんぞう〔本草〕
〈名〉Plants; herbs

content.content: 本草学
botany―herbal
本草学者
a botanist―a herbalist

content:
ほんそうする〔奔走する〕
〈自他動〉To bustle about; to busy oneself about, be busy about (something); to move, stir, bestir oneself (in a matter); to be on the move, on the go, on the run, on the rush, on the jump; to interest oneself in (some matter)

content.content: 君は何に奔走しているのか
What are you busy about?―What do you busy yourself about?
彼はかの件について奔走している
He is moving in the matter―stirring in the matter―bestirring himself in the matter.
彼は有力者間を奔走している
He is moving actively among people of influence.
彼は僕の一身上について奔走してくれた
He interested himself in my welfare.
国事に奔走する
to interest oneself in the affairs of state
名利に奔走する
to toil for wealth or fame―woo fame or fortune
衣食に奔走する
to work for one's bread
あの人は始終何かに奔走している
He is constantly bustling about―on the move―on the go―on the run―on the rush―on the jump.
彼は奔走家だ
He is a bustling man―He will not let the grass grow under his feet.

content:
ぼんぞく〔凡俗〕
〈名〉
1. (=僧侶に対し)a layman:(集合的に言えば)the laity:(=の) lay; secular; temporal; profane

content.content: 凡俗の説教
a lay sermon
凡俗の事務
temporal affairs
凡俗の文学
secular literature―profane literature

content: 2. (=世の凡俗)the vulgar crowd; the common herd

content.content: 凡俗に伍せず
He stands aloof from the crowd.
凡俗を脱している
He is raised above the crowd―exalted above the herd.

content:
ほんぞん〔本尊〕
〈名〉
1. (=寺に主として祭られたる仏)the principal image, the chief object of worship, the central figure (in a temple)
2. (=崇拝される人物)an object of adoration; an idol

content.content: 彼はその党の本尊として崇められている
He is idolized by the party.

content:
ほんたい〔本体〕
〈名〉Substance; essence; entity; noumenon; the thing in itself

content.content: 本体論、本体学
ontology

ほんたい〔本隊〕
〈名〉The main body (of an army):(両翼に対し)the centre

content:
ほんだい〔本題〕
〈名〉The subject under consideration

content.content: 本題を離れる
to digress from the subject―wander from the point
本題を離れないで
Keep to the point!
本題に帰って
To return to our subject.

ほんたく〔本宅〕
〈名〉One's principal residence

ほんだわら〔馬尾藻〕

ぽんちえ〔ポンチ絵〕
〈名〉(人物なら)a caricature:(時事のなら)a cartoon

〈名〉
1. (=我が国の朝廷)our Imperial Court
2. (=我が国)our country

ほんちょうし〔本調子〕
〈名〉The normal key (of the samisen)

ほんて〔本手〕
〈名〉The regular trick

content:
ほんてん〔本店〕
〈名〉The head office; the main office

content.content: 本店と支店
main and branch

ぼんてん〔梵天〕
〈固名〉(=梵天王)Brahma

content:
ほんど〔本土〕
〈名〉The main land; the country proper

content.content: 支那本土
China proper.

content:
ポンド
〈名〉
1. (=通貨単位、磅)a pound(￡―と略す)

content.content: 五ポンド

content: 52. (=重量単位、封度)a pound(lb.―と略す)

content.content: 五ポンド
5 lb.

content:
ほんとう〔奔騰〕
〈名〉A sudden rise (in price); a jump; a boom:(=する) to rise suddenly; to jump; to boom; to soar

content.content: 相場が奔騰暴落する
The price jumps and slumps―fluctuates violently―runs up and down the gamut.
物価は天井しらずに奔騰する
The prices soar.

content:
ほんとう〔本当〕
〈形〉
1. True; real; proper; right; genuine; veritable:(=に) truly; really; properly; indeed; in truth

content.content: そりゃ本当か
Is that true?
本当かしら
Can it be true?―I wonder if it can be true.
本当かウソかわからない
I can't not tell whether it is true or false.
本当でもウソでも我々には関係の無いことだ
Whether it be true or false,―Be it true or false,―it does not concern us.
本当か、そりゃ結構だ
Really!―Indeed!―I am glad of it.
本当に面白かった
We had a really good time.
ありゃ本当の兄弟じゃない
They are not true brothers.
この刀は本当の正宗だ
This sword is a genuine Masamune.
それが本当のやり方だ
This is the proper way to do it.
本当の時間は何時か
What is the right time?
造花は本当の花と見分けがつかぬ
You can not tell the artificial flowers from natural ones.
これこそ本当の賜物だ
This is a veritable boon.
本当は僕が後を取るのだ
By rights, I ought to be heir.
(彼を英文家だと言うが)本当は英文などは書いたことが無い
In reality,―In point of fact,―he never penned a line of English.
本当を言えば日本人は黄色人種ではない
Properly speaking,―Strictly speaking,―the Japanese do not belong to the yellow race.
僕の言うことは大丈夫本当だ
You may depend upon the truth of my statement―depend upon it.
これは誓って本当だ
I can affirm it to be true.
彼はその説は誓って本当だと言った
He solemnly affirmed the statement to be true.
(冗談は冗談として)本当にどうするつもりか
Really and truly,―Honestly and frankly,―Indeed and indeed,―what do you mean to do?
本当らしい話
a likely story
その話は本当らしい
The story has some colour of truth.
その話が本当らしくみえる事情がある
Circumstances give colour to the story.
本当らしいウソ
a specious lie
ウソから出た本当
Truth comes out of falsehood.
人の話を本当にする
to believe a story
僕は彼の言うことを本当にしない
I do not believe him.
そんな話を誰が本当にするものか
Who will believe such a story?―“Tell it to the horse-marines!”
(そんなうまいことを言うと)ばかな者は本当にしますよ
One would take you at your word.

ほんどう〔本堂〕
〈名〉The main temple

content:
ほんどう〔本道〕
〈名〉The main road; the highroad; the highway

content.content: その村は本道か
Is the village on the main road?
本道から少し入ったところです
It is a little way off the main road.

content:
ほんとおり〔本通り〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ほんどおり〔本通り〕

ほんどおり〔本通り〕
〈名〉The main street; the high street

ほんに〔本に〕
〈副〉Truly; really; indeed; in truth

content:
ほんにん〔本人〕
〈名〉The person himself (or herself); the principal party; the chief party; the party concerned:(代人に対しては)the principal:(写真などに本人は)the original:(=の) personal

content.content: 僕は本人に会った
I have seen the man (himself).
本人の来談
Apply in person―Personal application is required.
そんなことをさせておいては本人の不為だ
Such conduct is against his own interests.
本人が来ないので拍子抜けがした
The absence of the chief party disappointed us.
入費は本人の負担たるべし
The party concerned shall bear the expenses.
本人から聞いた話だから確かだ
I have the news at first hand.
あの人の人真似は本人そっくりそのままだ
He mimics people to a hair.
本人出頭するかまたは相当の代人をつかわすべし
The principal or a suitable proxy shall attend.
本人さしつかえの場合は代人にても苦しからず
If the principal can not attend, he may send a proxy.
保証人は本人の負債を返済するの義務がある
The surety is liable for the debt of the principal.
この写真より本人の方が好い
The photo does not do justice to the original.

content:
ぼんにん〔凡人〕
〈名〉An ordinary mortal; a mediocrity:(総称すれば)everyday people; the common run of men

content.content: 凡人無くば偉人無からん
Were there no ordinary mortals, there would be no great men.
彼は凡人でないことは一見してわかる
You can see at a glance that he is no common being.
彼は非凡の凡人だ
He is a rare mediocrity.

content:
ほんね〔本音〕
〈名〉One's true tone

content.content: 本音を吐く
to show one's true colours

content:
ほんねん〔本年〕
〈名、副〉This year; the current year

content.content: 本年度の予算
the budget for the current year

content:
ほんの〔本の〕
〈形〉Mere:(副詞に訳せば)merely; only; but; just

content.content: まだほんの子どもです
He is a mere child―only a child.
ほんの間に合わせだ
It is a mere makeshift.
これはほんのお礼の印しばかりでございます
It is a mere token of my gratitude―a slight token of my gratitude.
学者とはほんの名ばかり
He is a scholar only in name―but in name.
ほんの少し
just a little bit
収益から入費を引去ると余すところはほんの少々だ
When the expenses are deduced from the profits, there is only a very little left.

content:
ほんのう〔本能〕
〈名〉Instinct

content.content: 理性は誤ることあるも本能は誤ること無し
Reason may err, but instinct never errs.
動物は本能によって繁殖する
Animals multiply by instinct.
本能的
instinctive
本能的に
instinctively

content:
ぼんのう〔煩悩〕
〈名〉The worldly passions

content.content: (難行苦行をして)煩悩を去る
to mortify the passions―mortify the flesh
煩悩の犬追えども去らず
The passions are hard of control.
煩悩の犬に追わる
to be impelled by passion
彼は子煩悩だ
He dotes on his children.

ぼんのくぼ〔盆の窪〕
〈名〉The nape of the neck; the scruff of the neck

content:
ほんのり〔仄り〕
〈副〉Faintly; slightly

content.content: 顔はほんのりと桜色
His face is slightly flushed with wine.
(彼女は恥ずかしくて)ほんのりと顔を赤らめた
She blushed slightly.

content:
ほんば〔本場〕
〈名〉The place; the best place (for any product); the home, the habitat (of an animal or a plant); the centre (of civilization, etc.):(=の) the best; native

content.content: 越後は雪の本場だ
Echigo is the place for snow.
川越は芋の本場だ
Kawagoe is the best place for sweet potatoes.
この芋は本場だ、本場でない
There are the best potatoes―not the best potatoes.
インドは虎の本場だ
India is the home of the tiger.
英国は代議政体の本場だ
England is the home of the representative government.
パリは流行の本場だ
Paris is the centre of fashion.
本場のカキ
native oysters
本場を踏む
to go through the mill

content:
ほんばしょ〔本場所〕
〈名〉(=相撲の本場所)the Annual Matches

content.content: あの相撲は本場所で土つかずだ
He left a clean record at the Annual Matches.

content:
ほんばら〔本腹〕
〈名〉Legitimacy

content.content: 本腹の子
a legitimate child
本腹の兄弟
full brothers―full sisters―full brother and sister

content:
ぽんびき〔ポン引き〕
〈名〉A confidence man; a sharper; a shark

content.content: ポン引きにかかる
to fall a victim to a confidence trick

content:
ほんぶ〔本部〕
〈名〉
1. (=主部)the head-office; the headquarters

content.content: 本部を東京に置く
The head-office is quartered in Tokyo.
政党本部
the party's headquarters
参謀本部
the General Staff Office

content: 2. (=本土)the country proper

content.content: 支那本部
China proper.

content:
ぼんぶ〔凡夫〕
〈名〉An ordinary mortal; a mediocrity:(総称すれば)everyday people

content.content: 凡夫の浅ましさ、彼女を諦められぬ
But an ordinary mortal, I can not have done with her.
まして凡夫の我々は
How much more so with us ordinary mortals!
凡夫盛りに神崇り無し
“The gods have no power over a man in his prime.”

content:
ぽんぷ〔喞筒<ポンプ>〕
〈名〉A pump

content.content: ポンプで水を汲む
to pump up water
ポンプで水をかえ出す
to pump out the water
ポンプで井を汲み干す
to pump a well dry
ポンプでタイヤに空気を入れる
to pump up a tire
消化ポンプ
a fire-engine
蒸気ポンプ
a steam-pump―a steam fire-engine
汲上ポンプ
a suction-pump
押上ポンプ
a force-pump

content:
ぽんぷ〔喞筒<ポンプ>〕
〈名〉A pump

content.content: ポンプで水を汲む
to pump up water
ポンプで水をかえ出す
to pump out the water
ポンプで井を汲み干す
to pump a well dry
ポンプでタイヤに空気を入れる
to pump up a tire
消化ポンプ
a fire-engine
蒸気ポンプ
a steam-pump―a steam fire-engine
汲上ポンプ
a suction-pump
押上ポンプ
a force-pump

content:
ほんぷく〔本復〕
〈名〉Recovery:(=する) to recover (from one's illness); to be restored to health; to get well

content.content: 病人は佐藤博士の治療で本復した
The invalid recovered under the treatment of Dr. Sato.

content:
ほんぶり〔本降り〕
〈名〉A regular rainfall

content.content: 雨はいよいよ本降りになったね
The rain has set in in earnest―It is a regular downpour.

content:
ほんぶん〔本分〕
〈名〉(One's) duty, part

content.content: 本分を尽す
to do one's duty―do one's part―acquit oneself
人は何と言おうとも僕は尽すべき本分を尽す
Whatever others may say, I will do my duty.
後先にかまわず本分を尽せ
Do your duty, irrespective of the consequences.
本分を尽しておけば世間に対してはばかるところは無い
If I do my duty, I can look the world in the face.
男らしく本分を尽そうではないか
Let us acquit ourselves like men―quit us like men.
軍人は忠節を本分とすべし
Loyalty should be the chief duty of a soldier
政治家の本分は国利民福を図るにあり
It is the duty of the politician to look to the interests of the State and the welfare of the people.
各自本分を守るべし
Let each man do his part―Let each man shine in his own sphere―“Let the cobbler stick to his last.”

ほんぽう〔本邦〕
〈名〉This country; our country

content:
ポンポン
〈名〉(Nursery Japanese for) the belly; tummy

content.content: ポンポンが痛い
My tummy hurts.

content:
ポンポン
〈擬音詞〉
1. Pom! pom!

content.content: 花火がポンポン上がる
Pom! pom! go the fireworks.
あの娘はポンポン言う
She will snap at you.
あの人はポンポン言う
He talks without the least reserve.
ポンポン言い返す
to talk back to one's face

content:
ほんまつ〔本末〕
〈名〉Cause and effect; root and branch; essentials and unessentials; the means and the end; the substance and the shadow

content.content: 本末を誤る
to mistake the means for the end―take the shadow for the substance―confound the essentials with the unessentials

ほんまる〔本丸〕
〈名〉The inner citadel, the inner keep (of a castle)

ほんみょう〔本名〕
〈名〉One's true name; one's real name

content:
ほんむ〔本務〕
〈名〉
1. (=道徳上の本務)duty
2. (=本業)one's business

content.content: まず本務を努めよ
Attend to your business first.

content:
ほんめい〔奔命〕
〈名〉Bustling about

content.content: 奔命につかれる
to bustle oneself weary

content:
ほんもう〔本望〕
〈名〉
1. (=宿望)a cherished desire; a cherished object

content.content: 本望を遂げる
to attain one's object―obtain one's desire―realize the desire of one's heart―reach the goal of one's ambition

content: 2. (=満足)satisfaction; gratification

content.content: 貴方に殺されりゃ本望ですわ
I shall be happy to die by your hand.

content:
ほんもの〔本物〕
〈名〉A genuine article:(=の) genuine

content.content: 本物だと言って偽物を売りつけられた
A false article was foisted upon me as genuine.
本物か偽物か一見してわかる
You can tell at a glance whether it is genuine or false.
この品は請合って本物です
The article is warranted genuine―I will answer for the genuineness of the article.
鑑定家が本物と鑑定した
A connoisseur has pronounced it genuine.
あの男は本物らしい
He rings true―He has the true ring.
いかさま物をごまかして本物に見せる
to fake up a questionable article

content:
ほんもん〔本文〕
〈名〉
1. (=主文)the text; the body (of a letter)

content.content: 本文不明の箇所あり
There are some obscure passages in the text.

content: 2. (=この文)these presents

content.content: 本文により(何の何々なる事を証明す)
Know all men by these presents that...

content:
ほんもんだい〔本問題〕
〈名〉The subject under consideration

content.content: 本問題に立返ります
To return to our subject.

content:
ほんや〔本屋〕
〈名〉A bookseller's:(英国にては) a bookshop:(米国にては)a bookstore

content.content: この本はどこの本屋にもある
The book is to be had at any bookseller's.

content:
ほんやく〔翻訳〕
〈名〉Translation; a version:(=する) to translate (from English into Japanese); to render, do (an English phrase into Japanese); to put it in (English); to decipher (a cipher telegram)

content.content: 英文を邦文に翻訳する
to translate (from) English into Japanese
それを英語に翻訳するとどうなるか
How do you render it into English?―put it in English?―English it?
この小説は仏文の翻訳だ
This novel is translated from the French―a translation from the French.
この本は五六カ国の語に翻訳になっている
This book has been translated into several languages.
翻訳を原文と比較してみた
I have compared the translation with the original.
どんな好い翻訳でも多少は原文と違うものだ
The best translation will vary more or less from the original.
その語は猥褻で翻訳ができない
The word does not bear translation.
彼は翻訳が上手だ
He is good at translation―a good translator.
翻訳を誤る
to mistranslate
翻訳違い
a mistranslation
乱暴な翻訳
a loose translation
暗号電報を翻訳する
to decipher a cipher telegram
翻訳者
the translator
翻訳官
a secretary-translator
翻訳課
the section of translations

content:
ぼんやりした
〈形〉
1. (=遅鈍)dull, dull-witted, dense, stupid (person)

content.content: 田舎者はぼんやりしている
Country-people are dull-witted.
あの男は少しぼんやりしている
He is rather dull of comprehension―rather dense.
いつもぼんやりしている
He has not his wits about him.
ぼんやり者だ
He is a stupid fellow―a dunce―a dullard.

content: 2. (=茫然)absent-minded (person); stupid (face); blank (look); vacant (stare); listless (air); abstracted (air)

content.content: 彼はぼんやりして突立っている
He stands staring―with a vacant stare―with a blank look.
ぼんやりするな
Don't stand staring (like a gawk)!―Look alive!
ぼんやりした顔をして人を眺める
He will stare at you with a stupid look.
ぼんやりした風をして人を眺める
He will stare at you with an absent-minded air―with an abstracted air.
何をぼんやり眺めているか
What are you staring at?
彼は机に向かってぼんやり考え込んでいる
He sits at his desk in a brown study.
何をぼんやり考えているか
“A penny for your thoughts!”
(大事な人に死なれて)皆ぼんやりしてしまっている
They are stupefied with grief.
一日ぼんやりして暮らす
to mope one's time away―mope all day
一日ぼんやりして当ても無く歩いている
He walks about listlessly―maunders about―moons about―all day.
ついぼんやりしておった
I had forgotten all about it.

content: 3. (=朦朧)dim, glimmering (light); dull, faint, watery (colour); dim, obscure, dreamy (view); dim, vague, confused, hazy, misty, nebulous (idea or memory); obscure, cloudy, indeterminate (meaning); dim, indistinct (impression); dim, blurred (image); vague, indefinable, indefinite (aim or object); neutral (tints)

content.content: ぼんやりした明かり
a dim light―a glimmering light
島が霞の中にぼんやり見える
An island shows dimly―looms―through the haze.
月が雲の蔭にぼんやり光っている
The moon glimmers through the clouds.
人の姿が写真にぼんやり映っている
The figure is dimly impressed―faintly imaged―blurred―on the photograph.
ぼんやり言う(暗にほのめかす)
to hint obscurely
ぼんやりわかる
to form a vague idea of anything
ぼんやり覚えている
I have a dim remembrance―a vague recollection―of it.
彼はぼんやりした考えで洋行したのだ
He went abroad without any definite plan―with no definite idea.
ここの意味がぼんやりしている
The meaning is obscure.

content:
ぼんよう〔凡庸〕
〈名〉Mediocrity; banality:(=の) mediocre, middling (talent); banal, indifferent (works); commonplace, hackneyed, trite, banal (expression); commonplace, flat (features); common, everyday (occurrence); humdrum, jog-trot (life or existence)

content.content: 才は凡庸
His talents are mediocre―nothing out of the common.
たいていの人は凡庸に終る
Most men end in mediocrity.
説を立てれば凡庸の説
His opinions are platitudes.
凡庸の説を吐くならばむしろ黙するにしかず
Better say nothing than utter platitudes.

ほんよみ〔本読み〕
〈名〉(=芝居の本読み)Reading a play; a rehearsal

content:
ほんらい〔本来〕
〈副〉Originally; primarily; essentially; intrinsically; in itself:(=の) original; primary; essential; intrinsic

content.content: これがこの語の本来の意義である
This is the original meaning of the word.
電気と磁気は本来同一の物である
Electricity and magnetism are essentially the same thing.
金剛石は本来価値無き物である
Diamond is of no intrinsic value.
本来善いものも用い方によっては有害になる
A thing good in itself may become bad by its use.

content:
ほんりょう〔本領〕
〈名〉
1. (=大名の領地)a daimyo's domains
2. (=本分)(one's) duty, province, function

content.content: 君の馬前に死すのが武士の本領である
It is the duty of the samurai to die in battle for his lord.
法律を解釈応用するのが判官の本領である
It is the duty of the judge―the province of the judge―to interpret and apply the laws.
強きをくじき弱きを助けるのが侠客の本領である
It is the function of chivalry―the spirit of chivalry―to fight for the oppressed against the oppressor.

content: 3. (=特色)a special character; a characteristic

content.content: 本領を発揮する
to exhibit one's characteristics

ほんるい〔本塁〕
〈名〉
1. (=根拠地)the base
2. (=野球の本塁)the home base

content:
ほんろうする〔翻弄する〕
〈他動〉To trifle with, play with, sport with, play fast and loose with (a girl's feelings); to fool, make a fool of, flirt with, coquette with (a man); to flirt with (a party); to play on (one's feelings); to toss about (a ship)

content.content: 男が女を翻弄する
A man trifles with a female heart―trifles with a girl's feelings―plays fast and loose with a girl's feelings.
私は男に翻弄されました
My feelings have been trifled with.
女が男を翻弄する
A woman makes a fool of a man―flirts with a man―coquettes with a man.
僕は女に翻弄された
I have been made a fool of.
あくまで男を翻弄する
to fool a man to the top of his bent
先方は誠意を欠いて我々を翻弄しているのだ
He is trifling with us―flirting with us―playing fast and loose with us.
人の感情を翻弄するものでない
You should not play on a man's feelings.
船は波濤のために木の葉のように翻弄された
The ship was tossed about by the sea.

content:
ほんろん〔本論〕
〈名〉The main discourse; the main issue

content.content: これより本論に入ります
We now proceed to the main issue.

content:
ま〔間〕
〈名〉
1. (=室)a room; an apartment

content.content: 奥の間がある
There is an inner room.
間を貸す
to let apartments
貸間有り
Apartment to let.
間を借りる
to hire a room―rent a room
この間を借りました
I have taken this room.
間代
room-rent
間代はいくら取るか
What do they charge for the room?
間代をいくら払うか(間代はいくらか)
What do you pay for your room?
間ごと間ごとに床の間と押入れが付いている
Each room has its alcove and its press.
三間か四間の家が欲しい
I want a three- or four-roomed house.
六間の二階立ての家がある
There is a six-roomed, two-storied house.

content: 2. (=暇、合間)time; while; interval

content.content: 用意する間が無かった
I had no time for preparation.
もうそうしている間が無い
We have no time to do so.
飯を食う間も無い
I have no time to eat.
忙しくて飯を食う間も無い
I am too busy to eat.
試験までにはまだ間がある
We have some time before the examination.
汽車が出るまでにはまだ間がある
It will be some time before the train leaves.
汽車が出るまでにはもう間が無い
It will not be long before the train leaves.
全快するにはまだ間がある
It will be some time before I am well.
次の汽車が出るまでにはまだたくさん間がある
We have plenty of time before the next train leaves―It will be a long while before the next train leaves.
試験にはもう間がない
We are near the examination―We are within a few days of the examination―The examination is close at hand.
日没にはもう間が無い
We are near sunset―We are not long from sunset―Sunset is near.→『まもなく〔間もなく〕』
(何々する)間に
while―when...
彼は留守の間に来た
He called while I was out―when I was out.
(何々せぬ)間に
before...
鬼の来ぬ間に洗濯
The washing must be done before the ogre comes―(に相当するは)―“When the cat is away, the mice will play.”
彼は仕事の間に読書する
He reads in the intervals of business.
瞬く間に
in a twinkling―in the twinkling of an eye
手術は瞬きする間にすむ
The operation is over in a twinkling.
あっという間に歯が抜けている
The tooth is off before you can say Jack Robinson.
いつの間にか、知らぬ間に
before we know (where we are)
いつの間にか用意ができていた
All was ready before we knew where we were.
知らぬ間に飛んで行った
The bird flew away before I knew.
間を見て行って来よう
I will go when I have time.
この間に行って来よう
I will go now that I have time.
この子はいたずらでちょっとの間も目が離されない
I can not take my eyes off this child for a moment.(何に)間に合う→『まにあう〔間に合う〕』

content: 3. (=隙間)space; gap

content.content: 間をふさぐ
to stop the gap
柱と柱との間をふさぐ
to fill the spaces between the posts
机と机との間を明ける
to leave spaces between the desks

content: 4. (=用)business; purpose→『

content.content: まにあう〔間に合う〕
まにあわせ〔間に合わせ〕
まにあわせる〔間に合わせる〕
お間を欠かせてすみませんでした
I am sorry to have failed you in need.

content: 5. (=運)luck

content.content: 間が好い、間が悪い
to be lucky―unlucky
なんて間が好いんでしょう
How luck!―What a stroke of luck!
間が好ければ千円も儲かることがある
One may make a thousand yen if one is lucky.
間が好くちょうどに便船があった
By good luck,―As good luck would have it,―I found a ship about to sail.
間が悪くその日に限って便船が出なかった
By ill luck,―As ill luck would have it,―the daily steamer did not sail on that particular day.
間が悪い
to be put out of countenance―embarrassed―confused―abashed
あまり顔を見られて間が悪かった
I was stared out of countenance.
ずいぶん間が悪かった
I was very much embarrassed.
そう聞かれて間が悪かった
I was embarrassed by the question―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The question embarrassed me.
彼は間の悪そうなふうをしている
He is embarrassed in manner.
あの人はどんなことがあっても間が悪いなんということが無い
Nothing can abash him.
人中で間の悪い思いをした
I looked foolish in company.

It is very stupid of you to do such a thing―How stupid of you to do such a thing!

ここに金がまあ千円あると仮定し給え

まあそんなものさ

content: 〈驚嘆の間投詞〉Oh!; La!; Good gracious!; Goodness gracious me!; Good God!; Good Heavens!

content: 〈場所の前置詞相当〉Before (one); in front of (a place); in the presence of (a person)

content.content: 日本の給仕人は前に坐る

家の前に庭がある

門の前に橋がある

前に川を控えてなかなか風流な家だ

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 目の前であったことだ
It happened under my eyes―under my very nose.
前で賞める者に限って陰で誹る
One who praises you to your face is sure to speak ill of you behind your back.
家の前を通る、門の前を通る
to pass a house―pass a door
毎日お宅の前を通ります
I pass your house―pass your door―every day.
彼は僕の見ている前で僕の弟を打った

僕の聞いている前でそう言った
He said so in my hearing.

content: 〈時の副詞、前置詞、接続詞相当〉(副詞に訳せば)before; formerly; (so long) ago, since, back:(前置詞に訳せば)before (that time); ere (now); (ten minutes) to (twelve); previous to (some action); prior to (some action or event); anterior to (some event):(接続詞に訳せば)before (the sun rises); ere (he comes):(=の) (the day) before; previous (day); last (Sunday); late (governor); former (principal, etc.)

content.content: あなたには前にお目にかかったことがある
I have met you before.
三年前にお逢い申した
I met you three years ago―three years since―three years back.
その人には前に逢ったことがあった
I had met him before.
それより三年前に逢ったのであった
I had met him three years before―three years since―three years back.
それは二三日前の出来事だ
It happened a few days ago―a few days since.
久しい前の出来事だ
It happened a long time ago―a long while since.
浅草辺は前は海であった
The neighbourhood of Asakusa formerly formed a part of the sea.
宴会の前に式がある
There is a function before the banquet―A function precedes the banquet.
暗くなる前に
(接続詞に訳せば)before it gets dark―(前置詞に訳せば)―before dark
暗くなる前に行き着けるだろうか
Shall we get there before dark?
夜明け前にたった
I started before daybreak―before daylight.
十二時前に着いた
I arrived before twelve.
十二時十五分前に着いた
I arrived at a quarter to twelve.
今十二時前だ
It is before twelve―not yet twelve.
今十二時十分前だ
It is ten minutes to twelve―It wants ten minutes to twelve―It lacks ten minutes of twelve.
ご到着になる前に家を掃除させておきます
I will have the house cleaned before you arrive―before your arrival―previous to your arrival.
たっ前にその人に会っておこう
I will see the man before I leave―before my departure―prior to my departure.
それは維新より前の出来事だ
The event was anterior to the Restoration.
この前
last time
この前どこまで読みましたか
Where did we leave off last time?
彼にこの前逢った時は無事でおった
The last time I met him, he was all right.
前の日曜に行った
I was there last Sunday―on Sunday last.
彼はその前の日に到着しておった
He had arrived the day before―the previous day.
その前の晩は徹夜したので疲労しておった
I was fatigued, for I had sat up all night the night before―the previous night.
その記事は一週間前の新聞に出た
The account appeared in the papers a week ago.
あの人は前の校長の時に幹事をした
He was secretary in the late principal's time―in the former principal's time.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼は一カ月前から病気でいる
He has been ill for a month.
僕は五年前から英語をやっておる
I have been studying English for five years.
料理の品によっては三日前にお申込を願います
Some dishes require three days' notice.
三日前に断る
to give one three days' notice
西洋では雇人を解雇する時には一カ月前に断るのが例である
When they discharge a servant in foreign countries, it is usual to give a month's warning.
彼は五十前だ
He is not, yet fifty.
そこでは一週間前の東京新聞を読んでいる
There the people read the Tokyo papers a week old.
それは大事の前の小事だ
That is a minor matter.

content:
まえ〔前〕
〈接尾詞〉(一人前、何人前)a portion; for (so many); enough for (so many)

content.content: 食事二人前
dinner for two
三人前の食器
covers for three
五人前の膳立てをする
to lay covers for five
肉は十人前ある
There is meat enough for ten.
三人前食った
I have eaten three portions―eaten for three.
彼は十人前働く
He can do ten men's work―He can work for ten―He is equal to ten men.
一人前五円ずつやれ
Give them five yen each―five yen apiece.

まえあし〔前足〕
〈名〉A fore leg:(犬猫のは)a fore paw

content:
まえいわい〔前祝い〕
〈名〉(Celebration in) anticipation:(=する) to celebrate in anticipation; to celebrate beforehand

content.content: 前祝いに飲み明かした
We made a night of it in anticipation (of success).

content:
まえおき〔前置き〕
〈名〉A preface; an introduction:(=する) to make prefatory remarks; to make some introductory statement; to preface (one's speech); to premise (something or that...)

content.content: 彼は自分は門外漢で詳しいことは知らぬと前置きした
He premised that he was an outsider and not versed in the matter.
前置きに言う
to say something by way of preface―by way of introduction
前置きは止せ
A way with your introduction!

まえがき〔前書き〕
〈名〉A foreword; a preface; an introduction; a prolegomenon; a preamble

content:
まえかけ〔前掛け〕
〈名〉An apron:(子どものは)a pinafore

content.content: 女中は赤い前掛けを締めている
The waitresses wear red aprons.
赤い前掛けを締めた女中
girls in red aprons―red-aproned girls

content:
まえがし〔前貸し〕
〈名〉Payment in advance:(=する) to pay (money) in advance; to advance (money on one's salary, etc.)

content.content: 給金の前貸しをする
to advance wages

まえがしら〔前頭〕
〈名〉A (common) wrestler

まえかた〔前方〕
〈副〉Before; beforehand; previously

まえかど〔前廉〕
〈副〉Before; beforehand; previously

content:
まえがり〔前借り〕
〈名〉Borrowing in advance:(=する) to borrow in advance

content.content: 月給の前借りをする
to draw one's salary in advance―have one's salary advanced

content:
まえきん〔前金〕
〈名〉Payment in advance; an advance

content.content: 前金を払った
I paid him in advance.
半額だけ前金に願います
You will please pay half the sum in advance.
月給の前金を貸す
(全部なら)to advance one's salary―(一部分なら)―advance a sum on one's salary
月給の前金を五十円貸していただきたい
I wish to have 50 yen advanced on my salary―have an advance of 50 yen on my salary.

まえげい〔前芸〕
〈名〉A prelude (to a play)

content:
まえげいき〔前景気〕
〈名〉A forecast; an outlook; the prospects

content.content: 前景気が好い
The prospects are bright.
この猟期は前景気が好い
The shooting season promises well.

content:
まえこうじょう〔前口上〕
〈名〉A prologue (to a play)

content.content: 前口上を述べる
to prologue―prologize―prologuize

content:
まえじらせ〔前知らせ〕
〈名〉
1. (=予告)a previous notice; a previous announcement
2. (=前兆)an omen
3. (=虫の知らせ)a presentiment; a foreboding

content.content: 誰でも死ぬ時は前知らせがあるものか
Does everybody forebode death?―Has everybody a presentiment of death?

まえだて〔前立て〕
〈名〉The crest (of a helmet); the pompon (of a military cap)

content:
まえだれ〔前垂〕
〈名〉An apron

content.content: 女中は赤い前垂を締めている
The waitresses wear red aprons.
前垂掛けの料理人
an aproned cook

content:
まえのよ〔前の世〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ぜんせい〔前世〕

content:
まえば〔前歯〕
〈名〉A front tooth; an incisor

content.content: 彼は前歯が透いている
There are gaps between his front teeth―His front teeth are apart.
俗説に前歯の透いた者は親不孝だと言う
It is a common saying that irregular front teeth are a sign of one's being a bad son or daughter.

まえばやし〔前囃し〕
〈名〉A prelude; an overture

content:
まえばらい〔前払い〕
〈名〉Prepayment; payment in advance:(=する) to prepay; to pay in advance

content.content: 下宿料は前払いのこと
Board is payable in advance.
運賃前払い
carriage prepaid―carriage paid
運賃前払いで品物を送る
to send the goods carriage prepaid

まえぶね〔前舟〕
〈名〉The front gallery (of a theatre)

content:
まえぶれ〔前触れ〕
〈名〉(事)a previous announcement:(人)a herald; a harbinger; a precursor; a forerunner:(=する) to announce beforehand; to herald; to harbinger; to fore-run

content.content: 幾日も前から前触れがあった
It was announced days beforehand.
できは前触れほどでない
The performance falls short of the announcement.
大袈裟な前触れであった
It was announced with a flourish of trumpets.

content:
まえもって〔前似て〕
〈副〉Beforehand; previously; in advance

content.content: 前もって用意してある口上だ
The speech is prepared beforehand.
前もって御礼申上候
Thanking you in advance.
前もって断る
to give one previous notice―give one previous warning
後から苦情の出ないように前もって断っておく
I give you fair warning―give you due warning.

まえやく〔前厄〕
〈名〉The year before one's climacteric

まえわ〔前輪〕
〈名〉
1. The fore wheels
2. (=鞍の前輪)the saddle-bow

まおう〔魔王〕
〈名〉Satan; the Prince of Darkness

content:
まおとこ〔間男〕
〈名〉(人)a paramour; an adulterer:(事)adultery

content.content: 女が間男する
A woman commits adultery―deceives her husband―dishonours her husband―clothes her husband with disgrace.
あの人は女房に間男をされている
He cherishes a viper in his bosom―He is a cuckold.

まかい〔魔界〕
〈名〉The world of spirits; the spirit world

content:
まがい〔紛い〕
〈名〉An imitation; a counterfeit:(=の) imitation; counterfeit

content.content: 金紛い
imitation gold
紛い物ご用心
Beware of counterfeits?

content:
まがう〔紛う〕
〈自動〉To be confounded (with something); to be confused (with something); to be mistaken (for something); to blend (with something)

content.content: 雲井に紛う沖津白波
The sea blends with the sky.
紛う方無き
unmistakable
紛う方無く
unmistakably―certainly
これは紛う方無き証拠
These are unmistakable signs―signs not to be mistaken.
これは紛う方無く彼の筆蹟だ
This is his handwriting to a certainty―beyond a doubt.

まがえる〔紛える〕
〈他動〉To imitate; to counterfeit

content:
まがお〔真顔〕
〈名〉A grave face; a grave look; a grave air; gravity

content.content: 真顔になる
to look grave―assume a grave look
彼は真顔でそんなばかばかしいことを言っている
He gravely says such absurd things.

まがごと〔禍事〕
〈名〉An evil; a calamity

content:
まかす〔負かす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=敗る)to defeat (the enemy); to vanquish (the enemy); to beat (one's competitor); to outdo (one's teacher); to worst (one); to put (one) to the worst; to worsen (one); to put (one) to the worse; to best (one)

content.content: 議論で負かしてやった
I worsted him in argument―argued him down―outargued him―confuted him (in argument).
競争で負かしてやった
I beat him in a race―outran him.
敵を軍略で負かす
to defeat the enemy in strategy―outgeneral the enemy
相手の得意なことで負かす
to beat one at one's own game―beat one on one's own ground
相手を飲み負かす
to drink one down―leave one under the table
彼をさんざんに(ぐうの音も出ないように)負かしてやった
I beat him all to nothing―beat him all to sticks―(は英国、米国では)―beat him all hollow.

content: 2. (=価を負けさせる)→『

content.content: まけさせる〔負けさせる〕

content:
まかせ〔任せ〕
〈接尾詞〉→『

content.content: まかせる〔任せる〕
彼は万事人任せだ
He leaves everything to others―leaves everything in other hands.
財政紊乱は人任せの結果だ
His affairs are in confusion, because they are in other hands.
家政の上手な女は何事も人任せにせぬ
A good housewife will see to everything herself.
店は雇人任せだ
He commits his business to the care of his employ?s.
店を雇人任せにして遊び歩いている
Leaving his business in his employ?s' hands, he gads about after pleasure.
彼は力任せに働く
He works with all his might.
力任せに殴ってやった
I thrashed him with all my strength.
力任せに引張れ
Tug by main force!

content:
まかせる〔任せる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=委任する)to commit (anything) to one's care; to leave (anything to one); to leave (anything) in one's hands; to trust (oneself to another―one with anything); to refer (a matter-to one)

content.content: 店のことは息子に任せておく
I have committed my business to my son's care.
事務上のことはいっさい田中君に任せてある
I have committed all business matters to the charge of Mr. Tanaka.
家政上のことは女に任せておくのが一番
It is best to commit all household matters to your wife's management.
この事は僕に任してくれ
Leave the matter to me!
君の判断に任せる(よろしく頼む)
I leave it to your judgment.
事件は君に任せる
I will leave the matter in your hands―leave the matter in your charge.
事件は君に任しておけば安心だ
The matter is safe in your hands.
事件は大丈夫な人に任してある
The matter is in safe hands.
一身を師の指導に任せる
to trust oneself to a teacher's guidance
医者に命を任せる
to trust one's life to a physician―trust a physician with one's life
あの人は金を任せても安心だ
You can trust him with money.
あの男に大金を任せるのは剣呑だ
You can not trust him with a large sum of money.
君なら命をも任せる
I could trust you with my life.
争いを仲裁に任せた
We have referred the matter to arbitration.
人に身を任せる
to place oneself in another's power
女が男に身を任せた
She surrendered her chastity to him―gave herself to him―admitted his embraces.
身は任せても心は任せぬ
I am yours in body, but not in heart.
船は船頭に任せよ
“No talking to the man at the wheel.”

content: 2. (=放任する)to abandon (a ship to her fate); to leave (a ship to her fate); to resign (oneself to fate); to trust to (chance or luck); to indulge (one's nature); to humour (one's wishes)

content.content: 船を運命に任せた(乗り棄てた)
We abandoned the ship to her fate―left the ship to her fate.
身を運命に任せた(運命と諦めた)
I have resigned myself to fate.
運に任せる
to trust to luck
運を天に任せる
to trust in Providence
運を天に任して断行する
to cross the Rubicon
運を天に任したり
The die is cast.
僥倖に任す
to leave anything to chance―trust to chance―trust to the chapter of accidents
僥倖に任して(運に任して)やってみよう
I will take my chance―take the chances―take the risks―risk it―chance it.
人の望みに任せる
to indulge one in one's wishes
病人の望みに任せよ
Humour the invalid (in his wishes)!
しからば君の望みに任せる
Then you may do as you please―Have, then, your wish!
自然のなりゆきに任せよ
Let nature take her course!
事のなりゆきに任せよう
I will let things take their course―leave the matter to take its own course―let things slide.
船を風浪に任せた
The ship was left to the mercy of the wind and waves.
風浪に任して船を流した
The ship was allowed to drift at the mercy of the wind and waves.
事実をありのままに述べて後は君達の判断に任せる
I will state the facts as they are, and leave you to judge for yourselves.
君の良心に任せる
I will leave you to your conscience.
君の名誉心に任せる(紳士を以て遇する)
I will trust to your honour.
天性に任せる
to indulge one's nature
想像に任せる
to give rein to one's imagination―give a loose to one's fancy
感情に任せる
to give a loose to one's feelings
彼は口に任してしゃべる
He gives a loose to his tongue.
口に任して悪口を言う
He calls you whatever name he can lay his tongue to.
筆に任して書く
He writes whatever drops from his pen.
足に任して走った
I ran as fast as my legs could carry me.
足に任して歩いた
I went wherever fancy led me.
金に任せて建てた家だ
The house was built regardless of expense.
暇に任してやるがよい
You may do it at your leisure―You may take your own time to do it.
力に任して働く
I work with all my might―with might and main.
力に任して殴ってやった
I thrashed him with all my strength.
力に任して引張った
I tugged by main force.
心に任せぬことがある
Something has gone against me―gone wrong with me.

まがたま〔勾玉〕
〈名〉Claw-shaped stone beads (used for necklaces in ancient times)

content:
まがった〔曲った〕
〈形〉
1. (=真直でない)bent (hook); crooked (street); curved (track); winding (path); meandering (stream); wry (neck); gnarled (bough, etc.)

content.content: 枝の面白く曲った古木
The old tree has gnarled and fantastic boughs.
老人は腰が曲っている
The old man is bent with age.
あの人は頭が曲っている
He has a wry neck―His neck is awry.

content: 2. (=傾ける)leaning

content.content: 曲った家
a leaning house
この家は曲っている
The house leans to one side―inclines to one side.

content: 3. (=邪曲な)wrong (action); crooked (ways); warped (mind); perverse, crabbed, cross-grained (nature); distorted (views, etc.)

content.content: 曲った事をする
to do wrong
あの人は曲った事が好きだ
He likes crooked ways.
僕は曲った事は大嫌いだ
I hate to do wrong.
曲った事をするな
Keep to the right!
曲った事を真直にする(筋を立てる)
to right a wrong―right one's wrongs
彼は根性が曲っている
He is a perverse character―a crabbed nature―a cross-grained fellow.

content:
まかない〔賄い〕
〈名〉
1. (=賄うこと)supplying food; purveyance; catering
2. (=賄う食物)board; fare; the table

content.content: 賄い付きの下宿
board and lodging
賄い付きで三十円で下宿している
I board and lodge at 30 yen a month.
賄い無しの下宿
dry lodging
賄い料はいくらか
What is the charge for board?―What do they charge you for board?―What do you pay for board?
賄い料は月二十円
They charge me 20 yen a month for board―I pay 20 yen a month for board.
あの下宿屋は賄いが好い
The house provides good fare―provides a good table.
下宿人は賄いが悪いとて苦情を言っている
The boarders complain of bad fare.

content: 3. (=賄方)a purveyor; a caterer; a victualler; a cook

content.content: 賄い征伐
a crusade against the cooks―a dining-room riot

content:
まかなう〔賄う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=食物を給する)to supply (one) with food; to board (a lodger); to victual (a ship); to purvey (for an army); to cater (for a person)

content.content: いくらで賄ってくれるか
What will you board me for?
月二十円で賄いましょう
I will board you at 20 yen a month.
月二十円で賄わせています
They board me at 20 yen a month―I board at 20 yen a month.

content: 2. (=物品を調達する)to supply; furnish; provide (articles―one with articles)

まがなすきがな〔間がな隙がな〕
〈副〉
1. (=絶えず)constantly; incessantly; all the time
2. (=隙あるごとに)at odd moments

content.content: 彼は忙しいから間がな隙がな読書する
He is a busy man, and reads at odd moments.

まがも〔真鴨〕
〈名〉The (common) wild duck; the mallard

content:
まがり〔間借り〕
〈名〉Renting a room:(=する) to rent a room; to hire a room; to engage a room

content.content: 僕は間借りしている
I live in a hired room―live in a room on hire.

content:
まがり〔曲り〕
〈名〉A crook (of a trunk); a bend (of a river); a turn (of a road); a curve (of a track)

content.content: 根性曲り
a perverse man―a crabbed man―a cross-grained man―a wrong-headed man
曲り木にも使いどころがある
Everything is useful in its place.
曲りを直す
to straighten anything→『まがりなりに〔曲りなりに〕』

まがりかど〔曲り角〕
〈名〉A corner (of a street); a turning (of a road)

content:
まがりくねった〔曲りくねった〕
〈形〉Winding (path); meandering (stream); crooked (street); mazy (corridor, etc.)

content.content: 曲りくねった路
a crooked road―a winding path―a path full of turns and twists
曲りくねった川
a winding stream―a meandering stream
河が平原を曲りくねって流れる
The river winds―meanders―through the plain.
曲りくねった枝
a crooked branch―a gnarled and fantastic bough

まかりこす〔罷り越す〕
〈第一人称自動詞〉I go

まかりでる〔罷り出る〕
〈第一人称自動詞〉I come; I wait on you

content:
まがりなりに〔曲りなりに〕
〈副〉As it is bent; as it is; somehow or other; imperfectly

content.content: 木が曲りなりに生長する
A tree grows as it is bent―“As the twig is bent, the tree is inclined.”
けがをした足が曲りなりに治った
The injured leg has healed as it was.
曲りなりにこの顔を描け
Paint me as I am!
事件は曲りなりに片づいた
The matter is settled somehow or other.
彼はどうやらこうやら曲りなりに暮らしている
He manages somehow or other―by hook or crook―to live.
不具な子が曲りなりに大きくなった
The deformed child grew up in its deformity.
それでも曲りなりに英語を覚えた
And yet I learned English, imperfect as it was.

content:
まかりまちがえば〔罷り間違えば〕
〈副〉At the worst; if the worst comes to the worst

content.content: まかり間違えば死ぬまでのことさ
I can but die at the worst.
まかり間違えば資本を棒に振るだけだ
I can but lose my capital at the worst.
まかり間違えば破産するまでのことだと思え
If the worst comes to the worst, you can but become bankrupt.

content:
まがりめ〔曲り目〕
〈名〉A turning (of a street); a bend (of a river)

content.content: 二番目の曲り目を左へお曲りなさい
Take the second turning on your left!

content:
まがる〔曲る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=長い物が曲る)to bend; to curve

content.content: 木は曲る
Wood bends.
石は曲らない
Stone does not bend.
線路が山を曲る
The track curves round a hill.
腰が曲る
to become bent (with age)
彼は腰が曲っている
He is bent with age.
彼女は年を取っても腰が曲らぬ
She is as straight as an arrow.
(そんなことをすると)手が曲るぞ、足が曲るぞ
You will incur divine judgment.
曲りやすい
(物質なら)a flexible substance―(身体なら)―a supple frame―(性質なら)―a pliant nature

content: 2. (=角を曲る)to turn (a corner)

content.content: 角を曲る
to turn a corner―go round a corner―(歩いて曲れば)―walk round a corner―(走って曲れば)―run round a corner
その家はあの角を曲った所だ
The house stands round the corner.
右へ曲る
to turn to the right―take the turning on the right
この通りを左へお曲りなさい
Turn to the left!
二番目の曲り目を左へお曲りなさい
Take the second turning on your left!
道が北の方へ曲る
The road turns to the north.
汽車がカーブを曲る
A train turns a curve.

content: 3. (=傾く)to lean; to incline

content.content: 家が曲っている
The house leans to one side―inclines to one side.
家は北の方へ曲っている
The house leans toward the north―inclines toward the north.

content:
まき〔巻〕
〈名〉
1. (=巻物)a roll

content.content: 一巻の紙
a roll of paper

content: 2. (=本の巻)a volume

content.content: 一の巻
the first volume―Vol.Ⅰ

content: 3. (=時計を巻くこと)winding (a clock or a watch)

content.content: 時計の巻きが戻った
The clock has run down.
一週巻きの時計
an eight-day clock

content:
まき〔薪〕
〈名〉Wood; firewood

content.content: 薪を割る
to split wood―chop wood
薪をくべろ
Throw on more wood―Throw a log on the fire―Mend the fire.
薪の束
a faggot
薪屋
a dealer in firewood

まき〔槇〕
〈名〉A kind of pine (with thick needles)

content:
まきあがる〔巻き上がる〕
〈自動〉To roll up; to curl up

content.content: 幕が巻き上がる
The curtain rolls up.
百姓屋から煙が巻き上がる
Smoke curls up from a cottage―There is a wreath of smoke rising from a cottage.

content:
まきあげる〔巻き上げる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=巻いて上げる)to roll up (a curtain); to wind up (coal from a coal-mine); to whirl (anything) up; to hoist (a sail)

content.content: 帆を巻き上げる
to hoist a sail
錨を巻き上げる
to heave up the anchor
簾を巻き上げる
to roll up a screen
風に巻き上げられた
They were caught up by the wind.

content: 2. (=奪い取る)to rob, ease, relieve (one of a purse); to fleece, shear (one of one's money); to cheat, fool, gull, swindle, wheedle, cozen, talk, do (one out of anything)

content.content: 彼は悪者に財布を巻き上げられた
A scoundrel robbed him of his purse―eased him of his purse―relieved him of his purse.
彼は資本を巻き上げられて帰って来た
He came back shorn of his capital―fleeced of his capital.
若い女がお爺さんをだまして何でも欲しい物を巻き上げる
The young woman fools the old man out of anything she wants.
十円巻き上げられた
I was done out of ten yen.

content:
まきえ〔蒔絵〕
〈名〉Raised lacquer

content.content: 金蒔絵
gold lacquer
黒塗に金蒔絵の定紋付きの箱
a black lacquered box with the family crest in gold

content:
まきがみ〔巻紙〕
〈名〉Rolled letter-paper

content.content: 巻紙一本
a roll of paper

まきがり〔巻狩〕
〈名〉A drive:(=する) to drive game

まきげーとる〔巻ゲートル〕
〈名〉Puttees

content:
まきこむ〔巻き込む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=巻き入れる)to roll in; to wind in

content.content: 魚を網に巻き込む
to enclose fish in a net

content: 2. (=吸い込む)to suck in; to swallow up; to engulf

content.content: 全村津浪に巻き込まれた
The whole village was engulfed by a tidal wave.
海岸の町が波に巻き込まれた
The towns on the coast were swallowed up by the sea.
船が渦に巻き込まれる
A ship is sucked in by a whirlpool―drawn into a vortex.
機関士が機械に巻き込まれた
An engineer was caught by the machinery.

content: 3. (=巻き添えにする)to involve (one in an affair); to entangle (one in a scheme); to implicate (one in a crime); to embroil (a country in war)

content.content: 国が戦争の渦中に巻き込まれる
A country is involved in war―embroiled in war―dragged into a war.
人が陰謀の仲間に巻き込まれる
A man is involved in a plot―implicated in a plot―drawn into a plot.

まきざっぽう〔薪ざっぽう〕
〈名〉A stick of firewood; a billet

content:
まきじた〔巻舌〕
〈名〉Trill

content.content: 巻舌に発音する
to trill one's r's
あの人は巻舌だ
He trills his words.

まきじゃく〔巻尺〕
〈名〉A tape-measure

content:
まきぞえ〔巻き添え〕
〈名〉Involvement; entanglement; embroilment; implication

content.content: 巻き添えにする
to involve one in an affair―entangle one in a scheme―implicate one in a crime―embroil a country in a war
巻き添えを喰う
to be involved in an affair―entangled in a scheme―implicated in a crime―embroiled in a war
彼は事件の巻き添えを喰った
He was involved in the affair―entangled in the affair―implicated in the affair―drawn into the affair.
海軍疑獄の巻き添えを喰った
He was implicated in the navy scandal.
日本は戦争の巻き添えを喰うようなことはあるまい
I hope Japan will not be embroiled in the war―dragged into the war.

content:
まきたばこ〔巻煙草〕
〈名〉(葉巻)a cigar:(紙巻)a cigarette

content.content: 巻タバコを吸う
to smoke a cigar―smoke a cigarette
巻タバコ入れ
a cigar case―a cigarette case

content:
まきちらす〔撒き散す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=散布する)to scatter about (paper); to strew (flowers on one's path―one's path with flowers); to bestrew (one's path with flowers); to distribute (handbills, etc.)

content.content: 路に花をまき散らして彼を歓迎した
They strewed his path with flowers.
引札をまき散らす
to distribute handbills

content: 2. (=濫費する)to spend (money) freely; to squander (money); to make ducks and drakes of (one's money)

content.content: 彼は湯水のように金をまき散らす
He squanders money like water.
彼はせっかく取った金を無駄にまき散らしてしまわなければよいが
I wish he would not make ducks and drakes of his hardly earned money.
彼は盛んに金をまき散らして人望取りをする
He bids for popularity by spending money in profusion.

content:
まきつく〔巻き付く〕
〈自動〉To wind, wind itself, get wound (round anything); to twine, twine itself (round anything); to coil (round anything)

content.content: 蛇が人に巻きつく
A snake winds itself round a man.
蛇が杖に巻きついた
The snake coiled round my stick.
蔦が木に巻きつく
An ivy twines round a tree.
綱が暗車に巻きついた
A rope got wound round the screw.

content:
まきつけ〔蒔付け〕
〈名〉Sowing

content.content: 麦の蒔付けがすんだ
The wheat is sown.
これから豆の蒔付けだ
We must now sow the beans.
蒔付け時
the sowing season

content:
まきつける〔巻き付ける〕
〈他動〉To wind, twine (one thing round or about another)

content.content: 頸に襟巻を巻きつける
to wind a comforter round one's neck
足に包帯を巻きつけている
His foot is swathed in bandages.

content:
まきなおし〔蒔直し〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: しんきまきなおし〔新規蒔直し〕

content:
まきば〔牧場〕
〈名〉A pasture

content.content: 牛を牧場に放す
to put cattle to pasture
馬を牧場に放す
to put a horse to grass―turn out a horse to graze
老馬は牧場に放してある
The old horse is sent to grass.

content:
まきはだ〔槇皮〕
〈名〉Oakum

content.content: 船底の隙に槇皮を詰める
to caulk the seams

まきもの〔巻物〕
〈名〉
1. A roll
2. (=軸)a scroll

まきょう〔魔鏡〕
〈名〉A magic mirror

content:
まぎらす〔紛らす〕
〈他動〉To divert (one's mind from care); to distract (one's mind); to relieve (the tedium); to beguile (time of its tedium)

content.content: 心をまぎらす、気をまぎらす
to divert one's mind (from care)―distract one's mind
芝居へ行って気をまぎらそうとした
I went to the play to distract my thoughts.
退屈をまぎらす
to relieve the tedium―beguile the time―while away the time―kill time

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 酒に苦労をまぎらす
to drown care in wine
酒を飲んで悲しみをまぎらす
to drink down sorrow
不平を酒にまぎらそうとした
I tried to forget my discontent in dissipation.
活動をして不幸をまぎらす
to forget one's misery in activity
笑いにまぎらす
to laugh a matter off―laugh a matter away
苦労を笑いにまぎらす
to laugh care away
悲しみを笑いまぎらす
to laugh sorrow away
腹の立つのを笑いにまぎらす
to laugh off one's vexations
事を冗談にまぎらす
to treat a matter as a joke

content: 〈自動〉(=言いまぎらす)to equivocate; to quibble; to dodge; to shuffle; to shift and prevaricate

まぎらわしい〔紛らわしい〕
〈形〉Misleading; ambiguous; equivocal

content.content: この本の表題はまぎらわしい
The title of the book is misleading.
ここの意味がまぎらわしい
The passage is ambiguous in meaning.
その返事はちとまぎらわしいね
Your answer is somewhat equivocal.

content:
まぎる〔間切る〕
〈自動〉［航海］To tack

content.content: 右舷に間切る、左舷に間切る
to go from port tack to starboard―go from starboard tack to port
時々間切る
to make short boards
間切らずに走る
to make a good board―make a long board

content:
まぎれこむ〔紛れ込む〕
〈自動〉To mingle with (something); to get mixed with (something); to find one's way into (some place)

content.content: 王は変装して敵陣へまぎれ込んだ
The king disguised himself and found his way into the enemy's camp.
こんな物が僕の鞄の中へまぎれ込んだ
Such a thing as this has found its way into my trunk.
書類がどこかへまぎれ込んで見えない
The papers have got mixed with something.
角袖巡査が群集の中へまぎれ込んでいた
Some plain-clothes men were mingled with the crowd.
彼はたちまち群集にまぎれ込んで見えなくなった
He was soon lost in the crowd.

content:
まぎれに〔紛れに〕
〈接尾詞〉［注意］訳語一定せず。

content.content: 嬉しまぎれに
in one's joy―in the excess of one's joy
嬉しまぎれにすっかり忘れておった
I forgot all about it in my joy.
腹立ちまぎれに
in a fit of passion―in a moment of anger
腹立ちまぎれに原稿を引裂いてしまった
I tore up the manuscript in a moment of anger.
どさくさまぎれに
in the confusion of the moment
彼はどさくさまぎれに逃げ果たした
He made good his escape in the confusion of the moment―He profited by the confusion to effect his escape.
悔しまぎれに
out of vexation―out of chagrin
彼は悔しまぎれにこんな早まったことをしたのだ
He committed the rash act out of sheer vexation.
酔ったまぎれにどうしたかわかったものじゃない
There is no saying what I may have done under the influence of wine.
苦しまぎれに
in a fit of desperation―in despair―in anguish of heart―under the pressure of necessity
彼は苦しまぎれに何をするかわかったものじゃない
There is no saying what he may do in a fit of desperation.
彼は苦しまぎれにひと思いに殺してくれと言った
In a fit of desperation, he begged to be put out of misery.
彼は苦しまぎれに自害したのだ
He committed suicide in despair―He was driven by despair to suicide―Despair drove him to suicide.
苦しまぎれに声を揚げた
I cried out in anguish of heart.
これは苦しまぎれに借りた金だ
The money was borrowed under the pressure of necessity.

content:
まぎれもない〔紛れも無い〕
〈形〉Unmistakable (signs); undoubted (fact); indubitable (good, etc.)

content.content: これはまぎれも無い証拠だ
These are unmistakable signs―signs not to be mistaken.
これはまぎれも無い事実だ
This is an undoubted fact―a certain fact.

content:
まぎれもなく〔紛れも無く〕
〈副〉Without mistake; beyond mistake; without doubt; beyond doubt

content.content: 彼はまぎれも無く日本人だ
He is a Japanese, without mistake―He is Japanese, beyond mistake―He is a Japanese, and no mistake.
これはまぎれも無い事実だ
It is true without doubt―beyond doubt―beyond dispute―past all dispute.
これはまぎれも無く彼の直筆だ
This is his genuine autograph.

content:
まぎれる〔紛れる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=入り交じって区別し難い)to blend (with something); to be lost (in something); to get confused; to get mixed

content.content: 海が空にまぎれる
The sea blends with the sky.
彼は忽ち群集にまぎれて見えなくなった
He was soon lost in the crowd.
彼は混雑にまぎれて逃げ果たした
He made good his escape in the confusion of the moment―He profited by the confusion to effect his escape.
書類がまぎれないようにして下さい
See that the papers do not get mixed.
闇にまぎれて逃げた
I fled under cover of night―under favour of darkness.

content: 2. (=心を奪われる)to be distracted (from grief); to be diverted (from care); to be absorbed (in study); to be engrossed (in business, etc.)

content.content: 気がまぎれる
One is diverted from care―distracted from sorrow.
人と話しをしていると気がまぎれて苦労を忘れる
Talk diverts my mind from care.
面白い話しにまぎれて用を忘れておった
Pleasant talk has distracted my mind from business.
仕事をしているとそれにまぎれて悲しさを忘れる
Work distracts one's mind from grief.
子どもが遊びにまぎれて課業を忘れている
The child is too much absorbed in play to think of its task.
つい多忙にまぎれてご無沙汰を致しました
I have been too much engrossed in my business to think of calling on you.

content:
まぎわに〔間際に〕
〈副〉On the eve of (something); on the brink of (something); on the verge of (something); on the threshold of (something); when on the point of (doing something); when about to (do something)

content.content: ネルソンは戦勝の間際に死んだ
Nelson died on the eve of victory.
彼は試験の間際に病気になった
He fell ill on the eve of the examination.
卒業の間際に死んだ
He died on the eve of graduation.
彼は滅亡の間際に迷夢が覚めた
He came to his senses when he was on the brink of ruin―when he was on the verge of ruin.
開戦の間際に買った軍艦だ
The ship was bought on the threshold of the war.
発車の間際に駈けつけた
I got to the station when the train was on the point of starting.
旅行に出かけようと思う間際にこの大事件が起こった
The great event happened when I was about to start on a journey.
彼は死ぬ間際に白状した
He confessed on his deathbed.
死ぬ間際に初めて白状した
He did not confess till he lay at death's door.

content:
まきわり〔薪割り〕
〈名〉(事)wood-splitting; wood-chopping:(道具)an axe

content.content: 薪割りをする
to split wood―chop wood

content:
まく〔巻く〕
〈他動〉
1. To wind (one thing round another); to twine (one thing round another); to roll (a piece of paper); to roll up (a blind); to coil (a rope); to reel (a line)

content.content: 頸に襟巻を巻く、ハンケチを巻く
to wind a comforter round one's neck―tie a handkerchief round one's neck
鞘に藤蔓を巻く
to twine a wistaria-vine round the scabbard
糸巻に糸を巻く
to wind thread on a reel―wind a reel with thread―reel a line
縄を巻く
to coil a rope
掛物を巻く
to roll up a scroll
簾垂のれんを巻く
to roll up a blind
風が悋気で簾巻く
The jealous wind raises the blind.
時計を巻く
to wind up a watch―wind up a clock
紙巻タバコを巻く
to roll a cigarette
帆を巻く
to hoist a sail
錨を巻く
to weigh anchor
疾風砂塵を巻く
The wind raises a dust.
疾風枯葉を巻く
The wind whirls up the leaves.
疾風枯葉を巻くの勢をもって進む
to carry everything before one

content:
2. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 証文を巻く
to nullify a bond
彼は酔うと管を巻く
He talks incoherently when he is drunk.
嚊{かかあ}の褌に巻かれる
to be tied to one's wife's apron-strings―be henpecked
長い物には巻かれろ
It is no use contending against a man in power―It is no good kicking against the pricks.
舌を巻く
to be outtalked (by some one)―be astonished

content:
まく〔撒く〕
〈他動〉
1. To scatter; to strew (flowers on the path―the path with flowers); to bestrew (the path with flowers); to sprinkle (water on the street―the street with water); to besprinkle (the street with water)

content.content: 往来に水をまく
to sprinkle the streets with water―water the streets
庭に水をまけ
Water the garden!
節分には豆をまく
Parched beans are scattered about the house at Setsubun.
餅をまく
to throw pieces of mochi among a crowd
路に花をまいて人を歓迎する
to strew one's path with flowers
金をまく
to spend money freely―squander one's money―make ducks and drakes of one's money
彼は湯水のように金をまく
He spends money like water.
人をまく
to give one the slip―give one. the guy
彼を人込みでまいてやった
I gave him the slip in a crowd.
追手をまく
to fling off one's pursuer―throw one's pursuer off the scent
泥棒が巡査をまいて逃げた
The burglar threw the policeman off the scent.

content:
まく〔蒔く〕
〈他動〉To sow (seed)

content.content: 地に種を蒔く
to sow seed in the soil―(の第二構文は)―sow the soil with seed
この畑には小麦を蒔いた
We have sown the field with wheat.
この畑には大麦が蒔いてある
This field is sown with barley.
ばらまきに蒔く
to sow broadcast
争いの種を蒔く
to sow the seeds of strife
苦労の種を蒔く
to sow the seeds of future trouble
蒔かぬ種は生えぬ
“We must sow before we can reap.”

content:
まく〔幕〕
〈名〉
1. A curtain

content.content: 幕を張る
to hang a curtain―draw a curtain
幕を引く
to draw the curtain―draw back the curtain
幕を引き廻す
to draw a curtain around
幕を引き絞る
to gather a curtain
窓に幕が掛けてある
The window is hung with a curtain.
幕が明く
The curtain rises.
何時に幕が明きますか
What time does the curtain rise?―the performance commence?
幕が今明いたばかりだ
The performance has just commenced.
幕が明くとそこがこっけいの場
The curtain rises on a comic scene.
幕が下りる、幕になる
The curtain falls―The curtain drops.
愁歎場で幕が下りる
The curtain falls on a scene of tears.
のべつ幕無し
constantly―continually―incessantly―without intermission
彼はのべつ幕無しにしゃべっている
He talks without intermission―talks nineteen to the dozen.

content: 2. (=芝居の一幕)an act; a scene; a piece

content.content: 西洋の演劇はたいがい五幕になっている
A foreign play is generally in five acts.
一幕物
a one-act play
序幕
the opening act―the first act―the prelude
中幕
the middle piece
幕合い
the interval between the acts
幕合いが長い
There is a long interval between the acts.
お前達の出る幕じゃない
It is none of your business―no business of yours.

content: 3. (=相撲の幕)the first grade

content.content: 相撲が幕に入る
A wrestler rises to the first grade.
幕の内
wrestlers of the first grade
幕の内まで取り上がる
to wrestle one's way up to the first grade

content:
まくあい〔幕合〕
〈名〉The interval between the acts

content.content: 幕合いが長い
There is a long interval between the acts.
幕合いが二十分ある
There is a twenty minutes' interval between the acts.

content:
まぐさ〔秣〕
〈名〉Fodder; provender; hay:(軍隊にては)forage

content.content: 馬に秣をかう
to fodder a horse―(軍隊の馬なら)―forage cattle
秣槽
a manger
秣置場
a hay-loft
秣切り
a hay-knife

まくしかける〔捲しかける〕
〈他動〉To attack; to fly at (one)

content:
まくした〔幕下〕
〈名〉Wrestlers of the second grade; wrestlers of junior grades

content.content: 幕下力士
a second-grade wrestler―a junior-grade wrestler

まくしたてる〔捲し立てる〕
〈他動〉To attack; to fly at (one)

まぐそだか〔馬糞鷹〕
〈名〉The kestrel

content:
まぐち〔間口〕
〈名〉Frontage; width

content.content: 五間間口の店
The shop has a 30 feet frontage.
地所は間口五間奥行十間
The plot is 30 feet wide and 60 feet deep.
彼の学問は間口ばかりで奥行が無い
His knowledge is of a wide range, but lacks depth.

content:
まくつ〔魔窟〕
〈名〉A den; a house of ill fame; disreputable quarters:(米国では)a red-light district

content.content: 警察が魔窟狩りをする
The police make a raid on disreputable quarters.

content:
まくのうち〔幕の内〕
〈名〉Wrestlers of the first grade

content.content: 相撲が幕の内に入る
A wrestler rises to the first grade.
幕の内まで取り上がる
to wrestle one's way up to the first grade

content:
まくら〔枕〕
〈名〉
1. A pillow:(括り枕は)a bolster:(=する) to pillow one's head, rest one's head (on something)

content.content: 枕につく
to go to bed―go to sleep―(病人が床に就くの意味なら)―take to one's bed
どっと枕についた
He was confined to his bed―laid by the heels.
枕をつけるとすぐ眠る
I fall asleep as soon as my head touches the pillow―as soon as I lie down.
枕を上げる
to raise one's head off the pillow
その音を聞いて枕を上げた
On hearing the sound, I raised my head.
枕も上がらないほどの大病人だ
The invalid can not raise his head.
枕を高うして寝る
to sleep in peace―sleep on a calm conscience
市民は枕を高うして寝られる
The townsfolk can now sleep in peace.
悪事を為す者は枕を高うして寝られぬ
Evil-doers can not sleep on a calm conscience.
枕を並べて寝る
to lie down side by side
枕を並べて討死にする
to fall fighting side by side
城を枕に討死にする
to make a castle one's death-pillow
本を枕にする
to pillow one's head on a book―rest one's head on a book
本を枕にして寝ておった
He lay with his head pillowed on a book―with his head resting on a book―with his head on a book―with a book for pillow.
肘枕する
to rest one's head on one's hand
木の根を枕にして眠った
I slept with my head (pillowed) on the root of a tree―with a root for pillow.
木の根枕に青天井
Pillowing my head on the root of a tree, I slept under the blue sky.
美人の膝枕する
to lie on beauty's lap
酔うては枕す美人の膝
When drunk, I rest my head on beauty's lap.
北枕に寝る
to sleep with one's head toward the north
枕を交わす
to lie with―sleep with―a man or a woman
(女が)枕の塵を払う、枕の伽をする
to do bedservice

content:
2. (=機械などを受ける枕)a block
3. (=序言)a preamble

まくらえ〔枕絵〕
〈名〉An obscene picture; an indecent picture

まくらかけ〔枕掛け〕
〈名〉A pillow-case; a slip

まくらがね〔枕金〕
〈名〉(A geisha's) charge for bedservice

content:
まくらぎ〔枕木〕
〈名〉A (railway) sleeper; a tie

content.content: 枕木を取り換える
to resleeper a track

content:
まくらきん〔枕金〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: まくらがね〔枕金〕

まくらことば〔枕言葉〕
〈名〉A “pillow-word”; a permanent epithet

まくらさがし〔枕捜し〕
〈名〉(事)bedroom theft:(人) a bedroom thief; a hotel thief

まくらぞうし〔枕草紙〕
〈名〉A book of obscene pictures

content:
まくらっぴき〔枕引き〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: まくらびき〔枕引き〕

まくらびき〔枕引き〕
〈名〉A pillow-pulling match

まくらびょうぶ〔枕屏風〕
〈名〉A low screen placed at the head of a bed; a bed-screen

content:
まくらもと〔枕許〕
〈名〉One's bedside

content.content: 目をさましてみると誰か枕もとに泣いている者がある
I awoke to find some one crying by my bedside.
家族が死せんとする人の枕もとに集まった
The family gathered about his deathbed.
朝起きてみると枕もとの時計が無い
I awoke in the morning to miss my watch beneath my pillow.
病人の枕もとへ寄る
to bend over one's pillow

content:
まくる〔捲る〕
