〈他動〉To turn (the edge); to turn up (a sleeve); to roll up (a curtain); to tuck up (one's skirt)

content.content: 裾をまくる、尻をまくる
to tuck up one's skirt
裾をまくり上げる
to roll up one's skirt
袖をまくる
to turn up one's sleeves
腕をまくる
to roll up one's sleeves―bare one's arms
刀の刃をまくる
to turn the edge of a sword―blunt the edge of a sword―dull the edge of a sword

content:
まぐれあたり〔紛れ中り〕
〈名〉A chance hit; a lucky hit; an accidental hit; a fluke:(当て事なら) a lucky guess; a lucky shot

content.content: まぐれあたりもあたりはあたりだ
A chance hit is a hit after all.
当ったことは当ったけれどまぐれあたりだ
You have guessed right, it is true, but you have made a lucky guess.
いい加減に書いて出した答案がまぐれあたりに当った
The answer I gave at random turned out correct.

content:
まぐれこむ〔紛れ込む〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: まぎれこむ〔紛れ込む〕

まぐれざいわい〔紛れ幸〕
〈名〉Good luck; a windfall; a godsend

content:
まくれる〔捲れる〕
〈自動〉To turn; to turn up

content.content: 縁{へり}が捲れる
The edge turns up.
刀の刃がまくれた
The edge of the sword has turned.

content:
まぐれる〔紛れる〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: まぎれる〔紛れる〕

content:
まぐろ〔鮪〕
〈名〉The tunny

content.content: 鮪の刺身
slices of raw tunny

content:
まぐわ〔馬鍬〕
〈名〉A harrow

content.content: 馬鍬で土地をならす
to harrow land

まくわうり〔甜瓜〕
〈名〉The melon:(米国にては)the musk-melon

content:
まけ〔負け〕
〈名〉
1. (=敗北)a defeat; a reverse

content.content: 戦争はドイツの負けになった
The war resulted in Germany's defeat.
裁判は原告の負けになった
Decision was given against the plaintiff―The plaintiff lost the case.
得点は五に対し三の負け
The scores are 5 to 3 against me.

content: 2. (=減価)reduction in price

content.content: 馬をお買いになるなら鞍はお負けにする
If you will buy the horse, I will throw the saddle into the bargain.
おまけに資本までも棒に振った
I lost my capital into the bargain.

content:
まげ〔髷〕
〈名〉(男のは)a topknot:(女のは)a chignon

content.content: 髷に結ぶ
to tie one's hair in a topknot―do one's hair in a chignon

content:
まけいくさ〔負け軍〕
〈名〉A lost battle; a defeat

content.content: 負け軍になってきた
The tide of war is turning against us―We are fighting a losing battle―We are playing a losing game.

content:
まけいろ〔負け色〕
〈名〉Signs of defeat

content.content: 負け色を表す
to waver―begin to give way

content:
まけおしみ〔負け惜み〕
〈名〉
1. Unwillingness to acknowledge one's defeat; pride

content.content: 彼は負け惜しみを言っている
He will not acknowledge himself beaten―refuses to acknowledge his defeat―denies his defeat.
負け惜しみが強い
He is too proud to acknowledge his defeat.
彼は負け惜しみが強いから負けても負けたと言わぬ
His pride forbids his acknowledging his defeat.

content: 2. (=欲しい者を欲しくないと言う負け惜しみ)sour grapes

content.content: 君は金が欲しくないと言うのは負け惜しみだ
“The grapes are sour.”
彼も実は東京へ行きたいのだけれども行きたいことはないと負け惜しみを言って停車場まで僕を見送ってくれた
He came to the station to see me off in a sour-grape humour.
武士が清貧を誇るのもしかたがないから負け惜しみさ
Making a virtue of necessity, the samurai gloried in honourable poverty.

content:
まけさせる〔負けさせる〕
〈他動〉To cheapen, lower, beat down, knock down (the price)

content.content: 値切り小切って五十円に負けさせた
After much haggling and higgling, I beat down the price to 50 yen.

まけじだましい〔負けじ魂〕
〈名〉An unyielding spirit

content:
まけずおとらず〔負けず劣らず〕
〈副〉Equally well; each as well as the other:(=の) evenly matched; well-matched

content.content: 二人とも負けず劣らず勉強する
They work equally hard―They work each as hard as the other.
彼は誰にも負けず劣らず勉強する
He works as hard as any one―He can work with the best of them.
二人とも負けず劣らず学問ができる
They are equally good scholars―Each of them is as good a scholar as the other.
彼は誰にも負けず劣らず学問ができる
He is as good a scholar as any one.
競争者は負けず劣らずよく走った
The racers ran equally well―neck and neck.
両軍とも負けず劣らずだ
Both armies are evenly matched―well matched.
負けず劣らずの好取組みだ
It is a good match.

content:
まけずと〔負けずと〕
〈副〉A well as (any one)

content.content: 彼は誰にも負けずと勉強する
He works as hard as any one―He can work with the best of them.
兄に負けずと勉強する
He works quite as hard as his brother.
負けずと打ち返す(言い返す)
He gives as good as he gets.

content:
まげて〔抂げて〕
〈副〉Against one's will; against one's judgment

content.content: (非と知りつつ)まげて依頼に応じた
I complied with his request against my better judgment.
そこを一つまげてご承諾下さるわけにはいくまいか
Couldn't you consent against your will?―Couldn't you bring yourself to consent?

まげもの〔曲物〕
〈名〉A round box of bent chip

content:
まける〔負ける〕
〈自動〉
1. (=敗北する)to be defeated; to be beaten; to be vanquished; to meet with a reverse; to lose (a battle or a game); to emerge a loser; to come off a loser; to come off second-best:(争いに負ける)to be confuted; to have the worst of it, get the worst of it; to have the worse, get the worse; to be worsted

content.content: 戦いに負ける
to be defeated in battle―lose a battle―lose the day
日本が負けたら大変だった
What if Japan had been defeated?
戦争のことだから日本が負けぬとも限らぬ
As it is the fortune of war, Japan might be defeated.
日本は海陸ともに何国にも負けぬ
Japan can hold her own against any power on land or sea.
議論に負ける
to be confuted in argument―be worsted in argument―have the worst of it
僕の方が負けたようだ
I am afraid I have the worst of it.
勝負ごとに負ける
to lose a game―come off a loser
(勝負はいかがでしたかと問われて)負けました
I have lost―come off a loser―(こっけいに言えば)―come off second-best.
一番負けた
I have lost one game.
彼は負けたことが無い
He never came off a loser―never met his match.
負けたとて血眼になってはいかん
You must not lose your temper, even if you lose your game―even if the game goes against you.
血眼になるとかえって負ける
If you lose your temper, you will only lose the more.
その手ならこちらも負けぬ
“Two can play at that game.”
相撲に負ける
to be defeated in wrestling―be beaten in wrestling―lose a wrestling match―come off a loser
あの相撲が負けたのは変だ
It is strange that he should have come off a loser.
ばくちに負ける
to lose at play
彼に百円負けた(取られた)
I have lost 100 yen to him.
勝ってもしたく負けてもしたくなるものはばくち
Win or lose, one will go on gambling.
負けて勝つ
to stoop to conquer―gain a moral victory
負けるは勝ち
Defeat is sometimes a moral victory.

content: 2. (=屈服する)to submit to (authority); to surrender to (the enemy); to yield to (persuasion); to give in to (one's antagonist); to give way to (pressure)

content.content: 誘惑に負ける
to yield to temptation
一度誘惑に負けると抵抗力がだんだん弱くなる
If you yield to the first temptation, you will have the less power to resist a second.
感情に負ける(泣く)
to give way to one's feelings―be overcome (with emotion)
自分の智慧に負ける
One's sagacity overreaches itself.
暑気に負ける
to be affected by the heat―be prostrated by the heat
長者には負けよ
Give way to your betters!
女でこそあれあんな男に負けはせぬ
Woman as I am, I will not give in to such a man.
あれは負けん気の女だ
She is a woman of spirit.

content: 3. (=劣る)to be inferior to (the other in something); to be second to (none in something); to yield to (some one in something); to fall behind (some one in something); to be beaten

content.content: 巡洋艦は戦闘艦に攻防力では負けるが速力では勝つ
A cruiser is inferior to a battleship in offensive and defensive power, but superior in speed.
彼に英語では負けるが数学では勝つ
He beats me in English, but I beat him in mathematics.
彼は英語では誰にも負けない
He is second to none in English―He yields to none in English―He yields the palm to no one in English―He falls behind no one in English.
僕は熱心の点においては誰にも負けないつもりだ
I hope I am behind no man in zeal.
器量では姉に負ける
She is not so beautiful as her elder sister.
器量では姉に負けぬ
She is quite as beautiful as her elder sister―no less beautiful than her elder sister.
僕は勉強では誰にも負けぬ
I can work as hard as any―I can work with the best of them.
彼は競技では誰にも負けぬ
He can play as well as any one―with the best of them.
彼は英語を話しては誰にも負けぬ
He speaks English as well as any one―with the best of them.
これなら外国品に負けぬ
This compares favourably with foreign articles.
年をとってもなかなか若い者に負けぬ
Though old, he can cope with the young.

content: 4. (=値を引く)to reduce (the price); to abate (the price); to lower (the price); to make it cheaper; to make it (so much); to take (something) off the price; to take off (so much); to knock off (so much); to come down (so much); to take (so much) less

content.content: 東京で負ける店は無い
There are no shops in Tokyo where they reduce the price.
もっと負からんか
Can't you make it cheaper?―let me have it cheaper?
五十円に負けろ
Make it 50 yen.
いくらか負けられるだろう
Can't you take something off the price?―take off something?―knock off something?
五十銭だけお負け申しておきます
I'll take off 50 sen―knock off 50 sen―come down 50 sen.
一銭も負かりません
I can't take off a cent―take a cent less (than that).
負けられるだけ負けました
I have made it as cheap as I can.
現金なら一割負けます
I will take off ten percent for cash―knock off ten percent for cash.
よろしゅうがす、お負け申します
All right, I will let you have it at the price you name.
五十円に値切ったら負けた
I beat down the price to 50 yen, and he let me have it for that.
先方では請求額を一文も負けない
The other party will not bate a jot of their demands.
売手はなかなか負けぬ(鼻息が荒い)
The sellers hold firm―stand firm.
負けさせる
to cheapen the price―lower the price―beat down the price―knock down the price

content: 5. (=かぶれる)to be poisoned (with something)

content.content: 漆に負ける
to be poisoned with lacquer

content:
まげる〔曲げる〕
〈他動〉
1. To bend (a wire); to curve (a line); to crook (one's arm); to bow (one's head); to double up (one's body)

content.content: 木を曲げる
to bend a tree
腰を曲げる
to bow
頭を曲げる
to bow one's head―incline one's head
頭を曲げて歩いていた
He was walking with bowed head.
首を曲げる
to put one's head on one side
首を曲げて考えておった
He was thinking with his head on one side.
曲げやすい
(物質なら)a flexible substance―(身体なら)―a supple body―(性質なら)―a pliant nature

content: 2. (=法律などを曲げる、文意を曲げて解釈するなど)to pervert (the law); to misrepresent (facts); to falsify (the facts); to prostitute (learning); to depart from (one's principles); to deflect from (one's purpose); to deviate from (a rule); to strain (the meaning of a passage); to stretch (the interpretation of a passage); to wrest (the fact); to wrench (the sense of a passage); to wring (a word from its meaning); to distort (facts or statements); to twist (a word into some meaning not its own)

content.content: 法律を曲げる
to pervert the law―strain the law―stretch the law
主義を曲げる
to depart from one's principles
さすがの頑固親父もあの時だけは主義を曲げた
Rigid disciplinarian as he is, for once did he depart from his principles.
彼はどんなことがあっても主義を曲げぬ(性剛直)
He is inflexible.
規則は曲げられぬ
We can not deviate from the rule.
筆を曲げる
to prostitute one's pen―pervert the truth―falsify the facts―misrepresent the state of things
事実を曲げる
to pervert the truth―falsify the facts―wrest the facts―distort the facts―misrepresent the facts―juggle with facts―take liberties with facts
文意を曲げて解釈する
to strain the interpretation of a passage―stretch the construction of a passage―put a false construction on a passage―put a false complexion on a passage―put false colours on a passage
言葉の意味を無理に曲げて使う
to wring a word from its meaning―twist a word into some meaning not its own
理を非に曲げる
to talk right into wrong―talk black into white
情によって判断を曲げる
to allow passion to influence one's judgment
意を曲げる
to yield to another's views―act against one's will―act against one's judgment
(非と知りつつ)曲げて依頼に応じた
I complied with his request against my better judgment.
そこを一つ曲げてご承諾下さるわけにはいくまいか
Couldn't you consent against your will?―Couldn't you bring yourself to consent?
いくら曲げてもそのご相談には応じかねる
I can not bring myself to accept your offer.

content: 3. (=向ける)to turn; to bend; to direct

content.content: 歩をまげる
to turn one's steps―bend one's steps―direct one's steps―to ward some place
駕をまげる
to call on one―pay one a visit

content: 4. (=質に置く)to pawn (one's property)

まけんき〔負けん気〕
〈名〉An unyielding spirit

content.content: あの女は負けん気者だ
She is a woman of spirit.
負けん気の小僧だ
He is a lad of spirit.

まご〔孫〕
〈名〉A grandchild:(男は)a grandson:(女は)a granddaughter

content:
まご〔馬子〕
〈名〉A pack-horse man; a pack-horse leader

content.content: 馬子にも衣装
“Clothes make the man.”

まごい〔真鯉〕
〈名〉The black carp; the common carp

content:
まごころ〔真心〕
〈名〉A true heart; a whole heart; a single heart; sincerity; devotion

content.content: 彼は真心がある
He is true-hearted―sincere.
彼は真心が無い
He is false-hearted―insincere.
彼は真心をもって君に仕えた
He served his lord with a whole heart―He devoted his heart and soul to the service of his lord.
真心をもって国事に奔走した
He interested himself in the affairs of state with a single heart.
彼女は真心を込めて夫を愛した
She loved her husband with devotion―She was devoted to her husband.
彼の言うことは真心から出る
His words flow from his heart.
彼は何事にも真心を捧げる質だ
He goes, heart and soul, into any scheme.

content:
まごつく
〈自動〉
1. (=うろたえる)to lose one's presence of mind; to lose one's head; to be bewildered; to be confused; to be perplexed; to be puzzled; to be at a loss (for something); to be straitened (for something); to be embarrassed (for something)

content.content: 急に不幸に逢ってまごついた
I was bewildered at my sudden misfortune―Meeting with a sudden misfortune, I did not know which way to turn.
急に尋ねられてちょっと返答にまごついた
At the sudden question, I was at a loss for an answer―I was confused by the suddenness of the question.
彼は免職になって食うにまごついている
He has lost his place, and is straitened for means of livelihood―embarrassed for a living.
急報に接して役人達はまごついて為すところを知らなかった
At the sudden news, the officials lost their heads―lost their presence of mind―and did not know what to do.
彼はどんな問題が出てもまごつかない
No problem can perplex him―No question can puzzle him.
日本はいつ戦争が始まってもまごつかない
Japan is always prepared for war.
真人はどんな境遇に立ってもまごつかない
A true man is found in his place everywhere.
金さえありゃどこへ行ってもまごつかない
Money will make all right anywhere.

content: 2. (=うろつく)to wander about (a place); to hang about (a place); to knock about (a place)

content.content: 今時分どこをまごついていたのか
What have you been knocking about at this time of day?
彼はまだ口が無くてまごついている
He is still unemployed and at a loose end―adrift.
彼は主人から暇が出てまごついている
He has been turned adrift.

content: 3. (=下手遣る、失錯する)to blunder; to commit a blunder; to mistake

content.content: 人間は一度まごつくと止め度無くまごつくものだ
If a man blunders once, he will commit a series of blunders.
人間は始めまごつくと一生うだつが上がらない
If one makes a wrong start in life, he will never get on―(他動詞構文にすれば)―A wrong start in life will prevent a man from rising in the world.

content: 4. (=気を付けない)to be careless; to be heedless

content.content: 下手まごつくと損をするぞ
If I don't take care, I may lose.
下手まごつくと資本までも無くしてしまうぞ
If you don't take heed, you may lose your capital.
下手まごつくとやり損なうぞ
Take care, or you will spoil the game.
下手まごつくと取返しのつかないことになるぞ
Take heed, or you will commit a fatal blunder.

content:
まこと〔誠〕
〈名〉
1. (=真実)truth:(=の) true

content.content: 誠を重んずる
to have a regard for truth
彼は誠を重んぜぬ(嘘をつく)
He has no regard for truth.
これはまことの話だ
This is a true story.
まことを言えば彼はばかだ
To tell the truth, he is a fool.
嘘から出たまこと
Truth comes out of falsehood―“Many a true word is spoken in jest.”

content: 2. (=真性)genuineness; truth:(=の) genuine; true

content.content: 彼こそまことの日本人だ
He is a true Japanese―a genuine Japanese―a Japanese to the backbone.
まことの勇気
true courage―genuine courage

content: 3. (=誠意)sincerity; truth:(=の) sincere; true

content.content: 誠ある友
a sincere friend―a true friend
心だに誠の
If but thy heart be e'er sincere,
道にかないなば
And follow Truth's way,
祈らずとても
The gods shall watch o'er thy career,
神や守らん
E'en though thou never pray.

content: 4. (=実意)fidelity; faithfulness; truth:(=の) faithful; true

content.content: 傾城に誠無し
A harlot has no truth in her.
女郎に誠あらば晦日に月が出る
A harlot is as full of truth as a fish is of feathers.

content:
まことしやか〔誠しやか〕
〈形〉Seemingly true; plausible; specious

content.content: まことしやかな言い訳だ
It is a plausible excuse.
まことしやかな話だ
It is a specious story.
彼の言うことはたいそうまことしやかだ
He talks with much plausibility―with much show of truth.

content:
まことに〔誠に〕
〈副〉
1. (=実に)truly; in truth; indeed

content.content: まことによろしい
Very good, indeed!
まことにさようでございます
It is truly as you say.
まことに困りました
In truth, I am at a loss how to act.

content: 2. (=大いに)very; much; quite

content.content: まことに好くできました
It is very well done.
ここはまことに温かです
It is quite warm here.
そりゃまことに結構です
I am very glad to hear you say so―I am very much pleased at it.
そりゃまことに残念です
I am very sorry to hear it.

content:
まごまごする
〈自動〉
1. (=うろたえる)to lose one's presence of mind; to lose one's head; to be bewildered; to be flurried; to be confused; to be in confusion; to be thrown into confusion

content.content: 女子どもは逃げ場を失ってただまごまごして駈けまわっておった
The women and children, seeing no way of escape, were running about in confusion.
敵は不意を打たれてただまごまごするばかりであった
The enemy, taken by surprise, were thrown into confusion.
まごまごして逃げた
They fled in confusion―in a confused manner.
火事と聞いて皆まごまごして何一つ出す者が無かった
At the cry of“Fire!” they lost their heads, and no one thought of bringing away the furniture.
彼はどんなことがあってもまごまごするようなことは無い
Nothing can confuse him―Nothing can bewilder him―Nothing can flurry him―He never loses his head―He always keeps his head.
まごまごするな
Look alive!―Look sharp!
まごまごするとぶん殴るぞ
Look alive, or I'll give it you!
まごまごするとこちらが負けそうだ
I may get beaten if I don't look sharp.

content: 2. (=うろつく)to wander about (a place); to hang about (a place); to knock about (a place)

content.content: 何をまごまごしているか
What are you hanging about here for?
今時分どこをまごまごしていたか
Where have you been knocking about at this time of day?

content:
まさか〔豈夫〕
〈副〉Surely (must, can not); (can not) possibly, by any possibility

content.content: まさか(!)
Surely not!―Impossible!―You don't say so!
まさか本当じゃあるまい
Surely it can not be true―It can not by any possibility be true.
彼はまさかそんなことは言うまい
Surely he can not have said so―He can not possibly have said so―He can scarcely have said so.
まさかそんな卑劣なことはすまい
Surely he must be above such baseness.
まさかそうでもあるまい
Surely it can't be so―It can not possibly be so.
彼はまさかそんなことはすまい
Surely he can not have done such a thing―He can not possibly have done such a thing―He is the last man to do such a thing.
なんぼ因業な高利貸でもまさかそんな無理は言うまい
Surely the most unconscionable usurer can not be so unreasonable.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 君はまさか本当にそんなことをするのじゃあるまい
You don't mean to say that you are really going to do such a thing.
僕はまさかそんなことはできないよ
I can't think of doing such a thing.
彼女は死ぬ死ぬとは言ったものの今となってはまさか死ぬにも死なれず
She often talked of dying but she can not think of doing so at this time of day.
病人が治ると聞いてまさかと思った
When I was told that invalid would recover, I dared not hope for its truth―I did not know what dared hope.
まさかと思ったがやはり本当だった
I dared not hope for its truth,―I thought my hopes were too wild,―but is has proved true after all.
まさかと思った望みがかなった
My wildest hopes have been fulfilled.

content:
まさかのときに〔まさかの時に〕
〈副〉In case of need; in time of need; at need; in the day of trouble; in the hour of danger; in the moment of peril; in case of emergency; in (an) emergency

content.content: あのような人はまさかの時に役に立つ
Such men will prove of service in time of need.
まさかの時に頼みになる人だ
He is a trusty friend.
あんな人はまさかの時に役に立たぬ
Such men will fail you in the day of trouble.
まさかの時に頼みにならぬ人だ
He is a fair-weather friend.
畳の上の水練はまさかの時に役に立たぬ
Theories will not avail you in the hour of danger―in the moment of peril.
女ながらもまさかの時にや
Woman as I am, I may be of help in case of emergency.
まさかの時には国家にご奉公する覚悟だ
I am ready to serve my country in an emergency―in emergency.
まさかの時のご奉公をする
to do yeoman's service
まさかの時に備える
to provide against the time of need
まさかの時の備えに貯金する
to save money against the time of need―lay by against a rainy day
この金はまさかの時の備えに貯えておいたのだ
I have put aside the money against the time of need.

まさかり〔鉞〕
〈名〉A large axe

content:
まさご〔真砂〕
〈名〉Sand

content.content: 浜の真砂
the sand on the seashore
浜の真砂は尽きるとも
The countless sands may pass from off the shore,
世に盗人の尽きまじ
But yet thieves will have their day for e'er

content:
まさしく〔正しく〕
〈副〉Certainly; as sure as I am alive; as sure as eggs is eggs; without doubt; without question; without dispute

content.content: これはまさしく彼の仕業だ
This is certainly his doing.
これをしたのはまさしく彼だ
It is he that has done it.
この筆蹟はまさしく田中だ
This handwriting is certainly Tanaka's.
これを書いたのはまさしく田中だ
It is Tanaka who has written it.
彼が行ったのはまさしくこの路だ
It is this road that he has taken―He has taken this road without doubt.
盗んだのはまさしく彼だ
It is he who has stolen it―He is the thief, as sure as I am alive.

content:
まさつ〔摩擦〕
〈名〉Friction; rubbing; chafing:(=する) to rub (the feet―one thing against another); to chafe (the skin, etc.)

content.content: 摩擦は熱を生じ電気を起こす
Friction produces heat and generates electricity.
摩擦電気
frictional electricity
油を差すと摩擦を減ずる
Lubrication diminishes the friction.
木片を摩擦すると火が出る
Rubbing two pieces of wood will make a fire.
毛が生えるのは皮膚の摩擦を防ぐためである
Hair grows to prevent the chafing of the skin.
冷水摩擦
cold-water rubbing
僕は毎朝冷水摩擦をやる
I rub myself down with cold water―take a douche and rud-down―every morning.
摩擦術
massage

content:
まさに〔将に〕
〈副〉(To be) about to (do something); on the point of (falling); on the brink of (ruin); on the verge of (bankruptcy); on the eve of (destruction, etc.)

content.content: 日まさに西山に入りなんとす
The sun is about to sink below the horizon.
汽車はまさに発車せんとする処であった
I found the train on the point of starting.
城がまさに陥落せんとする処へ援軍が来た
The reinforcement arrived when the castle was on the point of falling.
彼はまさに破滅せんとする時に助けられた
He was saved when he was on the brink of ruin.
あの銀行はまさに破産せんとしている
The bank is on the brink of failure―on the verge of failure―on the eve of failure.

content:
まさに〔正に〕
〈副〉
1. (=滞り無く)duly

content.content: お手紙正に落手仕候
Your letter is duly to hand―I am duly in receipt of your favour.
金百円也右正に請取申候何某殿
Duly rec'd of Mr. A. B. the sum of 100 yen.

content: 2. (=ちょうど)just; exactly:(形容詞に訳せば) the very (thing, etc.)

content.content: 国を出て正に一年だ
It is just one year―exactly one year―one year to a day―since I left home.
英語仏語独語のできる人と言えば君こそ正にその人だ
A man who knows English, French and German,―why, you are the very man.
正に然り
Exactly―(古文体にては)―Even so.

content: 3. (=全く)really; truly:(形容詞に訳せば) the very (fact); downright (swindle); positive (nuisance); sheer (nonsense); complete (failure, etc.)

content.content: これは正に事実だ
It is the very truth.
正に詐欺だ
It is a downright swindle.
彼は正に発狂だ
He is downright mad.
彼に正に刑法の罪人である
He is a positive criminal under the penal laws.
これは正に醜聞だ
It is a positive scandal―a sheer scandal.
事業は正に失敗だ
The enterprise is a complete failure.

content:
まさに〔当に、方に〕
〈副〉Properly; naturally:(助動詞に訳せば)ought; should

content.content: 彼はまさに謝罪すべきである(謝罪は当然の義務)
He ought to apologize―It is proper that he should apologize.
借りたものはまさに返すべきである
One ought to pay what one owes―It is proper that one should pay what one owes.
あのような勉強家はまさに成功すべきである(成功は当然の結果)
Such a hard-working man ought to succeed―It is quite natural that such a hard-working man should succeed.
まさに処置を施すべき時である
It is high time that some measure should be taken.
この人にして称賛の価値は無くばまさに誰あるべきか
It he does not deserve praise, who else should?

content:
まさに〔当に、方に〕
〈副〉Properly; naturally:(助動詞に訳せば)ought; should

content.content: 彼はまさに謝罪すべきである(謝罪は当然の義務)
He ought to apologize―It is proper that he should apologize.
借りたものはまさに返すべきである
One ought to pay what one owes―It is proper that one should pay what one owes.
あのような勉強家はまさに成功すべきである(成功は当然の結果)
Such a hard-working man ought to succeed―It is quite natural that such a hard-working man should succeed.
まさに処置を施すべき時である
It is high time that some measure should be taken.
この人にして称賛の価値は無くばまさに誰あるべきか
It he does not deserve praise, who else should?

content:
マザマザ
〈副〉Vividly; distinctly

content.content: その場がマザマザと見えるように記憶している
I have a vivid recollection of the scene.
マザマザと想像する
to have a vivid imagination―have one's imagination full of body and colour
マザマザと見える
It is distinctly visible.
マザマザしい嘘をつく
to tell circumstantial lies

content:
まさむね〔正宗〕
〈名〉A Masamune blade

content.content: 彼に持たせると鈍刀も正宗
A dull blade becomes a Masamune in his hands.

content: 〈形〉Worn-out (clothes)

content.content: 着物は正宗、肌は村正
My clothes are worn out, and my skin is mottled with cold.

まさめ〔柾目〕
〈名〉Straight grain (of wood)

content:
まさゆめ〔正夢〕
〈名〉A true dream

content.content: 夢は正夢であった
My dream has come true.

content:
まさり〔勝り〕
〈接尾詞〉(=何勝り)(One) superior to (some one)

content.content: あの女は男勝りだ
She is more of a man than many a man.
男勝りの女
a strong-minded woman―a termagant―a virago
彼は親勝りだ
He has outdone his father―He is “a white egg laid by a black hen.”
筍親勝り
“A black hen lays a white egg.”
君は医者勝りだ
You should have been a physician.

content:
まざり〔混ざり〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: まじり〔混り〕

content:
まさる〔勝る〕
〈他動〉To surpass (the other in some quality); to exceed (the other in quantity or magnitude); to excel (the other in English); to best (the other in mathematics); to outdo (one's master); to outvie (one's rival); to outdistance (all competitors); to eclipse (the others); to bear the palm over (one's rival); to be superior to (the other); to be preferable to (dishonour); to be better than (nothing); to be above (wealth); to have an advantage over (the other); to be an improvement on (the last)

content.content: 器量では妹は姉に勝る
The younger sister surpasses the elder in beauty―The younger sister is more beautiful than the elder.
力量象に勝る動物無し
No animal surpasses the elephant in strength―No animal is stronger than the elephant.
大きさではロンドンはどこの都会にも勝る
London exceeds any other city in size―London is larger than any other city.
学問では甲ははるかに乙に勝る
A far surpasses B in scholarship―A is a far better scholar than B―A is by far the better scholar of the two―A is out of sight the better scholar of the two.
品質においてはこの品はあの品に勝る
This article is superior to the other in quality.
こちらが明らかに勝っている
This is decidedly superior.
健康は富に勝る
Health is better than wealth―Health is above wealth.
予防は治療に勝る
Prevention is better than cure.
言わぬは言うに勝る
Silence is better than speech―“Speech is silvern, silence is golden.”
知らざるは誤るに勝る
Ignorance is better than error―“Better untaught than ill-taught”
死は恥に勝る
Death is preferable to dishonour.
人は死すべき時に死せざれば死に勝る恥あり
If a man does not die when he ought to, he will have to endure dishonour worse than death―A man must sometimes choose between death and dishonour.
有るは無いに勝る
Something is better than nothing.
どんな職業でも無いに勝る
Any occupation is better than none.
英語でも知っていれば知らないには勝る
If you know English, it is better than nothing―It is something to know English.
英語では甲は乙に勝るが数学では劣る
A beats B in English, but B beats A in mathematics.
鉄船は種々の点において木船に勝る
An iron ship has several advantages over a wooden one.
鉄船の木船に勝る主なる点はその堅牢にして軽きことである
The chief advantages of an iron ship over a wooden one are its strength and lightness.
この作文は前のに勝る
This composition is an improvement on your last.
熟練は力量に勝る
Skill is an advance on strength.
風景においては日本に勝る国は無い
No country surpasses Japan in scenery―For scenery, there is no country like Japan.
我が家に勝る処無し
“There is no place like home.”
聞きしに勝る風景だ
The beauty of scenery exceeds expectation―exceeds my expectations.
その美に勝るもの無し
Nothing can exceed its beauty―Nothing can be more beautiful.

まさる〔増さる〕
〈自動〉To increase

content:
まざる〔混ざる〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: まじる〔混る〕

content:
まし〔勝し〕
〈形〉Preferable (to); better (than)

content.content: 恥を掻くなら死んだほうがましだ

Death is preferable to dishonour―I should prefer death to dishonour―I should choose death before dishonour―I would rather die than live in dishonour―I would sooner die than live in dishonour―I would as soon die as live in dishonour.
どんな仕事でも遊んでいるにはましだ
Any work is preferable to idleness―better than idleness.
どんな職業でも無いよりましだ
Any occupation is better than none.
何でも有る方が無いよりましだ
Anything is better than nothing.
英語でも知っていれば知らないにはましだ
If you know English, it is better than nothing―It is something to know English.
(子どもに用をさして)猫よりましだ
You are more useful than a cat.

content:
まし〔増し〕
〈名〉Increase; addition; extra:(形容詞に用いれば) additional; extra

content.content: 二割増し
an increase of 20 percent
郵券代用一割増し
ten percent extra if paid in postage stamps
増し賃銀
additional wages―extra pay
増し時間
overtime

content: 〈接尾詞〉

content.content: 日増しに温かになる
It grows daily warmer―It grows warmer and warmer every day.
一年増しに美しくなる
She becomes yearly more beautiful―She becomes more and more beautiful every year.

content:
まじえる〔交える〕
〈他動〉To mix(の意味なれどもかく訳す場合無し)

content.content: 言葉を交える
to bandy words with one―talk with one
戦いを交える
to join battle
砲火を交える
to exchange fire
刃を交える
to cross swords with one
兵を交える、千戈を交える
to go to war with―wage war with―fight with―some power
両国は境を交えている
The two countries border on each other.
頭髪霜を交えている
His hair is shot with gray.
膝を交えて語る
to have a familiar talk with one

ましかく〔真四角〕
〈名〉A true square

content:
ました〔真下〕
〈副詞、前置詞相当〉Right under

content.content: 橋の真下が一番に深い
The river is deepest right under the bridge.

content:
まして〔況して〕
〈副〉Still more; much more; how much more:(打消に続けば)still less; much less; how much less:(肯定、否定ともに)to say nothing of; not to speak of; not to mention

content.content: 金持ちの君でさえ働くなら僕などはましてだ
If you, a rich man, works, how much more must I?
鳥にさえ反哺の孝ありまして人間やだ
If a bird shows its filial piety by feeding its parents, how much more should man?
まして凡夫の我々が
How much more so with us ordinary mortals!
彼は人並みの楽もできないましてぜいたくをやだ
He can not afford the ordinary comforts of life much less luxuries―to say nothing of luxuries.
彼は代数機何もろくに知らないまして微積分をやだ
He does not know algebra and geometry well, still less calculus―not to speak of calculus.
君にさえできない問題ならまして僕にできるはずがあろうか
If you can not solve the problem, how much less ought I?―how ought I?

content:
まじない〔呪い〕
〈名〉A charm; a spell; incantation; conjuration

content.content: まじないをする
to conjure―charm―use a charm
足のしびれを直すまじない
a charm against pins and needles
けがをせぬまじないをする
to use a charm against accidents
これは何かのおまじないですか
It is a charm against anything?
何のおまじないですか
What is it a charm against?
まじないで病気を直す
to charm away an illness―conjure away an illness
まじないで人を縛る
to cast a spell over one―lay one under a spell―spellbind one
まじないで縛られた
I am spellbound.
まじないを解く
to dissolve the spell―break the spell

content:
まじなう〔呪う〕
〈自他動〉To conjure; to charm; to spellbind (one); to cast a spell over (one); to lay (one) under a spell

content.content: まじない出す
to conjure up (a feast, etc.)
まじない去る
to conjure away―charm away―(an illness, etc.)

content:
ましに〔増しに〕
〈接尾詞〉More and more... every...

content.content: あの娘は一年増しに美しくなる
She becomes more and more beautiful every year―She becomes yearly more beautiful.
日増しに温かになる
It grows warmer and warmer every day―It grows daily warmer.
十斤増しに三十銭
thirty sen for every additional ten pounds

まじまじする
〈自動〉To blink; to wink

content:
まします〔坐す〕
〈自動〉(Honorific for) to be

content.content: 天にまします我らの父よ
“Our Father which art in Heaven!”
ここに鎮座ましますは天照大神なり
Here is enshrined the great Sun-goddess―This shrine is sacred to the great Sun-goddess.

content:
まじめ〔真面目〕
〈形〉
1. (=笑わぬ真面目)grave; serious; solemn:(=に) gravely; seriously; solemnly

content.content: まじめ顔
a grave face―a serious look―a solemn air
まじめな顔をする
to look grave―put on a grave look―assume a serious air
彼は非常にまじめな顔をしている
He is as grave as a judge.
まじめ過ぎる
He is too grave―grave to sadness.
平生はまじめだが酔うと冗談を言う
He is grave at other times, but funny over his cups.
まじめな顔をして冗談を言う
He has a dry humour.
彼はまじめな顔をしてそんなばかばかしいことを言っている
He gravely says such absurd things.
君はよくそんなまじめな顔をしてそんな嘘がつけるね
How can you tell such a story with such a grave face?
彼はあんなまじめな顔をしているがなかなか隅に置けぬ
He looks as grave as a judge, but he is a devil of a fellow.
あの人はまじめくさっている
He looks solemn―He has a solemn air.
まじめくさった顔をする
to put on a solemn look―assume a solemn air
まじめな顔をくずさぬ
to keep one's gravity―keep one's countenance
(おかしくて)まじめな顔をしておれなかった
I could not keep my gravity―I had much ado to keep my countenance.
まじめな顔をくずさせる
to upset one's gravity
その光景を見て皆まじめな顔をくずした
The sight upset our gravity.

content: 2. (=冗談でないまじめ)earnest; serious; sincere; matter-of-fact:(=に) earnestly; seriously; sincerely

content.content: 君は冗談でなくまじめにそんなことを言うのか
Are you in earnest?―Are you not in joke―Are you not in jest?―Are you not in fun?―Do you mean what you say?
冗談じゃないまじめに言うのだ
I am in earnest―I mean what I say.
僕が冗談に言ったことを彼はまじめに取ったのだ
He took seriously what I said in joke.
誰も君の言うことをまじめに取る人は無い
No one will take you seriously.
彼は物事を真面目に考える
He takes things seriously.
物事はそうまじめに考えるものでない
Things should not be treated so seriously.
君は人生を真面目に考え過ぎる
You take life too seriously.
人生ほどまじめなものは無い
Nothing is so serious as life.
まじめなことを茶にしちゃ困る
You must no make light of a serious matter.
あれはまじめな男だ
He is an earnest man.
まじめに働く
He goes about his business in earnest―He is earnest in his endeavours.
君はまじめに勉強さえすればきっと出世する
If you would only be earnest in your endeavours, you would be sure to get on.
本人は大まじめだ(真剣だ)
He is in sober earnest―in sad earnest―in dead earnest.
あの人はきまじめでしゃれなどはわからぬ
He is a matter-of-fact man, and can not enter into a joke.
君はよっぽどまじめな人だね
What a matter-of-fact man you are!
個人がまじめでなければまじめな社会はできぬ
Insincere individuals can not make a sincere society.
まじめでない国民は大国民にはなれぬ
An insincere people can not make a great nation.

content: 3. (=酒に酔わぬ真面目)sober (countenance)

content.content: 今日はおまじめですね
You are sober today.
あの人はいつもまじめだ
He is (a man) of sober habits.
年をとってまじめになった
He has sobered down with age.

content: 4. (=気違いでない真面目)sane (man); sound (mind)

content.content: 僕は(精神に異状はない)まじめだ
I am sound in mind―in my right mind―in my senses.
こりゃまじめの沙汰ではないね
He can not be in his right mind―He can not be in his senses―He must be out of his senses―He must be out of his mind.
この計画は真面目の沙汰とは思われぬ
The scheme can not have originated with a man in his right mind.

content:
ましゃく〔間尺〕
〈名〉Measure

content.content: 間尺に合わぬ
It is too large or too small.
こんな仕事は間尺に合わぬ(割に合わぬ)
The work does not pay―The work is not work my while―I do not find my account in the work.
人のしたことを僕が叱られて間尺に合わぬ
It is hard that I must pay for what others have done.

content:
まじゅつ〔魔術〕
〈名〉Magic; sorcery; jugglery; conjuring

content.content: 魔術を行う
to deal in magic―practise sorcery―juggle―conjure
魔術師
a magician―a sorcerer―a juggler―a conjuror

content:
ましょう
〈助動詞〉Will; shall; let us

content.content: 行きましょう
I will go.
さあ行きましょう
Let us go!
どうしましょう
What shall I do?
彼は今に来ましょう
He will be here presently.
戦争になりましょう
Will there be a war?

content:
ましょう〔魔性〕
〈名〉Diabolic nature; spiritual nature

content.content: 魔性のもの
a spirit―a spiritual being―a mysterious being
彼の命は魔性の命
He bears a charmed life.

ましらげ〔真精〕
〈名〉Superior cleaned rice

content:
まじり〔混り〕
〈名〉A mixture:(形容詞に用いれば)mixed with (something)

content.content: この米は砂混じりだ
This rice is mixed with sand.
あの人の話は嘘混じりだ
His stories are mixed with falsehood―dashed with imagination.
彼の頭は白髪混じりだ
His head is shot with gray.
彼の歎願は威し混じりだ
His entreaty is accompanied with threats.
彼の話しは漢語混じりだ
His talk bristles with Chinese expressions.
漢語混じりの演説
a speech bristling with Chinese expressions
彼の話しは冗談混じりだ
He talks in a jocular vein.

content:
まじりけ〔混り気〕
〈名〉A dash (of something)

content.content: この酒は何かの混じり気がある
This wine has a dash of something in it.
焼酎の混じり気がある
It has a dash of spirits in it―It is dashed with spirits.
混じり気の無い
pure―unalloyed
混じり気の無い悦びはこの世に無い
Pure joy―Unalloyed joy―is not to be found in this world.

content:
まじる〔混る〕
〈自動〉To mix, be mixed (with something); to mingle, be mingled (with something); to blend (with something); to be dashed (with something):(独りでに混るは)to become mixed; to get mixed

content.content: 油と水は混じらぬ
Oil does not mix with water.
彼は世間の人と混じらぬ
He does not mix with the multitude―mingle with the crowd.
書類が混じらぬように頼む
See that the papers do not become mixed.
この米には砂か混じっている、砂が混じっておらぬ
This rice is mixed with sand―free from sand.
この牛乳には水(白水)が混じっている
The milk is mixed with water―(混ぜ物がしてあるの意味なら)―adulterated with water.
この火酒には水が混じっている
The spirits are mixed with water―(水が混じって薄くなっているの意味なら)―diluted with water.
この酒には少し焼酎が混じっている
This wine is dashed with spirits―This wine has a dash of spirits in it.
あの人の話は嘘が混じっている
His accounts are mixed with falsehood―dashed with imagination.
男女がごちゃごちゃに混じった
Men and women were mixed up pell-mell.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 男の子の中に女の子が混じっていた
There were some girls among the boys.
群衆の中に女も混じっていた
There were some women in the crowd.
彼は群集に混じって見えなくなった
He was lost in the crowd.
聴衆の中には婦人が混じっていた
The audience was sprinkled with fair faces―There was a sprinkling of fair faces among the audience.
先生もいっしょに混じって遊戯をやる
The teacher joins in the games.
彼は皆の話しに混じらぬ
He does not join in their talk.
五年生もいっしょに混じって騒いだ
The Fifth Year students joined in the riot.

content:
まじわり〔交り〕
〈名〉Intercourse; association; society; company; friendship; acquaintance:(交際関係の意味なら)relations; terms

content.content: 彼との交わりは学校時代からだ
My intercourse with him dates from our school-days.
交わりを結ぶ
to contract a friendship with one―form an acquaintance with a person―make one's acquaintance
交わりを求める
to cultivate one's friendship―seek one's society―pay court to a person―go after a man
彼は人に交わりを求められる
He is much sought after―much run after.
彼は学者と交わりを求めている
He seeks the society of scholars.
交わりを絶つ
to break off friendship with one―sever acquaintanceship with one―sever connections with one―cut connections with one―renounce one's friendship―renounce a friend
二人の交わりは親密だ
They are on intimate terms with each other―Intimate relations subsist between the two.
君子の交わりは淡き事水の如し
“Great men meet as water meets water.”
刎頸の交わり、断金の交わり
eternal friendship―sworn friends―devoted friends―Damon and Pythias―David and Jonathan
刎頸の交わりを誓う
to vow eternal friendship
断金の交わりを結ぶ
to become sworn friends
二人は水魚の交わり
They are hand and glove with each other.
彼らは人交わりもできぬ身だ
They are cast out from society.
夫婦の交わり
marriage-bed―nuptial rites
男女の交わり
sexual intercourse

content:
まじわる〔交る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=人と交わる)to associate with (a person); to keep company with (one); to hold intercourse with (a person); to have relations with (a person); to deal with (men); to mix with (the multitude); to mingle with (the crowd); to consort with (one); to live with (foreigners); to go with (a set); to go among (strangers, etc.)

content.content: 道徳標準の低い者と交わるな
Do not associate with men of low moral standards.
彼は善い人と交わっている、悪い人と交わっている
He keeps good company―keeps bad company.
悪友と交わるな
Avoid bad company!
同等の者と交われ
Keep to the company of your equals!
彼は西洋人と多く交わっている
He lives much with foreigners.
僕は西洋人と交わらぬ
I do not go among foreigners.
僕はあの連中と交わらぬ
I do not go with that set.
彼とは交わったことが無い
I have had no relations with him.
二人は深く(親密に)交わっている
They are on intimate terms with each other―in intimate relations with each other.
彼は人と深く交わらない
He does not grow intimate with people.
彼は世間の人と交わらない
He does not mix with the multitude―mingle with the crowd.
超然として世と交わらぬ
He keeps aloof from the crowd.
彼は人と交わらぬ
He keeps to his own company―keeps to himself.
女と交わることが好きだ
He is fond of female society.
彼と交わる者が無い
Nobody associates with him―Nobody consorts with him.
他の学生らは彼と交わるのを恥じている
The other students are ashamed to be seen in his company.
僕と交わるのが恥かしいなら押しかけはせぬ
If you are ashamed to be seen in my company, I will not force myself upon you.
人の善悪はその交わる友を見て知れ
“A man is known by the company he keeps.”
朱に交われば赤くなる
He who mixes with vermilion will turn red―(に相当するは)―“He who touches pitch shall be defiled therewith.”

content: 2. (=交叉する)to cross (each other); to intersect (each other)

content.content: 両線相交わる
The two lines intersect (each other)―cross each other―run across each other.
二線の交わる点
the point of intersection of two lines―the junction of two lines
両河の交わる所
the confluence of two rivers

content:
ましん〔痳疹〕
〈名〉The measles

content.content: 痳疹にかかる
to catch the measles
子どもが痳疹にかかっている
The child has the measles.

まじん〔魔神〕
〈名〉A devil; Satan

content:
ます〔増す〕
〈自動〉(Numbers or quantities) increase; (debts) grow; (a river) rises; to gain (in weight)

content.content: 日本は人口が増す
The population of Japan increases―(と言うよりも通例)―Japan increases in population.
人数が増す
The number of men increases―The men increase in number.
人数が千人に増した
The number of men has increased to 1,000.
人数が百人(だけ)増した
The number of men has increased by 100.
品物の需要がだんだん増す方だ
The demand for the article is increasing―on the increase―growing greater.
河の水が増した
The river has risen.
体量が増した
I have gained in weight―put on weight.
体量が十斤増した
I have gained 10 pounds in weight―put on 10 pounds.

content: 〈他動〉To increase (the number or quantity); to add to (the value); to raise (the wages); to enlarge (one's possessions); to extend (one's territory)

content.content: 人数を増す必要がある
We must increase the number of men.
位置が好いから土地の価値を増す
The location adds to the value of the land.
賃銀を増してやる
I will raise your wages.
日本は領土を増した
Japan has enlarged her possessions―extended her territory.
帆を増す
to make sail

content:
ます〔桝〕
〈名〉
1. A measure

content.content: 桝で量る
to measure (corn, etc.)
そんな人間は桝で量るほどある
Such men are to be found by the bushel―by the cartload.
桝で売る
to sell by measure
あの店は桝が好い
They give good measure―give full measure―at that shop.
桝が悪い
They give bad measure―give short measure.
一升桝
a sho measure
不正桝
an unlawful measure―an illegal measure

content: 2. (=芝居の桝)a section (of the pit)

まず〔先ず〕
〈副〉
1. (=第一に)first; in the first place; to begin with; before everything

content.content: まず用事を片づけよう
I will first finish my business.
まず用をすましてしかる後に遊ぶ
“Business first and pleasure afterwards.”
まず第一にどんな本を読んだらよいでしょうか
What sort of books shall I read in the first place?
その人はまず第一に金持ちだ
He is rich, to begin with.
まず事の来歴から述べます
I shall begin with a history of the matter.
学生にはなにはさておきまず第一に学問が大事だ
A student should, before everything, attend to his studies.
刈り取らんとするにはまず種を蒔かなければならぬ
You must sow before you can reap.
教えんとするにはまず学ばなければならぬ
You must learn before you can teach.
将を射る者は先ず馬を射よ(に相当するは)
“If you would win the mistress, first bribe the maid.”

content: 2. (=凡そ) about

content.content: まずそんなものだろう
That's about it―That's about the size of it.
四十か、まずその辺のところだろう
Forty? He must be somewhere about that.

content: 3. (=まあ)it would seem; I should think; I should say; (let us) say

content.content: (あの人の年か)まず四十くらいだろうね
He must be forty, I should think―I should say.
あれでもまず学者だろうね
He is a scholar, it would seem.
行くとしたらまず次の日曜かね
Let us go―say, next Sunday.
費用はまず五十円かね
We shall need―say, fifty yen.

content: 4. (=ざっと)Something like

content.content: これならまず英語と言っても恥ずかしくなかろう
This is something like English.
これならまずステーションと言ってもよい
This is something like a station―some station.
これならまず結構だ、まず上等だ
This is something like.
僕にやらせりゃまずこんなものだ
This is something I can do―This is what I can do.

content: 5. (=かなり)fairly

content.content: これならまず上出来だ
It is fairly well done.
この写真はまず上出来の方だ
The photograph is fairly well taken.
この作文はまず上出来と言ってもよい
The composition is fairly well written.
まず無い
scarcely any―scarcely ever―hardly possible
そんな人はまず無い
There are scarcely any such men―few or no such men―few, if any, such men.
全快の見込はまず無い
There is scarcely any―little or no―little, if any,―hope of his recovery.
我が国には読み書きのできぬ者はまず無い
There are scarcely any―few or no―few, if any,―Japanese who can not read or write.
彼が本を開くことはまず無い
Ha scarcely ever―seldom or never―seldom, if ever,―opens a book.
彼が人と争うことはまず無い
He scarcely ever―rarely or never―rarely, if ever,―has words with any one.
そんなことはまず無いことだ
That is hardly possible―That can hardly happen.

content:
7. 
〈話頭填補語〉 Well; now

content.content: 仕事が片づいてまずこれでひと安心
Now, the work is off my hands.
まずこれなら満足だ
Well, I am satisfied with it.
まず今日はこれでよし
Well, that'll do for today.

content:
ますい〔麻酔〕
〈名〉Anaesthesia; narcosis:(=する) to be anaesthetized; to be narcotized; to be chloroformed; to be drugged:(=させる) to anaesthetize; to narcotize; to chloroform (a subject); to drug (a victim)

content.content: 局部麻酔
local anaesthesia

content:
まずい〔不味い〕
〈形〉
1. (=旨くない)unsavoury; unpalatable; insipid; vapid; nasty; tasteless; bad; poor; disagreeable to the taste

content.content: 料理がまずそうだから箸もつけなかった
The dishes appeared so unsavoury that I did not touch them.
あそこの料理はまずい
The cooking there is bad―The food they provide is poor.
この食物はまずい
This food does not taste good―This food does not eat well―I have no relish for this food―I do not enjoy this food.
今日は運動しないから飯がまずい
I have taken no exercise today, and have no appetite.
彼はまずそうにして飯を食っている
He eats his dinner with apparent disrelish.
まずそうな食物
untempting food―unappetizing food
悪いことを聞いて飯をまずくした
The bad news has spoiled my dinner.
ひもじい時にはまずいもの無し
“Nothing comes amiss to a hungry man”―“Hunger is the best sauce.”

content: 2. (=拙い)clumsy; awkward; unskilful; poor; bad

content.content: 僕は字がまずい
I write a poor hand.
彼は文章がまずい
He writes a poor style―writes a clumsy style.
彼は英語がまずい
He speaks poor English―speaks English poorly.
まずい細工だ
It is clumsy workmanship.
まずいしゃれだ
It is a bad pun―a poor joke.
うまいしゃれをまずく言う
to spoil a joke in the telling
まずい言い訳だ
It is a poor excuse―a lame excuse.
彼は応対がまずい
He has an awkward address.
君は見立てがまずい
You have made a bad choice―I do not admire your taste.
君はまずいことをやったね
You have bungled your work―made a mess of it.
これが親の耳に入ってはまずい
It would be awkward if the matter came to my father's ears.

content: 3. (=醜い)ugly; plain; homely

content.content: まずい面
an ugly face
あの女はまずい面だ
She is a plain woman―a homely woman.

content:
ますいざい〔麻酔剤〕
〈名〉An anaesthetic; a narcotic; an opiate; chloroform

content.content: 麻酔剤をかける
to put one under an anaesthetic―(手術を行うためなら)―chloroform a subject―(人を害するなら)―drug a victim
患者は麻酔剤をかけて手術を行った
The subject was chloroformed for the operation.
麻酔剤がさめる
to awake from chloroform―come out of chloroform
彼は麻酔剤をかけられて金品を奪われた
He was drugged and robbed.
酒に麻酔剤を入れる
to drug wine
その酒に麻酔剤が入っていた
The wine was drugged.
麻酔剤の入った酒
drugged wine

ますかがみ〔十寸鏡〕
〈名〉A clear mirror

ますざけ〔桝酒〕
〈名〉Sake drunk from the measure

content:
まずしい〔貧しい〕
〈形〉Poor; indigent; penurious; needy; destitute

content.content: 貧しくなる
to be reduced to poverty―reduced to want
貧しく暮らす
to live in poverty―lead a life of poverty
彼は貧しい家に生まれた
He was born poor―born to poverty.
貧しい家に人と為った
He was bred in poverty.

content:
ますはな〔増す花〕
〈名〉Another sweetheart; somebody in one's shoes; somebody in the wind

content.content: 外に増す花ができたらしい
Somebody must be standing in my shoes―There is somebody in the wind.

content:
ますます〔益々〕
〈副〉More and more; more than ever

content.content: 店はますます繁昌する
The business grows more and more prosperous.
景気はますます好くなる
The times grow better.
ますます悪くなる
Things grow worse and worse―Things are going from bad to worse.
学校はますます盛んだ
The school is more prosperous than ever.
彼はますます勉強している
He works harder than ever.
(その人は信者だと)それならますます好い
So much the better.
(その上病気だ)そりゃますます悪い
So much the worse.
(酒を止めて焼酎を始めた)そりゃますます悪い
That is going from bad to worse.
登るに従ってますます寒くなる
The higher up you go,the colder is becomes.
下るに従ってますます熱くなる
The lower down you go, the hotter it becomes.
有れば有るだけますます欲しくなる
The more you have, the more you want.
多々ますます弁ず
The more the better.

content:
ますめ〔桝目〕
〈名〉(Good or bad) measure

content.content: あの店が桝目が好い
They give good measure―give measure―at that shop.
桝目が悪い、桝目を盗む
They give bad measure―give short measure.
桝目で売る
to sell by measure

ますらお〔丈夫〕
〈名〉A man of might; a mighty man

content:
まする〔摩する〕
〈他動〉To scrape

content.content: 天を摩する
to scrape the sky
天を摩する高楼
a sky-scraper
天を摩する峰
a sky-kissing peak

まぜあわせる〔混ぜ合わせる〕
〈他動〉To mix (thing) together

content:
まぜこぜ〔混ぜこぜ〕
〈名〉A confused mixture; a jumble; a huddle; a medley:(=に) pell-mell

content.content: 混ぜこぜに入り混じっている
They are intermixed pell-mell―promiscuously.
混ぜこぜにする
to mix up―jumble together―huddle together
善いのも悪いのも混ぜこぜになっている
The good and bad are mixed up―jumbled together―huddled together―It is an indiscriminate mixture.

content:
ませた
〈形〉Precocious (child); forward (girl); pert (miss)

content.content: 僕はませた子は嫌いだ
I don't like a precocious child―an old head on young shoulders.
あの子はませている
She looks older than her age.

content:
まぜっかえし〔混ぜっ返し〕
〈名〉Scoffing; interruption

content.content: 混ぜっ返しを言うな
No interruption, please!―Do not interrupt me in my talk!
混ぜ返し屋
a scoffer

content:
まぜっかえす〔混ぜっ返す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=掻き混ぜる)to mix by stirring; to stir up
2. (=嘲弄して妨害する)to scoff at (religion); to make fun of (what one says); to interrupt (one's talk)

content.content: 彼の説教を混ぜっ返しに来る者までも感服して帰る
Those who come to scoff at his sermons, remain to pray.
そう一々混ぜっ返されちゃ話しができない
You make fun of everything I say.
人の話しを混ぜっ返す
to interrupt one's talk―interrupt one in one's talk
混ぜっ返しちゃいかん
Do not interrupt me!―No interruption, please!

content:
まぜもの〔混ぜ物〕
〈名〉Mixture; admixture; alloy; adulteration

content.content: 葡萄酒などに混ぜものをする
to adulterate wine―doctor wine―load wine
この葡萄酒に混ぜものがある
The wine is adulterated―doctored―loaded.

content:
まぜる〔混ぜる〕
〈他動〉To mix (two things―one thing with another); to mingle (two kinds―one kind with another); to blend (two colours―one colour with another); to alloy (two metals―one metal with another); to cross (two breeds―one breed with another); to dash (water with brandy); to adulterate (wine with something); to dilute (whiskey with water)

content.content: この牛乳には水(白水)が混ぜてある
This milk is mixed with water―adulterated with rice-water.
このウイスキーには水が混ぜてある
The whisky is mixed with water―diluted with water.
米に砂を混ぜて搗く
Rice is cleaned by mixing it with sand.
話に嘘を混ぜる
to mix one's story with falsehood―dash one's story with imagination
青に黄を混ぜると緑ができる
We get green by mixing blue with yellow―mixing blue and yellow.
酒に火酒を混ぜる
to dash wine with spirits
水にブランデーを混ぜて一杯お上がり
Drink a glass of water with a dash of brandy in it.

content:
また〔股〕
〈名〉The fork (of human legs):(=を) between one's legs

content.content: 股を拡げる
to spread one's legs
股を拡げてかけるものではない
You should not sit with your legs wide apart.
人の股を潜る
to creep between one's legs―(恥を忍ぶ意味なら)―eat dirt―eat humble-pie
大股に歩く
to walk with long strides
彼は六十余州を股にかけて歩いている
He travels all over Japan.
世界を股にかけて歩く
to knock about the world
満洲を股にかけて荒らした大賊だ
He is a notorious burglar whose feats extend over Manchuria.
彼は東京と田舎を股にかけて暮らしている
He passes his time between town and country.

content:
また〔叉〕
〈名〉A fork; a crotch

content.content: 木の叉
the fork of a tree―the crotch of a tree
木の叉から生まれもせず
I am made of flesh and blood.
木の叉からでも生まれしゃんしたか
Are you not made of flesh and blood?
道の叉
the fork of a road
道が叉になる
A road forks.
河の叉
the fork of a river
二叉大根
a forked radish

content:
また〔亦〕
〈副〉
1. (主格を形容して、...もまた)too likewise:(打消に伴えば)either

content.content: 彼もまた好人物だ
He is a good-natured man, too.
君は小説が好きか僕もまた小説が好きだ
I am fond of novels, too―So am I.
君はこの本を読んだか僕もまた読んだ
I have read it, too―So have I.
君の親父も酒を飲むか僕の親父もまた飲む
My father drinks, too―So does my father.
君も行かなかったか僕もまた行かなかった
I did not go, either―Neither did I―Nor did I―Nor I either.
君も朝起きでないか僕もまた朝起きでない
I am not an early-riser, either―Neither am I―Nor am I―Nor I either.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 俺がばかなら貴様もまたそうだ
If I am a fool, you are another.
彼もまた一種の天才と言うべし
He is a genius in his way.
身の上話もまた一興
The story of your life must be interesting.

content: 2. (目的語を形容して、...をもまた)also; likewise; as well:(打消に伴えば)either

content.content: (彼は英語はもちろんだが)また独払もできる
He knows German and French also―as well.
英語はもちろんまた独払もできる
He knows German and French as well as English.
彼は話しが上手なばかりでなくまた文章も上手だ
He not only speaks well,but also writes well.
彼は知識もありまた経験もある
He has not only knowledge, but also experience―He has experience as well as knowledge.
正直でまた才子である
He is honest,and clever as well―He is clever as well as honest―He is as clever as he is honest.
(独語仏語はもちろん)また英語もできない
He does not know English, either.
僕は歌はやらぬ、また舞踏もやらぬ
I do not sing; I do not dance, either―I do not sing nor do I dance.

content:
3. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 僕は金持ちでない、また金持ちになりたいとも思わぬ
I am not rich, nor do I wish to be.
僕は洋行はしない、またしたいとも思わぬ
I have never been abroad, nor do I wish to go.
彼は経済が下手だ、また上手になろうともせぬ
He is a poor economist, nor does he try to improve himself.

content:
また〔又、復〕
〈副〉
1. (=再び)again; once more; another time; a second time for the second time

content.content: 同じことがまたあった
The same thing has happened again―The same thing has happened a second time―The same thing has happened for the second time.
またいらっしゃい
Call again!
彼はいつまた来ると言ったか
When did he say he would call again?
今晩また伺います
I shall call again this evening―I shall return in the evening.
また雨かね
Are we going to have another rain?
あのような人はまたと見られぬ
We shall never eyes on his like again.
別れてもまた逢う
We part only to meet again.
また花の咲く春もあろう
I may again be at the top of Fortune's wheel.
今度失敗してもまた機会がある
Even if I fail this time, I shall have another chance.
また光りました
There was another flash!
また地震
There was another shock!
一杯一杯また一杯
Another and another glass.
思う事一つ叶えばまた一つ
One desire fulfilled gives rise to another.
それからまた話しを始めた
Then we resumed our talk.
先生、いつまた仕事を始めることができましょうか
Doctor, when shall I be able to resume my work?
また黙り込んでしまった
He has relapsed into silence.
こんな機会はまたと無い
Such an opportunity will never occur again.
あのような美人は世にまたと無い
She is a peerless beauty―a matchless beauty.
こんな風景はまたと無い
The scenery is unequalled―unparallelled.
あんな人は世にまたと無い
He is unique.

content: 2. (=またその上に)and also; besides; moreover; what is more

content.content: 彼は軍人でまた経世家だ
He is a soldier, and also a statesman―He is a statesman as well as a soldier.
彼は経世家でもなければまた政治家でもない
He is neither a statesman nor a politician.
またあそこには用も有る
Besides, I have business there.
また注意も必要だ
Moreover, you must me careful.
規則は数少なく簡単にしてまた包括的なるを要す
The rules should be few, simple, and, what is more, comprehensive.
彼は男が好くて才子でまた金持ちと来ているからたまらない
He is handsome, clever, and, what is better, rich.
山また山
Mountains on mountains.
彼は損また損を重ねた
He sustained loss on loss.

content: 3. (=また実際)and, in fact; as, indeed; and so, indeed

content.content: 彼は学者をもって任じている、また学問ができることもできる
He pretends to scholarship; and, in fact, he is a good scholar.
またあれほどできる人を見たことが無い
And, in fact, he is the greatest scholar I ever saw.
彼は自分で女嫌いと称している、またそうだ
He calls himself a woman-hater; as, indeed, he is.
彼は一升酒だと言っている、またそうだ
He says he drinks by the gallon; and so, indeed, he does.
彼はそれは本当だと言った、またそうだった
He said it was true; as, indeed, it proved―and so, indeed, it proved.

content: 4. (=あるいは)again

content.content: そうかも知れぬまたそうでないかも知れぬ
It may be so, and again it may not.

content:
また〔又、復〕
〈副〉
1. (=再び)again; once more; another time; a second time for the second time

content.content: 同じことがまたあった
The same thing has happened again―The same thing has happened a second time―The same thing has happened for the second time.
またいらっしゃい
Call again!
彼はいつまた来ると言ったか
When did he say he would call again?
今晩また伺います
I shall call again this evening―I shall return in the evening.
また雨かね
Are we going to have another rain?
あのような人はまたと見られぬ
We shall never eyes on his like again.
別れてもまた逢う
We part only to meet again.
また花の咲く春もあろう
I may again be at the top of Fortune's wheel.
今度失敗してもまた機会がある
Even if I fail this time, I shall have another chance.
また光りました
There was another flash!
また地震
There was another shock!
一杯一杯また一杯
Another and another glass.
思う事一つ叶えばまた一つ
One desire fulfilled gives rise to another.
それからまた話しを始めた
Then we resumed our talk.
先生、いつまた仕事を始めることができましょうか
Doctor, when shall I be able to resume my work?
また黙り込んでしまった
He has relapsed into silence.
こんな機会はまたと無い
Such an opportunity will never occur again.
あのような美人は世にまたと無い
She is a peerless beauty―a matchless beauty.
こんな風景はまたと無い
The scenery is unequalled―unparallelled.
あんな人は世にまたと無い
He is unique.

content: 2. (=またその上に)and also; besides; moreover; what is more

content.content: 彼は軍人でまた経世家だ
He is a soldier, and also a statesman―He is a statesman as well as a soldier.
彼は経世家でもなければまた政治家でもない
He is neither a statesman nor a politician.
またあそこには用も有る
Besides, I have business there.
また注意も必要だ
Moreover, you must me careful.
規則は数少なく簡単にしてまた包括的なるを要す
The rules should be few, simple, and, what is more, comprehensive.
彼は男が好くて才子でまた金持ちと来ているからたまらない
He is handsome, clever, and, what is better, rich.
山また山
Mountains on mountains.
彼は損また損を重ねた
He sustained loss on loss.

content: 3. (=また実際)and, in fact; as, indeed; and so, indeed

content.content: 彼は学者をもって任じている、また学問ができることもできる
He pretends to scholarship; and, in fact, he is a good scholar.
またあれほどできる人を見たことが無い
And, in fact, he is the greatest scholar I ever saw.
彼は自分で女嫌いと称している、またそうだ
He calls himself a woman-hater; as, indeed, he is.
彼は一升酒だと言っている、またそうだ
He says he drinks by the gallon; and so, indeed, he does.
彼はそれは本当だと言った、またそうだった
He said it was true; as, indeed, it proved―and so, indeed, it proved.

content: 4. (=あるいは)again

content.content: そうかも知れぬまたそうでないかも知れぬ
It may be so, and again it may not.

content:
まだ〔未だ〕
〈副〉
1. (=未だに、今なお)still

content.content: その人はまだ生きている
The man is still living.
外はまだ明るい
It is still light outside.
まだ降っていますか
Is it raining still?
彼はまだ未練がある
He still looks back to the past.
皆で十冊あるのだからまだ一冊足りない
There ought to be ten volumes in all, so one is still wanting.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: まだ望みがある
There is yet hope.

content: 2. (=未だ何々ならず)(not) yet:(“not”以外の打消に伴えば)as yet; (not) so far

content.content: その人はまだ死なない
The man is not yet dead.
外はまだ暗くならない
It is not yet dark without.
彼はまだ来ない
He has not come yet―He is not yet here.
金はまだできない
I have not found the money yet―The money is not yet ready.
本はまだ書き終らぬ
I have not finished the book yet―The book is not yet finished.
著述はまだ完成しない
The work is not yet completed―as yet incomplete.
金はまだ足りない
The money is not yet enough―as yet insufficient.
彼はどんな人物だか君はまだ知らないのか
Have you yet to learn what sort of a man he is?
全快にはまだ少し間がある
I shall not be well for some time yet―It will be some time before I am well.
全快にはまだなかなか間がある
I shall not be well for a long while yet―It will be long before I am well―I am not nearly well.
新築が落成するにはまだ暫く間がある
The building will not be finished just yet―It will be some time before the new building is finished.
まだ詳報に接しない
The particulars have not been received so far.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 新築が落成するにはまだなかなか間がある
It will be long before the new building is finished―The new building is not nearly finished.
本はまだなかなかでき上がらない
It will be long before the book is completed―The book is not nearly completed.
病人はまだ少し悪い
The invalid is not quite well.
仕事を始めるにはまだ少し早い
He is heardly well enough to resume work.
彼女はまだお嫁に行くには早い
She is too young to marry.
まだ子どもだからそんなことはわからない
She is too much of a child to understand such things.
竿がまだ三尺短い
The pole is too short by three feet.
彼女はまだ十五にならないのに子ができた
She had a child before she had attained her fifteenth year.
彼はまだ卒業もしないうちに結婚した
He got married before he had graduated.
結婚してまだ一月も経たないのに夫婦げんかを始めた
They had not been married a month before they began quarrelling.
まだ道の一里も行かないうちに疲れてきた
I had not gone mile before I began to feel tired.

content: 3. (=もっと)more

content.content: これだけでない、まだある
These are not all; there are some more.
まだあるか
Are there any more?
まだ質問がありますか
Have you any more questions?―any other questions?
まだあります
I have some more―some others.
まだ入れますか
Is there room for more?
まだ二三人は入れます
There is room for two or three more.

content: 4. (=只)only

content.content: 彼は英語を始めてからまだ一年にしかならない
It is only a year since he began English.
英語をまだ始めたばかりだ
He has only just begun English.
二人は結婚してまだ三月しか経たない
It is only three months since they were married―They have been married only three months.
僕はその頃はまだ子どもだった
I was a mere child at that time.

content:
まだい〔間代〕
〈名〉Room-rent; lodging

content.content: 間代をいくら取るか
What do they charge you for the room?
間代をいくら払うか
What do you pay for your room?
食料と間代で三十円
I pay thirty yen for board and lodging.

またいとこ〔再従兄弟〕
〈名〉A second cousin

またうけおい〔又請負〕
〈名〉A subcontract:(=する) to subcontract

またうつし〔又写し〕
〈名〉A recopy:(=する) to recopy (a copy)

またがい〔又買い〕
〈名〉Indirect purchase:(=する) to buy through (a third person)

content:
またがし〔又貸し〕
〈名〉Sublease; underlease:(=する) to sublease, sublet, underlet (land, etc.)

content.content: 又貸人
a sublessor

content:
またがり〔又借り〕
〈名〉
1. Borrowing second-hand:(=する) to borrow (anything) second-hand (from some one)

content.content: これは伊藤の本だが田中から又借りしたのだ
This is Ito's book, which I borrowed second-hand from Tanaka.

content: 2. (=土地などの又借り)sublease; undertenancy

content.content: 又借人
a sublessee―an undertenant

content:
またがる〔跨がる〕
〈他動〉
1. To bestride; to stride; to straddle

content.content: 彼は馬に跨がっている
He sits astride a horse―He is mounted on a horse.
鞍に跨がる
to sit in a saddle
人に跨がる(戦場などにて仲間を救う為に)
to bestride―stand astride of―a comrade

content: 2. (=橋が河に跨がる)to span (a river)

content.content: 隅田川にまたがる橋はいくつもある
Several bridges span the Sumida.

content: 3. (=亘る)to extend over (place or time)

content.content: ロシアは欧亜の二大陸にまたがっている
Russia extends over the two continents of Europe and Asia.
富士山は三国にまたがっている
Mt. Fuji rises over three provinces.
東京市は隅田川の両河畔にまたがっている
Tokyo stretches over both banks of the Sumida.
海軍計画は五カ年にまたがる
The naval programme extends over five years.
祭礼は三日にまたがる
The festival extends over three days―lasts three days.

content:
またぎ〔跨ぎ〕
〈名〉A stride; a step

content.content: ここからそこまではほんのひとまたぎだ
It is only a step from here.

またぎ〔叉木〕
〈名〉A forked tree

content:
またぎき〔又聞き〕
〈名〉Hearsay; second-hand information:(=する) to learn by hearsay; to hear at second hand

content.content: 又聞きだから確かとはわからない
I can't say for certain, for I only know it by hearsay―have it at second hand.
又聞きした話しじゃない
I don't speak from hearsay.

content:
またぐ〔跨ぐ〕
〈他動〉
1. To bestride; to stride; to straddle

content.content: 彼は倒れた戦友をまたいで救った
He bestrode―stood astride of―his fallen comrade.

content: 2. (=越える)to pass; to cross; to step over (a ditch, etc.)

content.content: 溝をまたぐ
to step over a ditch
寝ている者をまたいで入口にでた
I stepped over―stepped across―the sleepers to gain the door.
敷居をまたぐ
to cross the threshold―pass the threshold
二度と再びこの家の敷居をまたがん
I will never set foot in this house―darken your door―again.

またぐら〔股ぐら〕
〈副〉Between the thighs

まだけ〔真竹〕
〈名〉The commonest kind of bamboo

content:
またじっさい〔又実際〕
〈副〉And, in fact; as indeed; and so, indeed

content.content: 後は学者をもって任じている、また実際学問ができる
He pretends to scholarship; and in fact, he is a good scholar.
また実際あれほどできる人を見たことがない
And, in fact, he is the greatest scholar I ever saw.
彼は自分で女嫌いをと評している、また実際そうだ
He calls himself a woman-hater; as, indeed, he is.
彼は一升酒だと言っている、また実際そうだ
He says he drinks by the gallon; and so, indeed, he does.
彼はそれは本当だと言った、また実際そうだった
He said it was true; as, indeed, it proved―and so, indeed, it proved.

content:
またしても〔又しても〕
〈副〉Again; once more

content.content: またしても金の無心
Come for money again?

content:
まだしも
〈副〉
1. (=その方がまだしも)better; rather; preferable

content.content: その方がまだしもだ
That would be better―That is preferable.
恥を掻くより死んだ方がまだしも好い
I would rather die than disgrace myself―I should prefer death to disgrace―Death is preferable to disgrace.

content: 2. (=それだからまだしも)it is well

content.content: 傷が軽いからまだしも好かった、重かったら大変だった
As the wound is slight, it is well. What if it were severer?
腕を一本折ったのはまだしもだ、両腕折ったらどうする
It is well that only one arm is broken. What if both were broken?

content: 3. (=それならまだしも)it would be well; it would have been well

content.content: それだけならまだしも好いが、まだ悪いことがある
It this were all, it would be well; but there is something worse behind.
失敗だけならまだしも好いが、おまけに病気までした
If it had been failure only, it would have been well; but he fell ill into the bargain―He not only failed, but also fell ill.

content:
またせる〔待たせる〕
〈他動〉To keep (one) waiting

content.content: お待たせしました
I am sorry to have kept you waiting.
人を待たせるものじゃない
You should not keep people waiting.
俥が待たせてある
I have my kuruma waiting for me.
その男を待たせておけ
Let the man wait!―Bid the fellow wait!
長く待たせられる
to cool one's heels
三時間も待たせられた
I was kept waiting―I cooled my heels―for three mortal hours.

content:
またぞろ〔又ぞろ〕
〈副〉Again; once more

content.content: いったん決まった問題をまたぞろ出しかけたのか
Have you brought out again what has already been settled?

またたき〔瞬き〕
〈名〉Winking:(一回なら)a wink

content:
またたく〔瞬く〕
〈自動〉
1. To wink; to blink

content.content: 瞬きもせず眺めている
He gazes without winking―without blinking.
瞬く間に
in a twinkling―in the twinkling of an eye
この手術は瞬く間にすむ
The operation is over in a twinkling―The operation is the work of a moment.
星が輝く
The stars twinkle.
灯火が瞬く
A light flickers.
灯火が風に瞬く
A light flickers in the wind.

まただのみ〔又頼み〕
〈名〉An indirect request:(=する) to make (one) a request through (another)

content:
またたび〔木天蓼〕
〈名〉The valerian

content.content: それは猫にまたたびだ
That is valerian to a cat―the very thing―just the thing.

content:
またとない〔又と無い〕
〈形〉Peerless; matchless; unmatched; unequalled; unrivalled; unparallelled; unique

content.content: 世にまたと無い美人だ
She is a peerless beauty―a matchless beauty.
こんな風景は世界にまたと無い
The scenery is unequalled―unrivalled―unparallelled―in the world.
あんな人はまたと無い
He is unique―We shall never look upon his like again.
こんな機会はまたと無い
Such an opportunity will never occur again.
こんなものは日本中にまたと無い
Its fellow is not to be found in all Japan.

またどなり〔又隣り〕
〈形、副〉Next-door but one

content:
または〔又は〕
〈接続詞〉Or; either... or...

content.content: 知っているのはフランス語かまたはドイツ語か(どちらを知っているのか)
Do you know French or German? (Which do you know?)
フランス語かまたはドイツ語かどちらか知っているか(それともどちらも知らぬか)
Do you know either French or German? (Or do you neither?)

content:
またまた〔又々〕
〈副〉Again; repeatedly

content.content: またまたお手数を煩し恐縮の至りに御座候
I am sorry to occasion you repeated troubles.

content:
まだまだ
〈副〉
1. Still more; much more; ever so many more

content.content: まだまだある
There are ever so many more.
物価はまだまだ上がる
The prices will rise still higher―yet higher.
君達はまだまだ学ばねばならぬことがある
You have much more to learn.

content: 2. (=打消に伴えば)far from; not nearly

content.content: 新築はまだまだ落成はせぬ
The new building is far from finished―not nearly finished.
この金ではまだまだ足りない
The sum is far from enough―not nearly enough.
彼の英語はまだまだ完全とはいかぬ
His English is far from perfect―not nearly perfect.
こんなことではまだまだ安心ができぬ
We can not rest easy by far―We can not rest easy by a long way.

content:
またもや〔又もや〕
〈副〉Again; once more

content.content: またもや見合す顔と顔
Once more shall I see you face to face!

content:
まだら〔斑〕
〈名〉Spots; speckles; mottle; dapple:(=な) spotted (skin); speckled (snake); mottled (leg); dappled (horse); brindle, brindled (cow); pied (crow, etc.)

content.content: 斑蛇
a speckled snake
斑馬
a dapple horse―a dappled mare
斑牛
a brindled cow―a brindle ox

content:
まだるい〔間怠い〕
〈形〉Slow; sluggish; hardy; tedious; tiresome; wearisome

content.content: まだるっこくて見ておられん
I am impatient at their slowness.
あの人のまだるっこい話しをよく聴いているね
How can you listen to his tedious talk?
彼のものの言いようがまだるい
He drawls―He speaks with a drawl―He speaks in a drawling tone.

content:
まだるっこい〔間怠っこい〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: まだるい〔間怠い〕

content:
まち〔町〕
〈名〉
1. (=都会)a town; a city

content.content: あの町を通ったことがある
I once passed through that town.
ちょっと町へ行って来る
I am going to town―(米国では)―going down town.
彼は町に住んでいる
He lives in town―(米国では)―lives down town.
その家は町はずれだ
The house stands on the outskirts of the city.
町医者
a city physician―a medical practitioner

content: 2. (=市街)a street; the streets

content.content: 町を通る
to pass along a street―walk down a street―(馬で通れば)―ride down a street―(馬車で通れば)―drive down a street
この町を通ったことがある
I once passed along this street.
行列は町を練り廻す
The procession marches through the streets.
夕飯をすまして町をぶらついた
Supper over, I strolled about the streets.
彼に町で逢った
I met him in the streets.
その学校はこの町の突き当たりです
The school is at the end of this street.

content:
まち〔襠〕
〈名〉
1. (=補いに入れる布)a gusset; a gore

content.content: 襠を入れる
to put in a gusset

content: 2. (=袴の内股)the parting of a divided skirt

まちあい〔待合〕
〈名〉
1. (=待合室)a waiting-room

content.content: 一等待合室
the first-class waiting room

content: 2. (=待合茶室)an assignation-house

まちあかす〔待ち明かす〕
〈自他動〉To pass (the night) in waiting; to sit up for (one)

content.content: 昨夜は君が来るかと思って待ち明かした
I waited for you all last night.

content:
まちあぐむ〔待ちあぐむ〕
〈自動〉To grow weary of waiting

content.content: 皆待ちあぐんでいる
Everybody is weary of waiting.

content:
まちあわせる〔待ち合わせる〕
〈自動〉To rendezvous; to meet (in an appointed place)

content.content: 彼とはステーションで待ち合わせることにした
We are to meet at the station.

まちいしゃ〔町医者〕
〈名〉A city physician; a medical practitioner

content:
まちうける〔待ち受ける〕
〈他動〉To expect; to look for (anything); to wait for (anything); to abide by (anything)

content.content: それでは明日お待ち受けます
Then I shall expect you―look for you―tomorrow.
どうなるか結果を待ち受けよう
I shall wait for the result―abide by the event.

content:
まぢか〔間近〕
〈形〉Very near; near at hand; close at hand:(前置詞相当に用いれば)near by, close by, hard by (a place)

content.content: 歳の暮に間近い
The end of the year is near at hand―The year draws to a close.
試験も間近くなった
The examination is close at hand.
僕は学校の間近に居る
I live near by the school―close by the school―hard by the school.

content:
まちがい〔間違い〕
〈名〉
1. (=誤り)a mistake; an error; an oversight; a slip

content.content: 作文に間違いがあるかどうか見て下さい
See if there are any mistakes in my composition.
間違いが無い
It is free from mistakes.
間違いがある
There are some mistakes in it.
間違いだらけだ
It is full of mistakes.
一つ二つの間違いはしかたがない
One or two mistakes can not be helped―A mistake or two are not to be helped.
間違いを直す
to correct a mistake―rectify an error
文法上の間違い
a grammatical mistake―a grammatical error
文法上の間違いを直す
to correct grammatical mistakes
彼は強情にも間違いを直さぬ
He persists in his error.
こんなわかりきった間違いを見落とすとはどうした間抜けだ
How stupid of you to overlook such an obvious mistake!
そんなことができると思うのは間違いだ
It is a mistake to think that such things can be done.
君はあんな者を信用したのが間違いだ
You made a mistake in trusting such a man.
憚りながらそりゃお間違いでしょう
I beg your pardon, but you are mistaken.
僕の間違い(思い違い)でした
I was mistaken.
彼と一日議論をしたけれども間違いを悟らせることができなかった
I argued with him all day, but I could not convince him of his error.
間違いを悟りました
I am convinced of my error―I am undeceived.
あるいは僕の間違いかも知らんがあの男は前科があるようだ
I may be mistaken, but―Unless I am mistaken,―he is an old offender.
生徒がよくあの先生の間違いをとがめる
The students often catch him in errors―catch him tripping.
あの先生は訳の間違いがある
He makes mistakes in translation.
よく不注意の間違いをする
He has many slips.
間違いの無いように別々にしておこう
We will keep them apart, to prevent mistakes―to obviate the possibility of a mistake―to preclude the possibility of a mistake.
人間違い
a mistake of identity
書き間違い
a clerical error

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 英語でこう言うと間違いではありませんか
Is it good English to say so?
そう言うと間違いです
It is bad English to say so.
勘定に間違いが無い
The accounts are straight―all right.
間違いの無い事実
a certain fact
間違いの無い方法
an unfailing method―an infallible method―a sure way
あれは間違いの無い男だ
He is a prudent man.→『まちがいない〔間違い無い〕』→『まちがいなく〔間違い無く〕』

content: 2. (=けが)an accident; a trouble; something wrong

content.content: 何か間違いが起こった
There was something wrong―some trouble.
彼は途中で何か間違いがあって手間を取ったのだ
Something went wrong with him on the way, and delayed him.
間違いは有りがちだ
Accidents will happen.
間違いの無いように万事に目を通しておくがよい
You ought to see to everything, to prevent accidents.
どうした間違いか子どもを置き忘れて行ったのだ
The child was left behind by some accident.
金のことで何か間違いがあったと見える
It seems that there was some trouble about money.
間違いがあるといけないから念のため証文を書かせるがよい
You ought to make him sign a paper, lest any trouble should arise―for fear of trouble―to make sure.

content: 3. (=男女間の間違い)an indiscretion

content.content: 男女間の間違いは若い時はありがちだ
Indiscretion is incidental to youth―Young people will be indiscreet.
間違いがあると悪いから男と女は別々にするがよい
Boys and girls should be kept apart, lest they should commit indiscretions.
間違いの無いうちに娘にお暇を戴きとう存じます
Let my daughter leave your service before she can commit an indiscretion.

content:
まちがいない〔間違い無い〕
〈形〉Certain (fact); sure (way); unfailing, infallible (method); unerring (aim, etc.)

content.content: 間違い無い方法(万全の策)
an unfailing method―an infallible method―a sure way―a sure card
間違い無い事実
a certain fact―a certainty
彼の成功は間違い無い
His success is certain―a certainty.
あれは間違い無い男だ
He is a prudent man.
彼がにらんだら間違い無い
His judgment never errs.

content:
まちがいなく〔間違い無く〕
〈副〉Certainly; infallibly; without fall:(形容詞を用いれば)to be sure to (do something)

content.content: 今月末には間違い無く金を返します
I will certainly pay you―I will pay you without fail―I will not fail to pay you―at the end of the month.
六時までには間違い無く来る
I will certainly come―I will be here without fail―I will not fail to come―by six.
間違い無く(きっと)来給えよ
Be sure to come!―Don't fail to come!
彼は間違い無く成功する
He will certainly succeed―He is sure to succeed.

content:
まちがう〔間違う〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: まちがえる〔間違える〕

content:
まちがえる〔間違える〕
〈他動〉To mistake (one's meaning); to make a mistake (in writing); to commit an error (in calculation):(思い間違う)to be mistaken; to be wrong (about something):(何と何を間違える)to mistake (one person or thing for another):(何と何を思い間違える)to take (one person or thing for another); to confound (one thing with another); to confuse (one thing with another); to mix up (one thing with another)

content.content: 意味を間違える
to mistake the meaning―misapprehend the meaning
彼は僕の言ったことの意味を間違えたのだ
He misconstrued my remark―put a wrong construction on my remark.
番地を間違える、番号を間違える
to mistake the number
番号を間違えた
I went to the wrong number.
交換手が番号を間違えたに違いない
The telephone-girl must have given the wrong number.
道を間違える
to mistake the road―take the wrong road―miss the (right) road
案内者が道を間違えた
The guide missed the way.
汽車を間違える
to take the wrong train
汽車を間違えないようにし給え
See that you take the right train.
書き違える
to make a mistake in writing―write amiss―miswrite
読み間違える
to make a mistake in reading―read amiss―misread
計算を間違える
to commit an error in calculation―make a mistake in calculation―miscalculate
綴りを間違える
to spell a word incorrectly―misspell a word
発音を間違える
to pronounce a word incorrectly―mispronounce a word
彼は僕の意向を間違えている
He is wrong about my intentions―He misunderstands my intentions.
君を泥棒と間違えた
I mistook you for a burglar―took you for a burglar.
泥棒と間違えられた
I was mistaken for a burglar―taken for a burglar.
兄弟があまりよく似ているので間違えられる
The brothers are so much alike that the one is mistaken for the other.
彼らは自由と放縦とを間違えている
They confound liberty with licence―confuse liberty with licence―mix up liberty with licence.
日付けを間違えた
I have mistaken the date―confused the dates.
間違えば間違うものだ
One will make mistakes.→『まちがった〔間違った〕』→『まちがって〔間違って〕』

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: いったい彼がそんなことをするのが間違っている
He ought not to do so.
あんな奴がここへ来るのが間違っている
He ought not to be here at all.
そんなことを言うのが間違っている
He ought not to say such things.
僕に相談しないのが間違っている
He ought to consult me.
許可を乞わないのが間違っている
He ought to ask permission.
間違ったら腹を切る
I will answer for it with my life.
きっと成功する、間違ったら切腹する
I will answer for my success with my life.

content:
まちがった〔間違った〕
〈形〉Mistaken (idea); erroneous (view); wrong (statement); incorrect (answer); false (pride)

content.content: それは間違った考えだ
That is a mistaken idea―a wrong idea―an erroneous view.
貧を恥じるのは間違った名誉心である
It is false pride to be ashamed of poverty.
間違ったことをする
(不正なことなら)to do wrong―(失策なら)―make a mistake
嘘をつくとは間違ったことをしたものだ
You have done wrong in telling a lie.
あんな者を信用するとは間違ったことをしたものだ
You have made a mistake in trusting such a man.
間違ったことを言う
to say amiss―make a wrong statement―make a misstatement―make a mistake
日本人が英語を話したがらないのは間違ったことを言って笑われるのを気遣うのだ
Japanese do not like to speak English, for they are afraid of making mistakes.
君が間違っている(思い違いをしている)
You are mistaken.
君の言うことが間違っている
You are wrong.
大いに間違っている
You are as wrong as wrong can be.
僕の言うことは間違っておらぬつもりだ
I hope I am right.
君の方が間違っている
It is you who are wrong―You are in the wrong―I know better.
君はそう思うのが間違っている
You are wrong in thinking so.
僕の臆測が間違っていなかった
I was right in my conjectures.
君の計算が間違っている
You are wrong in your calculation―out in your reckoning.
二人が意見を異にする時は一人はどうしても間違っているに違いない
When two men differ in opinion, one must be wrong.
双方共間違っていることがある
Both may be wrong.
間違ったやり方をするから英語が進まないのだ
You do not improve in your English, because you go about it in the wrong way.
手紙は宛名が間違っていたから届かなかったのだ
The letter miscarried, for it was wrongly addressed.
唾蓮を“water-lily”と言うのは間違っている
The water-lily is wrongly named.
そう言うのは既に間違っている
To say so is already a mistake.
あの時計は間違っていませんか
Is that clock right?
僕の時計は間違っている
My watch is wrong.
この答は間違っていませんか
Is the answer correct?
その答は間違っている
The answer is incorrect.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: いったい彼がそんなことをするのが間違っている
He ought not to do such things.
あんな奴がここへ来るのが間違っている
He ought not to be here at all.
そんなことを言うのが間違っている
He ought not to say such things.
僕に相談しないのが間違っている
He ought to consult with me.
許可を乞わんのが間違っている
He ought to ask permission.

content:
まちがって〔間違って〕
〈副〉By mistake; by accident; by oversight

content.content: 間違って君の本を持って行った
I took your book by mistake.
間違って汽車を乗り違えた
I took the wrong train by mistake.
彼は銃猟に行って間違って撃たれたのだ
He went shooting, and got shot by accident.
間違って君の名を落とした
By an oversight, your name was omitted.

content:
まちがっても〔間違っても〕
〈副〉
1. (=万々一)possibly; by any possibility

content.content: そんなことは間違っても無い
It can not possibly be so―It can not by any possibility be so―It is beyond the bounds of possibility.
君が失敗するようなことは間違ってもありはせぬ
You can not possibly fail―can not by any possibility fail.
善悪に賞罰の無いことは間違っても無い
A good deed can not possibly go unrewarded, and an evil deed can not by any possibility go unpunished.

content: 2. (=まかり間違えば)at the worst

content.content: どう間違っても死ぬだけのことだ
I can but die at the worst.
どう間違っても資本を棒に振るだけのことだ
I can but lose my capital at the worst.

content:
まちかねる〔待ち兼ねる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=待ちもどかしがる)to be impatient for (something); to be dying for (something); to be agog for (news, etc.)

content.content: お返事を待ちかねていました
I have been impatient for your answer―impatient to hear your answer.
彼は国からの便りを待ちかねている
He is dying for news from home.
旦那がお待ちかねですよ
The gentleman is impatient for your coming―dying to see you.
お待ちかねの人が参りました
The person you expect is here at last.
お待ちかねの日にやっとなりました
The long-wished-for day has come at last.
彼は先妻の死ぬのを待ちかねて後妻を迎えた
Scarcely waiting for his first wife to die, he married a second.

content: 2. (=楽しみに待つ)to look forward to (an event)

content.content: 子どもらはお祭りを待ちかねている
The children look forward to the festival.
ご両親は君の卒業を待ちかねておられる
Your parents look forward to your graduation.

content:
まちかまえる〔待ち構える〕
〈他動〉To watch for (a chance); to look out for (a squall); to be on the watch for (a chance); to be on the lookout for (a squall); to be on the alert for (the enemy); to be on the qui vive for (news); to be agog for (news)

content.content: 今や遅しと機会のあるのを待ち構えた
I eagerly watched for a chance―I was on the eager lookout for my opportunity.
敵の来るのを待ち構えておれ
Be on the alert for the enemy!
全国民が勝報の来るのをしきりに待ち構えておった
The whole nation was on the qui vive for news of victory―all agog for news of victory.

content:
まちくたびれる〔待ち草臥れる〕
〈自動〉To grow weary of waiting

content.content: もう待ちくたびれた
I am weary of waiting.

content:
まちくらす〔待ち暮す〕
〈他動〉To pass one's time in waiting (for something)

content.content: 昨日は一日君を待ち暮らした
I waited for you all day yesterday.

content:
まちこがれる〔待ち焦れる〕
〈他動〉To long for (a day); to look forward to (an event); to be impatient for (something); to be dying for (something)

content.content: その時になるのを待ちこがれている
How I long for that time to come!
ご両親は君の卒業を待ちこがれておられる
Your parents look forward to your graduation.
ようやく待ちこがれた卒業の日となった
At last came the long-wished-for day of his graduation.
海外へ行って国からの便りを待ちこがれている
The exile is dying for news from home.

content:
まちつづき〔町続き〕
〈名〉A continuous town

content.content: 熱田は名古屋と町続きだ
Atsuta forms a continuous town to Nagoya.

content:
まちどおい〔待遠い〕
〈叙述形容詞〉→『

content.content: まちどおしい〔待遠しい〕

content:
まちどおしい〔待遠しい〕
〈叙述形容詞〉
1. ［主観的］ To wait eagerly for (something); to long for (something); to be impatient for (something); to be dying for (something)

content.content: 彼の返事が待ち遠しい
I am eagerly awaiting his answer.
その時が待ち遠しい
How I long for that time to come!
病後は三度の食事が待ち遠しかった
After my illness, I used to be impatient for my meals.
国からの便りが待ち遠しい
I am dying for news from home.
お待ち遠でした
I am sorry to have kept you waiting.

content: 2. ［客観的］ To be a long time in coming

content.content: 善い事は待ち遠しい
Good things are a long time in coming.
月が待ち遠しい
The moon is a long time in rising.
花が待ち遠しい
The blossoms are a long time in opening.
お正月が待ち遠しい年頃にいま一度なってみたい
I wish I could again be of an age when the New Year was a long time in coming.

content:
まちどおしがる〔待遠しがる〕
〈他動〉To wait eagerly for (something); to long for (something); to be impatient for (something); to be dying for (something)

content.content: 子どもらがお正月を待ち遠しがっている
The children are eagerly awaiting the New Year.
その時を待ち遠しがっている
They long for that time to come.
彼は三度の食事を待ち遠しがっている
He is impatient for his meals.
国からの便りを待ち遠しがっている
He is dying for news from home.

content:
まちなみ〔町並〕
〈名〉The row of houses on a street

content.content: 家は町並みに立っている
The house abuts on the street.
町並みが揃っている
The street has a regular row of houses.
大火後、町並みが好くなった
The streets have improved since the great fire.

content:
まちはずれ〔町外れ〕
〈名〉The outskirts of a town

content.content: そこは東京の町外れだ
The place lies on the outskirts of Tokyo.

content:
まちはば〔町幅〕
〈名〉The breadth of a street

content.content: 東京は町幅が広い
Tokyo has broad streets―wide streets.
京都は町幅が狭い
Kyoto has narrow streets.

まちびと〔待ち人〕
〈名〉An expected visitor

まちぶぎょう〔町奉行〕
〈名〉A chief magistrate (under the Tokugawa regime)

content:
まちぶせ〔待伏せ〕
〈名〉Ambush; ambuscade:(=する) to lie in ambush for, lie in wait for, lay wait for, waylay (travellers, etc.)

content.content: 追いはぎが旅人を待ち伏せする
A footpad lays wait for travellers.
彼は追いはぎに待ち伏せされて金品を奪われた
He was waylaid by a footpad and robbed of his possessions.

content:
まちぼうけ〔待ちぼうけ〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: まちぼけ〔待ちぼけ〕

content:
まちぼけ〔待ちぼけ〕
〈名〉Waiting in vain:(=る) to wait in vain (for a person)

content.content: 彼に待ちぼけ喰わされた
He kept me waiting in vain.

content:
まちまち〔区々〕
〈形〉Various; diverse; divided

content.content: 人々の説はまちまちだ
People are divided in opinion―There is a divergence of opinion.
この問題について輿世論はまちまちだ
Public opinion is divided―There is a divergence of public opinion―on the question.
風説はまちまちだ
There are various rumours―conflicting rumours.
皆の言うことはまちまちだ
One man says this, and another says that.

content:
まちもうける〔待ち設ける〕
〈他動〉To expect (some result); to look for (success, etc.)

content.content: 試験は待ち設けたよりやさしかった
The examination was easier than I had expected.
こんなにうまく行こうとは待ち設けなかった
I did not look for such a success.

content:
まちもどかしい〔待ちもどかしい〕
〈形〉Impatient (at one's slowness―for news―to do something)

content.content: 試験の成績発表が待ちもどかしい
I am impatient to know the result of my examination―impatient at the late publication of the results.

content:
まちやっこ〔町奴〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: おとこだて〔男達〕

まちわびる〔待ち侘びる〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=待ち焦れる)to long for (a day, etc.)
2. (=待ちあぐむ)to grow weary of waiting

content:
まつ〔松〕
〈名〉The pine

content.content: 松をこしらえる、松に手入れをする
to trim a pine
松は寸にして棟梁の機有り
Genius will early assert itself.
