松の木
a pine-tree
松の木に蝉
a mite on an elephant
松並木
an avenue of pines
松林
a pine-forest―a pinery
松山
a pine-clad hill
松原
a road bordered with pines
松葉
pine-needles
松笠
a pine-cone
松脂
pine-resin―rosin
松風
the soughing of the wind through pine-trees
松飾り
the New Year's pine decorations
松の内
the first seven days of the New Year

content:
まつ〔待つ〕
〈自他動〉
1. To wait; to wait for (a man); to await (an event); to watch for (a chance); to listen for (a sound); to sit up for (one's master)

content.content: 今行くから待て
Wait for me!
ちょっと待て
Wait a moment!―Wait a bit!
(走る人に向かって)待て
Hold on!
待った、待ったそこは僕の領分だ
Hold! hold! you are encroaching on my province.
待てよ何か忘れものをしないかな
Stay! have I not forgotten anything?
待っていました
I have been waiting for you!―I have been dying to see you!
そういう訳ですから来月までお待ち下さい
Such being the case, I must beg you to wait till next month.
いつまでも便々と待っていられぬ
I can not wait for ever.
事の発展を待たん
We shall await developments.
返事を待つ、返答を待つ
to wait for an answer―listen for a reply
御返事待上候
Awaiting the pleasure of an answer―Please oblige me with an early answer.
ヘンマツ(電報)
Waiting answer.
彼らは事あれかしと待っている
They wait for something to happen.
時期の熟するを待つ
to wait for the time to come
機運の熟するを待つよりほかにしかたがない
There is nothing for it but to wait for an opportunity.
今や遅しと機会を待った
I eagerly watched for a chance.
腕を磨いて千載一隅の機会を待っている
I am preparing myself for a golden opportunity.
耳を澄まして彼の足音のするのを待った
I listened for his footsteps.
時計が十二時打つのを待った
I listened for the clock to strike twelve.
待てど暮らせど彼の来そうな気配が無い
I waited and waited, but there was no sign of his coming.
待つ間ほど無く彼がやって来た
I had not waited long before he appeared.
一時間待つか待たぬに彼がやって来た
I had scarcely waited an hour when he made his appearance.
(親の財産を当てにして)親父の死ぬのを待つ
to wait for one's shoes
死ぬのを待たれるのは心持の好いものじゃない
It is not pleasant to have people waiting for your shoes.
飯を食わずに君の帰りを待っておった
We have been waiting dinner for you.
僕のところでは誰が帰らなくとも待たずに飯を食う
We wait dinner for no one.
僕の帰りを待たずに夕飯をすまして下さい
Do not wait supper for me!
寝ないで人の帰りを待つ
to sit up for some one
細君が夫の帰りを起きて待っている
His wife sitting up for him.
今夜は帰りが遅いからを待たずに寝てくれ
Do not sit up for me, for I shall return late tonight.
網を張って待つ
to spread one's net for one's victim
大口を明いて待つ
to gape for food
時節を待つ
to bide one's time
彼は世を忍んで時節を待っている
He lies low and bides his time.
時節を待てば成功する
You will succeed in time―in due time―in due season―in due course of time.
時節を待てよ時鳥
In time the cuckoo will sing.
退屈して待つ
to kick one's heels
長く待たされる
to be kept waiting for a long while―cool one's heels
待たるるとも待つ身となるな
Better be waited for than wait for another.
待つ身は長い
“A watched pot is long in boiling.”
待つ身の辛さ
How hard it is to wait!
待つは憂いもの辛いもの
“Hope deferred maketh the heart sick.”
待った甲斐があった
My patience is rewarded.
待つ甲斐あって老母は息子の顔を見た
The old mother saw her son in reward for her patience.
暫く掲げて確報を待つ
We give the news subject to confirmation.→『またせる〔待たせる〕』
歳月は人を待たす
“Time and tide wait for no man.”
待てば海路の日和あり
“After a storm comes a calm.”
果報は寝て待て
“Everything comes to those who wait.”
人事を尽くして天命を待つ
Do your best, and abide by the event.
百年河清を待つ
“If the sky fall, we shall catch larks.”
知己を千載の後に待つ
to throw oneself on the verdict of posterity

content: 2. (=待ち設ける)to expect; to look for (an event); to rely on (one's promise); to count on (the result); to look forward to (an event with hopes or fears)

content.content: それでは明日お待ち申します
Then I shall expect you tomorrow.
今晩友人の来るのを待っている
I expect a friend this evening.
彼の来るのを今か今かと待っている
I expect him every moment.
今死ぬか今死ぬかと待っていた
I expected to die every moment.
鶴首して(頸を長くして)待っている
We are on the tiptoe of expectation.
当てにして待っている
I shall count upon you―rely on your promise―wait in reliance on your promise.
当てにして待て
You may rely upon me!
楽しみにして待つ、指折り数えて待つ
to look forward to an event
子どもらはお祭りを楽しみにして待っている
The children look forward to the festival.
ご両親は君の卒業を指折り数えて待っておられる
Your parents look forward to your graduation.
僕は試験の来るのを非常に心配して待っておった
I looked forward to the examination with grave apprehensions.
彼の到着するのを毎日待っている
I am daily looking for his arrival.
待ちに待った日がやっと来た
The long-looked-for day―The long wished-for day―has come at last.

content: 3. (=待遇する)to treat (at person)

content.content: 彼は人を待つの礼を知らぬ
He does not know how to treat people.

content:
まつ〔末〕
〈名〉The end

content.content: 月末に払う
I will pay you at the end of the month.
年末に勘定する
I shall settle accounts at the end of the year.

content:
まつ〔俟つ〕
〈他動〉To look to (some one for assistance); to rely on (one's promise); to count on (one's support); to depend on (one's efforts); to condition, be conditioned by (each other)

content.content: 君の助力に俟つ
I look to you for assistance―I count on your support.
予防法は各自の注意に俟たなければならぬ
As for preventive measures, we must look to each man to take care of himself.
国家の将来は青年の努力に俟つ
The future of the country depends on the efforts of the rising generation.
明日の勝利は各員の努力に俟つよりほかは無い
Tomorrow's victory will depend on each man doing his best.
制度は人を俟って始めてその効あり
An institution depends on men for its efficiency.
健康と活動は両者相俟たざるべからず
Health and activity condition each other―are conditioned by each other.
智と徳は両々相俟って完全になる
Wisdom and virtue are both necessary―indispensable to each other―for perfection.
理論と実際とは両々相俟って始めて完全な成果をなす
Theory and practice both must concur―both must conspire―to make a complete result.
ご賛成を俟って計画を実行致します
I shall carry my plan into execution subject to your approval.
ご許可を俟って会を開きます
We shall hold a meeting subject to your permission.
ご承諾を俟って品物を売ります
I shall sell the goods subject to your consent.
彼の成功は論を俟たず
He will succeed without doubt―without question―without dispute.

まついた〔松板〕
〈名〉A pine-board; a deal board

content:
まっか〔真赤〕
〈形〉
1. Deep red

content.content: 真赤に焼いた鉄
red-hot iron
彼女は恥じて顔を真赤にした
She blushed for shame―blushed like a peony―blushed to the roots of her hair.
彼は酒を飲んで真赤になっている
He is flushed with wine―purple with wine.
激して真赤になっている
He is flushed with excitement.
子どもらは運動をして顔を真赤にしている
The boys are in a glow with exercise.
顔を真赤にしてしゃべっている
He has talked himself red in the face.
彼は真赤になって怒った
He was red with anger―He fired up―flamed up―flared up.
二人は真赤になって議論をした
They disputed with great warmth.
それは真赤な嘘だ
It is a downright lie―an arrant lie―a lie out of the whole cloth―a pure fabrication―a plumper.
真赤な嘘をつく
to tell a downright lie―make up a story out of the whole cloth

content:
まつかざり〔松飾り〕
〈名〉The New Year's pine decorations

content.content: 松飾りをする
to decorate the house with pine-branches (for the New Year)

〈名〉
1. The soughing of the wind through pine-trees
2. (=茶釜の煮え立つ音)the seething (of a tea-kettle)

content:
まっくら〔真暗〕
〈形〉Pitch-dark

content.content: 夜は真暗だ
The night is pitch-dark.
真暗で鼻をつままれるよう
It is too dark to see an inch before one.
彼はお先真暗だ
He can not see an inch beyond his nose―He has no foresight at all.

content:
まっくらやみ〔真暗闇〕
〈名〉Utter darkness; total darkness

content.content: 真暗闇につくねんとしておった
I sat alone in utter darkness.
真暗闇を手探りで行った
I groped my way in utter darkness.
東京が真暗闇になる懸念があった
There were fears of Tokyo being wrapped in total darkness.

content:
まっくろ〔真黒〕
〈形〉Jet-black

content.content: 顔が真黒に日に焼けている
His face is burnt black by the sun.
真黒くなって働く
to toil and moil―drudge it―fag it―slave it
彼は真黒くなって英語を勉強している
He is plodding away―grubbing away―driving away―hammering away―pegging away―at his English.

content:
まつげ〔睫毛〕
〈名〉The eyelashes

content.content: 逆さ睫毛
trichiasis

content:
まつご〔末期〕
〈名〉The hour of death; one's last moments

content.content: 末期を安らかにする
to ease one's last moments
末期及んで遺言をした
He made his will in his last moments.
末期に及んで懴悔した
He made a confession on his deathbed.
末期の言葉
one's dying words
末期の懴悔
one's deathbed confession
末期まで正気でおった
He remained conscious to the last.
末期の苦しみ
death agony―the throes of death

content:
まっこう〔真向〕
〈副〉Right in front; directly; flatly; boldly

content.content: 真向から攻撃する
to attack one in front―make a frontal attack
彼は真向から政府を攻撃する
He boldly attacks the government.
そんなことをするのはいやだと言って真向から断った
I flatly refused to do so.
真向から断られた
I was met by a direct refusal―met by a flat refusal.
船が真向に風を受けた
The wind was dead against us―We steamed in the wind's eye―in the teeth of the wind.
真向に刀を振りかざす
to brandish one's sword right over one's head
彼は真向から斬りつけられた
He was cut right over the head.

content:
まっこう〔抹香〕
〈名〉Incense; incense powder

content.content: 抹香を焚く
to burn incense
彼の話しは抹香臭い
His talk smells of incense―smacks of the temple.

まっこうくじら〔抹香鯨〕
〈名〉The sperm-whale

content:
まつざ〔末座〕
〈名〉A back seat

content.content: 末座に列する
to take a back sent―be present (at a meeting, etc.)
僕も末座に列した
I had the honour of being present.
僕も末座を汚している
I have the honour of being a member.

content:
まっさいちゅう〔真最中〕
〈副〉At its height; in full swing; in full blast:(前置詞に訳せば)amidst (a storm); in the midst of (a war); in the height of (a banquet); in the heat of (action)

content.content: 暴風雨の真最中に舟を出した
The boat put off amidst a storm―in the midst of a storm―in the height of a storm―when the storm was at its height.
これは戦争の真最中にできた軍艦だ
The ship was built in the midst of the war.
今仕事の真最中だ
Work is in full swing―in full blast.
宴会の真最中に火事がでた
A fire broke out in the height of the banquet―when the banquet was at its height.
戦闘の真最中には負傷しても痛くないそうだ
One does not feel the pain of wound in the heat of action.
ばくちの真最中に刑事に踏み込まれた
The house was raided when they were in the act of gambling.
行って見ると家族は朝飯の真最中であった
I found the family at breakfast.

content:
まっさお〔真青〕
〈形〉Deadly pale; ghastly pale; wan; as white as a sheet

content.content: 真青になる
to turn deadly pale―turn as white as a sheet
君の顔は真青だせ
You look ghastly pale.
彼は真青になって怒った

content:
まっさかさま〔真逆さま〕
〈副〉Headlong; head foremost; heels over head; head over heels

content.content: 水中へ真逆さまに飛び込む
to plunge headlong into the water
彼は三階から真逆さまに落ちた
He fell head foremost from the third story―He fell head over heels from the third story.
人馬もろとも真逆さま
Horse and rider rolled over the precipice.

content:
まっさかり〔真盛り〕
〈形〉
1. (=満開)→『

content.content: まんかい〔満開〕

content:
』
2. (=季節の真盛り)in full swing; in full blast; in the height of the season

content.content: 今海水浴が真盛りだ
We are in the height of the sea-bathing season―Sea-bathing is in full swing.
今は銃猟が真盛りだ
We are in the height of the shooting season―Shooting is in full blast.

content:
まっさきに〔真先に〕
〈副〉First of all:(通例形容詞に訳して)the first (to do something)

content.content: 真先に駆けつけたのは加藤だ
Kato hastened to the scene first of all―(と言うよりも)―Kato was the first to hasten to the scene.
いざとなると功名談をした勇士が真先に逃げ出した
In the moment of action, the braggart was the first to run away.

content:
マッサージ
〈名〉Massage

content.content: マッサージをやる
to massage a person
あの人はマッサージをやります
He is a masseur―(女なら)―She is a masseuse.

content:
まっさつ〔抹殺〕
〈名〉Effacement; erasure; obliteration:(=する) to efface (a figure); to erase (a word); to obliterate (a fact); to expunge (a passage); to strike out, cross out, rub out, scratch out (a name, etc.)

content.content: 児島高徳を抹殺せんとした歴史家がある

その筋の命により一カ所抹殺せり

まつじ〔末寺〕
〈名〉A branch temple

content:
まっしぐらに〔驀地に〕
〈副〉Full speed; full drive; full pelt; full tilt

content.content: 敵陣指してまっしぐらに進んだ
He rushed full tilt at the enemy.

content:
まつじつ〔末日〕
〈名〉The last day; the end (of a month)

content.content: 一月末日
the end of January
各月末日
the last day of every month
世界の末日
the day of doom―doomsday

content:
まっしょうじき〔真正直〕
〈形〉Straightforward downright honest

content.content: あれは真正直な男だ
He is a downright honest fellow.
真正直なところを言えばこの事業はちと危ない
To tell the straightforward truth, the enterprise is somewhat risky.

content:
まっしょうめん〔真正面〕
〈形、副〉Right in front (of a surface); right in the center (of a row); right opposite

content.content: 神社の真正面に額が掛けてある
A tablet hangs right in front of the shrine.
真正面に議長の席がある
Right in the middle is the speaker's seat.
真正面に玉座が設けられた
A throne was erected fronting the space.
真正面の建物が新築の議会です
The building right opposite (us) is the new Diet House.

content:
まっしろ〔真白〕
〈形〉Pure white

content.content: 舌が真白だ
My tongue is furred―coated with fur.
世の中が真白だ
The world is covered with snow.

content:
まっすぐ〔真直〕
〈形〉
1. (=曲らぬ)straight; direct:(=に) straight; direct; in a bee-line as the crow flies

content.content: 真っすぐな道
a straight road
そこへは東京から真っすぐな道がある
There is a direct route there from Tokyo.
真っすぐにお帰りなさい
You must go home straight.
彼はパリから真っすぐに日本へ来たのだ
He comes direct from Paris.
真っすぐにお出でなさい
Go straight on!―Keep straight on!―Follow your nose!
この通りを真っすぐに行くと上野へ出ます
Follow this street straight on, and you will find yourself at Ueno.
甲乙間の距離は真っすぐに測れば十マイルある
The distance across is ten miles in a bee-line―as the crow flies.
彼は脇目も触らずに真っすぐに進んだ
He held on his course, without looking right or left.

content: 2. (=直立せる)erect; upright:(=に) erect; upright

content.content: 真っすぐに立つ
to stand erect
真っすぐに坐る
to sit erect―sit up straight
真っすぐな姿勢
an erect posture―an upright posture

content: 3. (=正しき)right; upright

content.content: 彼は真っすぐな人だ
He is an upright man.
心が真っすぐだ
His heart is in the right place.
真っすぐに世を渡る
to tread the right path―tread one's shoes straight―draw a straight furrow

content: 4. (=正直)straightforward

content.content: 真っすぐに言う
to speak in a straightforward manner―tell the straight truth
真っすぐに白状する
to confess the straightforward truth

content: 5. (=公平)just; even-handed

content.content: 曲った処を真っすぐにしてやる
I will right your wrongs―see your wrongs righted.
真っすぐに裁判する
to try a case on its merits―hold the scales even
真っすぐな裁判
just judgment―even-handed justice

content:
まっせ〔末世〕
〈名〉A degenerate age; these degenerate days

content.content: こうなっては世も末世だ
The world is degenerate―The world is going to the dogs.

content:
まっせき〔末席〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ばっせき〔末席〕

content:
まっせつ〔末節〕
〈名〉Details; trifles

content.content: 末節に拘泥する
to stick to trifles
彼は末節に拘泥するきらいがある
He is a stickler for trifles―He is finical.

content:
まった〔待った〕
〈命令法〉Wait! Hold! Stay! Not yet! Not so fast!

content.content: ちょっと待った
Wait a bit!
待った待ったそこは僕の領分だ
Hold! hold! you are encroaching on my province.
おっと待ったその手は食わぬ
Not so fast! that trick won't do.
幾度も「待った」をやってからようやく立った
He stood up to his antagonist after several “Not yet's.”

content:
まつだい〔末代〕
〈名〉The end of time

content.content: 末代までも
to the end of time―to all ages―through all ages to come―for ever―world without end
その名は末代に伝わらん
His name shall endure to all ages.
人は一代名は末代
Man live but for one generation, but his name may live for ever―Man is mortal, but fame is immortal.
名を末代の残す
to immortalize one's name
聞くは一時の恥聞かざるは末代の恥
Do not be ashamed to ask, and you escape an eternal shame.

content:
まったき〔全き〕
〈形〉Perfect; complete; entire; whole; integral

content.content: 人事に全きを望むべからず
Perfection is not to be expected in human affairs.
支那の全きを保す
to preserve the integrity of China
全き健康
perfect health
全き統一体
a complete whole
全き団体
the entire body
全き世界
the whole world

content:
まったく〔全く〕
〈副〉
1. (=全然)quite; completely; perfectly; entirely; totally; utterly; wholly; simply; altogether; clear; dead; nothing short of:(打消に伴えば) (not) at all; absolutely (none)

content.content: (英語を教えるとなると)全く別物だ
That's quite another thing―quite another pair of shoes.
彼のやり方は全く女だ
He is quite a woman in his ways.
事が全く失敗に帰した
The project ended in a complete failure―ended in a total failure―ended in an utter failure―ended in a dead failure.
君の言うことは全く間違っている
You are entirely wrong―as wrong as wrong can be.
彼は教師としては全く駄目た
As a teacher, he is a complete failure―a total failure―an utter failure.
全くお委せ申す
I leave the matter wholly―entirely―to you.
彼の言うことは全くたわごとだ
What he says is simply nonsense.
全く嘘でもない
It is not altogether false.
その家は全く無い(影も形も無い)
The house is clean gone.
僕はこの縁談には全く反対だ
I am dead against the match.
彼が助かったのは全く奇蹟だ
His escape is nothing short of a miracle.
彼は全く気が違っている
He is stark mad―raving mad.
彼は全く英語を知らぬ
He knows no English at all―He does not know a word of English.
僕はそんなことは全く知らない
I don't know it at all―I know absolutely nothing of the matter―I am wholly in the dark about the affair.
これとあれとは全く何の関係も無い
This has absolutely nothing to do with that.
彼は全く無一物だ
He is absolutely penniless.
そんな物は全く無い
There are absolutely none.
どんな物だか全く知らない
I have no idea of what it is like.

content: 2. (=真に)truly; really; indeed; exactly; fairly; positively; just; all

content.content: 全く仰せの通りです
It is just as you say.
全くその通り
Exactly!―Just so!―(古文体では)―Even so!
全くそうです
It is truly so―really so.
全くです、全く本当です
It is true―It's a fact―I am speaking the truth.
全くですか
Is that true?
全く存じません
I really don't know.
全くの処存じません
Really,―Honestly and frankly,―I do not know.
彼は全くお話しの通りです
He is all you tell me.
君がそうだと言ったが全くその通りだ
You said so; and so, indeed, it is.
皆全く嬉し泣きに泣いた
Everybody fairly cried for joy.
全く驚いた
I am positively surprised.

content: 〈形〉(=の)(=純然たる)perfect (gentleman); complete (failure); total (destruction); utter (stranger); thorough (rascal); out-and-out (scoundrel); positive (nuisance); downright (swindle); sheer (waste); pure (fabrication)

content.content: 彼は全くの紳士だ

全くの悪党だ
He is a thorough rascal―an out-and-out scoundrel.
こりゃ全くの詐欺だ
It is a downright swindle.
彼は全くのしゃれ者だ
He is a positive dandy.
彼とは全くの他人です
He is a perfect stranger―a complete stranger―an utter stranger―to me.
全くの暗闇だ
It is utter darkness.
そりゃ全くの作りごとだ
It is a pure fabrication.
それは全くの金銭の浪費だ
It is a sheer waste of money.

content:

content:
まっち〔燐寸<マッチ>〕
〈名〉A match

content.content: マッチをすりつける
to strike a match―strike a light―light a match
火のついたマッチ
a lighted match
君マッチがあるか
Have you any matches?―Have you a match on you?
暗闇でマッチを手探りでさがした
I groped for the matches in the dark.
安全マッチ
safety-matches
螻マッチ
lucifer-matches―vestas
マッチ箱
a match-box
日本人はマッチ箱のような家に住んでいる(と西洋人は言う)

content:
まっとうする〔全うする〕

content.content: 天寿を全うする

望みを全うする

content:
まつば〔松葉〕
〈名〉Pine-needles

content.content: 松葉を掻き集める
to rake pine-needles together

まっぱい〔末輩〕
〈名〉One's subordinates; the underlings; small fry

まつばうど〔石刀柏〕
〈名〉The asparagus

content:
まっぱだか〔丸裸〕
〈形〉Stark naked

content.content: 彼は丸裸で涼んでいる
He is cooling himself stark naked―in buff―in a state of nature.
丸裸になる
to strip oneself stark naked―strip (oneself) to the skin
丸裸にする
to strip one stark naked―strip one to the skin
丸裸で褌も締めていない
There is not a shred of clothing on him.

content:
まつばづえ〔松葉杖〕
〈名〉A crutch

content.content: 松葉杖にすがって歩く
to walk on crutches

まつばぼたん〔松葉牡丹〕
〈名〉The sun-plant

まつばやし〔松林〕
〈名〉A pine-forest; a pinery

content:
まつばら〔松原〕
〈名〉A road bordered with pine-trees; a pinery

content.content: 長い松原ただ只一人
I am a solitary traveller on a pine-bordered road.
三保の松原
the pinery of Miho
君に別れて
When I part from thee
松原行けば
And through pinery fare,
松の露やら
The dew drops from the tree
涙やら
And mingles with my tear.

まつび〔末尾〕
〈名〉The end; the termination:(本の末尾は)the finis

content:
まっぴら〔真平〕
〈副〉Humbly

content.content: まっぴらご免なさい
I humbly beg your pardon.
そんな仕事はまっぴらご免をこうむる
I must excuse myself from such a task―I wish to be excused from such a task.
そんなことをするのはまっぴらだ
I would not do such a thing for the world―Nothing shall induce me to do such a thing.
そのお付き合いはまっぴらだ
I won't go with you in that―Nothing can induce me to go with you in that.
何でも致しますがそればかりはまっぴら
I would do anything but that.
どこへでも行くがあそこへだけはまっぴらだ
I would go anywhere but there.
あんなお客はまっぴらだ
I bless myself from such customers.
お世話焼きはまっぴらだ
Save me from my friends!
そんな改まった席はまっぴらだ
I can't stand such a formal company.
そんな物は熨斗を付けられてもまっぴらだ
I would not have it at a gift.
戦争はもうまっぴらだ
We have had enough of war―We deprecate any more wars.
彼女はまっぴらだと言うような顔をして僕の顔を見た
She looked in my face with a deprecatory countenance.

まっぴるま〔真昼間〕
〈副〉In broad daylight

content:
まっぷたつに〔真二つに〕
〈副〉In two; in twain

content.content: 真二つに切る
to cut anything in two
真二つに斬る
to cleave a man in twain

まっぽうだくせい〔末法濁世〕
〈名〉A degenerate age

content:
まっぽうのよ〔末法の世〕
〈名〉A degenerate age

content.content: あのような人はこの末法の世には稀だ
Such men are rarely to be met with in this degenerate age.

content:
まつみ〔待つ身〕
〈名〉One who waits

content.content: 待たれるとも待つ身になるな
Better be waited for than wait for another.
待つ身の辛さ
How hard it is to wait!
待つ身は長い
“A watched pot is long in boiling.”

まつむし〔松虫〕
〈名〉A kind of cricket

content:
まつり〔祭り〕
〈名〉A festival; a f?te; a celebration; a gala day

content.content: お祭りはいつですか
When does the festival take place?―When does the festival come off?―When is the festival to be held?
子どもらはお祭りを楽しみに待っている
The children look forward to the event.
子どもらはお祭りへ行きたがっている
The children are eager to go to the festival.
鎮守のお祭り
a village festival―a rural f?te
捷報に接して全国お祭りのようだった
The news of victory threw a festive air over the whole country.
いまさらそんなことを言っても後のお祭りだ
It is now too late―“a day after the fair”―to discuss the matter.
お祭着
a gala dress
江戸っ子はお祭り騒ぎが好きだ
The Edokko loves pageantry.

content:
まつりごと〔政〕
〈名〉Administration; government; the affairs (of state)

content.content: 政を執る
to administer the affairs of state
政を聴く
to hold court
政を専らにする
to rule arbitrarily―rule despotically
政武門に帰す
The administration of the land fell into the hands of military families.

content:
まつりこむ〔祭り込む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=祭らるる人の数に入れる)to canonize (a man)
2. (=邪魔になる人を邪魔にならぬ処へ片づける)to place (one) among the gods; to relegate (one to some inactive sphere); to kick (one) upstairs (to some sinecure office)

content.content: 彼は枢密院に祭り込まれた
He was placed among the gods of the Privy Council―relegated to the Privy Council―kicked upstairs into the Privy Council.

content:
まつりゅう〔末流〕
〈名〉
1. (=下流)the lower reaches (of a river)

content.content: 孔子の末流を汲む
to follow the doctrines of Confucius

content:
2. (=末孫)one's descendants
3. (=門下)(one's) disciples, followers

まつる〔祭る、祀る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=神を祭る)to worship (a god); to celebrate the festival of (a god); to dedicate, consecrate (a shrine to a god)

content.content: 先祖を祀る
to worship one's ancestors
戦死者は靖国神社へ祀られる
Those killed in battle are worshipped at the Yasukuni Shrine.
宮を建てて神を祭る
to erect a shrine to a god―dedicate a shrine to a god―consecrate a shrine to a god
天神を祭った社
a shrine dedicated to―consecrated to―sacred to―the God of Learning
あれは何神を祀った宮か
What god is that shrine sacred to?
招魂社は国家のために生命を棄てた勇士を祭った社である
The Shokonsha is a shrine sacred to the spirits of the heroes who fell fighting for their country.
先祖の霊を祀る
to perform religious service to the spirits of our ancestors
記念碑を建立して偉人の霊を祀る
A monument is erected to the spirit of a great man―(西洋ふうに言えば)―erected to the memory of a great man.
西郷隆盛の霊を祀る(碑文)
To the memory of Saigo Takamori.

content: 2. (=人を神に祀る)to deify, apotheosize (a man)

content.content: 菅公は神に祀られた
Sugawara Michizane has been apotheosized.
人の霊を祀る
to enshrine one's memory

content:
まつる〔祭る、祀る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=神を祭る)to worship (a god); to celebrate the festival of (a god); to dedicate, consecrate (a shrine to a god)

content.content: 先祖を祀る
to worship one's ancestors
戦死者は靖国神社へ祀られる
Those killed in battle are worshipped at the Yasukuni Shrine.
宮を建てて神を祭る
to erect a shrine to a god―dedicate a shrine to a god―consecrate a shrine to a god
天神を祭った社
a shrine dedicated to―consecrated to―sacred to―the God of Learning
あれは何神を祀った宮か
What god is that shrine sacred to?
招魂社は国家のために生命を棄てた勇士を祭った社である
The Shokonsha is a shrine sacred to the spirits of the heroes who fell fighting for their country.
先祖の霊を祀る
to perform religious service to the spirits of our ancestors
記念碑を建立して偉人の霊を祀る
A monument is erected to the spirit of a great man―(西洋ふうに言えば)―erected to the memory of a great man.
西郷隆盛の霊を祀る(碑文)
To the memory of Saigo Takamori.

content: 2. (=人を神に祀る)to deify, apotheosize (a man)

content.content: 菅公は神に祀られた
Sugawara Michizane has been apotheosized.
人の霊を祀る
to enshrine one's memory

content:
まつろ〔末路〕
〈名〉(One's) last days, end, fate

content.content: 英文学も末路なり
English literature is seeing its last days.
彼は末路憐むべし
His fate is to be pitied.
英雄の末路憐むべし
The great man had a miserable end.
末路振るわず
He outlived his fame―ended his life in obscurity.

まつわる〔纏わる〕
〈自動〉To be entangled (in something)

content:
まで〔迄〕
〈前置詞、接続詞相当(To; up to; down to; till; until; as far as)〉
1. ［時］(From morning) till (night); (from 8) to (12):(現在まで)till (now); to (this day); up to (the present):(過去のある時まで)up to (that time):(未来のある時まで)till, until (that time):(過去より現在まで)(from that time) down to (the present time):(未来のある時までに限り)not later than (the end of the month):(未来のある時までどうするに及ばぬ)(not) before (the end of the month, etc.)

content.content: 朝から晩まで働く
They work from morning till night―from dawn till dusk.
僕は九時から十二時まで授業がある
I teach from 9 to 12.
僕は五時までここに居る
I shall be here till five.
彼が帰るまで待とう
I will wait till he returns―(は接続詞、前置詞に用いれば)―till his return.
彼は夜遅くまで勉強する
He studies till late at night―far into the night.
追って沙汰をするまで待て
You are to wait till further notice.
あれまでは万事好都合であった
Up to that time, all had gone well.
病人は最後まで正気でおった
He remained conscious to the last.
現代までその習慣が続いた
The custom continued down to modern times.
今月末までは金を返すことは無い
You need not pay the money before the end of the month.
入学志願者は本月十五日までに出願すべし
Candidates for entrance shall apply not later than the 15th inst.
彼は今までここに居った
He has been here (till now).［注意］継続の Perfect Tense には「今まで」の意味を含むをもって“till now”を用いるの必要無し。ただし語勢を強める時はその代用語を用いる。
今までこの長い間どこにおったか
Where have you been all this while?
今日まで何の便りも無い
Nothing has been heard from him to this day―up to the present.
今まで発見された事実はこれだけである
These are the only facts that have been discovered up to date―down to date.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 今までのところではまだ判然したことはわからぬ
Nothing definite is known so far―thus far.
日の入るまで一時間しか無い
It is only an hour from sunset.
日の入るまで一時間も無い
It is not an hour from sunset―within an hour of sunset.
試験まで一週間しか無い
We are only a week from the examination.
百まで生きる者は少ない
Few people live to be a hundred.
お前百までわしゃ九十九まで
“Till death do us part.”
死ぬまで忘れません
I shall remember it as long as I live―the longest day I have to live.
いつまでここに居るか
How long shall you stay here?

content: 2. ［場所］(From Tokyo) to (Kyoto); up to (some mark); as far as (some place)

content.content: 東京から京都まで汽車で何時間かかるか
How long does it take to go by train from Tokyo to Kyoto?
神戸まで汽車で行く
I am going as far as Kobe by rail.
ちょうと鎌倉まで行って来る
I am just going down to Kamakura.
水が膝まで来た
The water came up to my knees.
どこまで行くのか
How far are you going?
ここまではよろしい
So far, so good.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: この前はどこまで読みましたか
Where did we leave off last time?
そこまでは気がつかなかった
I did not notice that.
そこまでは手が届くまい
They can not be so careful.
彼の言うことはどこまで本当だかわからない
I can not tell to what extent his statement is true.
彼はどこまで慾張っているかわからん
His avarice knows so bounds.

content: 3. ［程度］To (the end); up to (100 yen); down to (the lowest people); as far as, so far as (some limit)

content.content: しまいまで聴いて下さい
Hear me to the end!―Hear me out!
郵税は四匁までは三銭
The postage is three sen up to four momme.
百円までお預かり致します
Sums up to 100 yen are received in deposit.
百円までは出そう
I will go as far as 100 yen.
それまで出す気か
Will you go so far as that?―go that length?
上御一人より我々の果てに至るまで
from the Emperor down to ourselves

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: まかり間違えば死ぬまでのことさ
I can but die at the worst.
君がいやだと言えばそれまでだ
It you say no, there is an end of the matter.
やりそこなやそれまでさ
If we fail, there is an end of it.
君がいやなら他に人を捜すまでのことさ
If you will not do it, I will find another man who will―that's all.
十人が九人まではそう言う
Nine out of ten men will say so.
お礼の印までにさし上げます
I present it in token of my gratitude.
まずはお伺いまで
With kind inquiries.

content:
までに〔迄に〕
〈前置詞相当〉By (that time); before (the end of the month); not later than (some date)

content.content: 試験までに帰る
I shall be back by the examination.
稽古が始まるまでにはできます
I shall have it ready by the time school begins―before school begins.
それまでに僕は東京を去る
I shall have left Tokyo by that time.
金は今月末までに返せ
You must pay the money by the end of the month.
金は今月末までに返せばよい
You need not pay the money before the end of the month.
入学志願者は本月十五日までに出願すべし
Candidates for entrance shall apply not later than the 15th inst.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 日の入るまでに一時間しか無い
It is only an hour from sunset.
日の入るまでに一時間も無い
It is not an hour from sunset―We are within an hour of sunset.
試験まで一週間しか無い
We are only a week from the examination.
今日までに発見された事実はこれだけである
These are the only facts that have been discovered up to date―down to date.

content:
までも
〈副〉
1. (名詞を形容すれば)even; the very; not excepting (the king)

content.content: 彼はこれらの事実までも疑う
He doubts even these facts.
彼は鍋釜までも質に入れる
He pawns even his pot and pan.
下女下男までも彼をばかにしている
His very servants despise him.
三尺の童子までもこれを知っている
Even the children know it―The very children know it.
あまり見すぼらしい身なりをしていたものだから車屋までもあやしんですぐに乗せてくれなかった
I was so shabbily dressed that the very rickshaman looked twice at me before taking me.
主人までも皆働く
Everybody works, not excepting the master.
彼は奴隷に売られたことまでもある
He was even sold for a slave.

content: 2. (動詞を形容すれば)to go so far as to (do something); to go the length of (doing something)

content.content: 彼は夜の灯火までも倹約する
He goes so far as to do without a lamp at night―goes the length of doing without a lamp at night.
借金をしてまでも買うことは無い
You need not go so far as to borrow money―go the length of borrowing money―in order to buy it.
貧に迫って泥棒までもした
He went so far as to commit theft―went the length of committing theft―stooped to theft―under the pressure of necessity.
彼は追従までもして目的を遂げる
He stoops to flattery to effect his purpose.
乞食までもしたことがある
He once stooped to beggary―descended to beggary.

content: 〈時の前置詞相当〉To (this day); to (all ages)

content.content: 事実は今日までも判明しない
The fact remains unknown to this day.
その名は万世までも伝わらん
His name shall be handed down to all ages.
いつまでも待ってはいられない
I can not wait for ever.

content:
までもない
〈助動詞〉Need not:(形容詞に訳せば)needless

content.content: 言うまでもないことだ
I need not say―It is needless to say―It goes without saying.
その意味は尋ねるまでもない
We need not ask the meaning―It is needless to ask the meaning.

まてんかく〔摩天閣〕
〈名〉A sky-scraper

content:
まと〔的〕
〈名〉A mark:(射的の的)a target; a butt:(目的の的)an object

content.content: 的に命中する
to hit the mark
的をはずれる
to miss the mark
玉がうんと的をはずれた
The shot went wide of the mark.
玉が的に届かぬ
The shot fell short of the mark.
玉が的を越した
The shot went beyond the mark.
的を越して撃つ
to overshoot the mark
的を狙う
to aim at a mark
遠距離の的を狙う
to shoot at rovers
的を射る
to shoot a mark―(命中するの意味なら)―hit the mark
那須の与一は扇の的を射た
Nasu-no-Yoichi hit the fan with an arrow.
この船は敵弾の的になる
The ship offers an easy target.
総理大臣はたいがい攻撃の的になる
The premier generally becomes the target of attack―a target for attack.
彼は嘲笑の的になった
He became a butt of ridicule.
嘲笑の的
a butt―a laughing-stock
羨望の的
an object of envy
彼は成功したために仲間間の羨望の的となった
His success made him an object of envy to his companions.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 命を的にする
to risk one's life
彼は命を的にして冒険した
He made a venture at the risk of his life.
命を的にして栄誉を求める
to risk one's life for glory
命を的にして獲物を争う
to risk one's life for the prize
命を的にして争う
to stake one's life on the contest

content:
まど〔窓〕
〈名〉A window:(開き窓)a casement:(上げ下げ窓)a sash-window

content.content: 窓を明ける
to open the window―(上げ下げ窓なら)―raise the window―throw up the sash
窓を明けておけ
Keep the window open!
窓を締める
to shut the window―(上げ下げ窓なら)―let down the sash
一人の婦人が窓に立っていた
A lady was standing at the window.
その人が窓へ出て来た
He appeared at the window.
彼は窓際に読書をしておった
He was reading at the window.
窓の外に立ち聞きをしている者がある
Some one is eavesdropping under the window.
窓の梅
a plum-tree outside my window
窓から覗く
(内からなら)to look out of the window―(外からなら)―look in at the window
汽車の窓から海が見える
You get a view of the sea from the car window―through the car window.
窓が通りに向かっている、海を見晴らす、河を見晴らす、湖水を見晴らす、庭の方へ向かっている、中庭の方へ向かっている
The window―looks out on the street―looks out on the sea―looks out across the river―looks out across the lake―looks out into the garden―looks out into the court.
光線が窓から入る
Light comes in at the window―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The window lets in the light―The window admits the light.
壁に窓が明けてある
The wall is pierced with windows.
窓の無い壁
a blank wall
家にはたくさん窓がある
The house is well windowed.
窓掛け
a window-curtain
窓に窓掛けが掛けてある
The window is hung with a curtain.
窓にガラスを張る
to glaze a window
窓ガラス
window-glass―window-panes
窓枠
a window-frame
張り出し窓
a bow-window
船室の窓
a port

content:
まとい〔団居〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: まどい〔団居〕

content:
まとい〔纏い〕
〈名〉A fireman's standard

content.content: 纏い持ち
the standard-bearer

content:
まどい〔団居〕
〈名〉A family circle; a fireside

content.content: 楽しき一家の団居
a pleasant fireside

まどい〔惑い〕
〈名〉
1. (=思い違い)delusion
2. (=当惑)perplexity
3. (=誘惑)temptation

content:
まとう〔纏う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=巻き付く)to twine round, wind round (anything)
2. (=つけまとう)to dangle after, dangle about (a girl)
3. (=身にまとう、着る)to wrap (oneself in a blanket―a blanket about one); to wear (clothes); to be dressed in (foreign clothes); to be clad in (rags)

content.content: 旅人は身に雨合羽をまとっておった
The traveller was clad in a rain-coat.
彼は身にボロをまとっている
He is clad in rags.
身に毛布をまとって青天井で夜を明かした
I passed the night under the blue sky wrapped in a blanket―with a blanket (wrapped) about me.

まどう〔賠う〕
〈他動〉To compensate (one for a loss); to make up for (a loss); to make good (a loss)

content:
まどう〔魔道〕
〈名〉
1. (=邪教)heresy; heretical doctrines; heterodoxy
2. (=邪道)evil courses; evil ways

content.content: 魔道に入る
to fall into evil courses―stray from the path of duty―go astray

content:
まどう〔惑う〕
〈自動〉
1. (=思い誤る)to be deluded; to be deceived; to be mistaken

content.content: 四十にして惑わず
I ceased to doubt at forty.

content:
2. (=当惑する)to be puzzled; to be perplexed
3. (=誘惑される)to be tempted; to be seduced from duty

まとまった〔纏まった〕
〈形〉
1. (=百とか五十とか円く集まった)round

content.content: まとまった金
a round sum
そんなまとまった金は早速にはできない
I can not raise such a round sum―such a lump sum―at a moment's notice.

content: 2. (=大きな)large

content.content: 方々からまとまった註文があります
We have large orders from various quarters.

content: 3. (=一定の)definite

content.content: 僕はその問題についてはまとまった考えは無い
I have no definite ideas on the subject.

content:
まとまり〔纏り〕
〈名〉
1. (=落着)conclusion; settlement

content.content: まとまりがつく
to come to a conclusion―come to a settlement
談判はまとまりがついた
The negotiations have come to a conclusion―arrived at a conclusion.
事件はまとまりがつかない
The matter has not come to a settlement―not arrived at a settlement.
早くまとまりをつけたい
I wish to bring the matter to a settlement.
まとまりをつける
(談判なら)to conclude the negotiations―bring the negotiations to a conclusion―(事件なら)―settle the matter―bring the matter to a settlement
話はまとまりがつくだろうと思う
I hope we shall come to an agreement―come to an understanding―come to terms.

content: 2. (=完成)completion; completeness

content.content: まとまりがつく
to be completed―come to a completion
まとまりをつける
to complete anything―bring anything to a completion
彼の仕事はまとまりがつかない
His work is wanting in completeness.
彼は種々の事に手を出すが一つもまとまりをつけない
He attempts many things, but completes nothing―bring nothing to a completion.
会議はなんのまとまりがもつかずに終わった
The conference came to no end―arrived at no result.

content: 3. (=取締り)control

content.content: 彼はあまり手を拡げたのでまとまりがつかなっくなったのだ
His operations are extensive that he can not bring them under control―His business is so extensive that he can not control it.
まとまりの無い話し
a rambling talk
まとまりのつかない長話しをして暇をつぶした
We wasted our time in a long and rambling talk.

content:
まとまる〔纏まる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=落着する、整う)to be settled, come to a settlement, arrive at a settlement; to be concluded, come to a conclusion, arrive at a conclusion; to be arranged, lend itself to arrangement; to be adjusted; to be agreed upon; to be brought about; to come about

content.content: 事件が早くまとまればよいが
I wish the matter would be settled―come to a settlement.
談判はまとまった
The negotiations have been concluded―come to conclusion.
相談がまとまった
We have come to an agreement―come to an understanding―come to terms.
相談がまとまらぬ
We can not come to terms.
彼が僕の後任になることに話がまとまった
We have come to an agreement―We have agreed―It is agreed between us―that he shall take my place.
せっかくまとまりかけた相談をこわしてしまった
We broke off negotiations after very nearly coming to an understanding.
あの人は雇うと言えば相談がまとまる
He is negotiable.
甲君と乙嬢との間に縁談がまとまった
A marriage has been arranged between Mr. A and Miss B.
縁談がまとまらない
The marriage can not be arranged―does not lend itself to arrangement.
せっかくまとままりかけた縁談が破談になった
The match was broken off after very nearly being arranged.
議がまとまる
to come to a decision
議遂にまとまらず
We came to no decision after all.
争論がまとまった
The dispute has been adjusted―been amicably settled―come to an amicable settlement.
両者間に契約がまとまった
A contract has been concluded between the two parties.
給料の相談がまだまとまらない
The terms are not yet agreed upon.
二人の仲はどうしてまとまったか
How did reconciliation come about?―How was the reconciliation brought about?
田中君の斡旋で事がまとまった
The thing was brought about through the good offices of Mr. Tanaka.

content: 2. (=完成する)to be completed; to come to a completion

content.content: 仕事がまとまらない
The work is not completed.
これでは仕事がまとまらない
This will hinder the completion of the work.
著述はまとまった
The work is completed―The work has come to a completion―The work has been brought to a completion.
あの人は仕事のまとまらない人だ
He has no genius for creation.
会議はまとまらず終った
The conference came to no end―arrived at no result.

content: 3. (=形成する)to take shape; to settle into shape

content.content: 考えがまとまらない
My ideas do not take shape.
考えがだんだんとまとまって来た
My ideas have gradually taken shape.
僕はその問題についてはまとまった考えは無い
I have no definite ideas on the subject.
あれは考えのまとまらない人だ
He has flighty ideas―He is a flighty genius.
局面がまとまってから手を出すがよい
Your had better wait till the situation settles into shape before dealing with it.

content: 4. (=集まる)to be got together; to be made up

content.content: 金がまとまったか
Have you made up the (required) sum?
金がまとまらない
I can't make up the sum―make out the sum.
人数がまとまったか
Have you made up a party?
人数がまとまるにまだ十人足りない
Ten men are still wanting to make up a party.

content:
まとめ〔纏め〕
〈名〉Lumping

content.content: ひとまとめにする
to lump things together―lump this with that
一年分の給料を一まとめにして貰った
I received a year's pay in a lump.
一まとめにして買う
to buy in a lump
一まとめにして売る
to sell in the lump―in the gross―en masse

content:
まとめて〔纏めて〕
〈副〉In a lump; in the lump; in the gross; en masse

content.content: 一年分の給料をまとめて貰った
I received a year's pay in a lump.
まとめて払う
to pay in a lump―pay down a lump sum
いくつかまとめて買えば安い
If you buy so many in a lump, they will be cheaper.
まとめて売る
to sell in the lump―sell in the gross―sell en masse
まとめて註文する
to give a large order
まとめて註文すれば多少割引をする
Some reduction will be made for a large order.
明日は荷物をまとめて引越して来る
I shall move here bag and baggage tomorrow.
この品々をまとめて届けて下さい
Please send these things all together.

content:
まとめる〔纏める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=整える)to settle, bring (a matter) to a settlement; to conclude, bring (the negotiations) to a conclusion; to adjust, bring (a dispute) to an adjustment; to arrange (a marriage); to being about (a reconciliation)

content.content: まず第一にこの事件をまとめなければならぬ
We must first settle this matter―bring this matter to a settlement.
この事は早くまとめなければならぬ
The matter requires speedy settlement.
争いをまとめる
to settle a dispute―adjust a dispute―bring the dispute to an adjustment―bring the dispute to an amicable settlement
双方に不平の無いようにまとめてみよう
I will settle it to satisfaction of both parties.
談判をまとめた
We have concluded the negotiations―brought the negotiations to a conclusion.
談判があまり長引くから早くいずれかにまとめるようにしたいものだ
The negotiations have been protracted too long. I wish to bring the matter to a crisis.
先方では相談をまとめたがっている
The other party is desirous to come to an agreement―come to an understanding―come to terms.
取引をまとめる
to close a transaction―close a bargain
縁談をまとめる
to arrange a marriage―make up a marriage―make a match
どうかしてこの縁談をまとめたいものだ
I am anxious to successfully arrange the marriage.
こんな会をまとめるのは面倒なものだ
It is a great trouble to arrange such a meeting.
二人の仲をまとめてみよう
I will try and bring about a reconciliation between the two―heal the breach between the two.
まとまるものならまとめておくれ
Reconcile me with him if it can be done!

content: 2. (=完成する)to complete; to bring (anything) to a completion

content.content: この著述を早くまとめよう
I will bring my work to a speedy completion―make an end of my work―dispatch my work.

content: 3. (=形成する)to get (things) into shape; to reduce (to rule)

content.content: 考えをまとめる
to get one's ideas into shape―throw one's thoughts into shape
(事が乱雑になっているから)ちとまとめなければ手が付けられぬ
I must get matters into shape a little before I can deal with them.
規則にまとめる
to reduce anything to rules

content: 4. (=集める)to collect (materials); to get (things) together; to lump (things) together; to make up (a sum or party)

content.content: 荷物をまとめる
to get one's things together
荷物をまとめて来い
You must get your traps together before you come.
明日は荷物をまとめてこちらへ引越す
I shall move here bag and baggage tomorrow.
幾口もの品を一つにまとめる
to lump many items together
金をまとめる
to make up a sum―make out a sum
九十円あるから十円足してちょうど百円にまとめておこう
I will make it up into a round hundred.
人数をまとめる
to make up a party
材料をまとめるに骨が折れた
I had much ado to collect the materials.→『まとめて〔纏めて〕』

content:
まともに〔真正面に〕
〈副〉Right in front

content.content: まともに日を受ける
to have the sun in one's eyes
まともに風を受けて走るのは汽船
A steamer can run in the wind's eye―in the teeth of the wind.
まともに人の顔を見る
to look one full in the face
彼にまともに向かえるか
Can you stand up to him?
まともに向かっては勝てまい
You stand no chance against him in a stand-up fight.

content:
まどり〔間取り〕
〈名〉The arrangement of rooms in a house; the plan of a house

content.content: この家は間取りが好い
The house is well planned―The rooms are well laid out.

content:
マドロス
〈名〉A sailor; a seaman; a tar

content.content: あの人はマドロスふうがある
He has a slouched air.

まどろみ〔微睡み〕
〈名〉A doze; a drowse

content:
まどろむ〔微睡む〕
〈自動〉To drowse; to doze

content.content: ちょっとまどろんだ
I fell into a doze―dropped into a doze―dropped off into a doze.

content:
まどわす〔惑わす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=瞞す、誤らせる)to delude; to mislead

content.content: 未熟な批評は世を惑わすのみである
Immature criticism can only tend to mislead the public.

content:
2. (=当惑させる)to puzzle; to perplex; to mystify
3. (=誘惑する)to tempt (one to do wrong); to seduce (one from duty); to debauch (one's mind)

content.content: 未熟な批評は作者の心を惑わすのみである
Immature criticism serves only to debauch the mind of the writer.

まないた〔爼〕
〈名〉A chopping-board:(に相当するは)a dresser; a trencher

content:
まなこ〔眼〕
〈名〉The eye

content.content: ぱっちりした眼だ
She has a pair of bright and large eyes.
眠い眼
sleepy eyes―heavy eyes

まなじり〔眥〕
〈名〉The outer corner of the eye; the external canthus

まなづる〔真名鶴〕
〈名〉The white-naped crane

content:
まなび〔学び〕
〈名〉Learning; study

content.content: 学びの道
learning
学びの庭
a school
学びの友
a school-mate

content:
まなぶ〔学ぶ〕
〈自他動〉To learn; to study; to take lessons in (jujutsu); to take a course in (physics or chemistry); to acquire knowledge

content.content: 英語を学ぶ
to learn English―study English
どこで英語を学んだか
Where did you learn your English?
五年間英語を学んでいる
I have been studying English for five years.
彼は英国人について英語を学んだ
He has studied English under an Englishman.
彼は当時第一流の学者について学んだ
He has studied under―studied with―the first scholars of the day...
英語を学ぶに近道は無いものか
Is there no royal road to English?
中学校にいた時剣衛と柔術を学んだ
I took lessons in fencing and jujutsu while at the middle school.
彼は大学で化学を学んだ
He took a course in chemistry at the university.
君はこの本は誰に学んだか
With whom did you read this book?
文を学ぶ
to form one's style
大家の作を読んで文を学んだ
I formed my style by reading great writers.
会話は本では学べない
Conversation is not to be learned from books.
学校で学んだことは役に立たぬものが多い
Many things learned at school are useless.
医者は漢方からも学ぶ処がある
Doctors may take a lesson from the Chinese school of medicine.
人の賢愚は学ぶと学ばざるとによる
Wisdom depends on learning.
人の愚を学ぶ
to imitate one's folly
教えるは学ぶの半ば
“To teach is to learn.”
よく学びよく遊べ
“Work while you work, play while you play.”

content:
まにあう〔間に合う〕
〈自動〉
1. (=時間に後れぬ)to be in time (for something); to be ready; to catch (the train)

content.content: 汽車に間に合ったか
Were you in time for the train?―Did you catch the train?
急行には間に合わなかった(ひと足遅かった)
I was not in time for the express―too late for the express.
僕は試験の間に合うように帰る
I shall be back in time for the examination.
博覧会の間に合うように上京する
I shall come to town in time to see the fair.
早く起きて一番汽車の間に合った
I got up so early as to be in time for the first train.
一番汽車の間に合うように早く起きた
I got up early, so as to be in time for the first train.
急げば間に合います
Make haste, and you will be in time.
急がないと間に合わないよ
Make haste, or you will be too late.
きちんと時間に間に合った
I was there on the stroke.
やっと時間に間に合った
I was there in the nick of time.
仕事が間に合ったか
Is your work ready?
定刻までに間に合う
It will be ready by the appointed time.
その金はとっさの間に合わない
The money can not be ready at a moment's notice.
早速の間に合う金
available money

content: 2. (=用が足りる)to answer the purpose; to serve one's turn; to do (the business); to be useful; to be enough; to be sufficient:(収入なら)to make both ends meet

content.content: 百円で間に合う
One hundred you is enough―sufficient―One hundred yen will answer the purpose―serve my turn―do (the business).
これだけありゃ当分間に合う
This sum will do for the present.
しかたがなけりゃこの家でも間に合う
This house will do at a pinch.
何紙でも間に合う
Any paper will answer the purpose―Any paper will do.
こんな品では間に合わぬ
This article will not answer the purpose―This won't do.
この金が無くとも間に合う
I can do without this money―manage without this money―make shift without this money.
百円もあれば間に合う
100 yen will do―I can do with 100 yen―manage with 100 yen―put up with 100 yen―make shift with 100 yen.
彼がいなくともけっこう間に合う
We can do very well without him―He can be very well done without.
あれはなかなか間に合う男だ
I find him quite useful.
こんな物はいざという時間に合わぬ
Such things are useless in the moment of action.
本はあるけれども部数が間に合わぬ
The book is to be had, but there are not enough copies.
金は間に合うだけあるか
Have you enough money?
今の収入で間に合うか
Can you make both ends meet?―meet your expenses?
僕は金は要らぬ、間に合うだけあればよい
I don't care for wealth. I only wish to make both ends meet.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 油は今夜中間に合うか
Will the oil last through the night?
薪は冬期中間に合わぬ
The fuel will not last through the winter.

content:
まにあわせ〔間に合わせ〕
〈名〉A shift; a makeshift; a temporary expedient

content.content: これでも一時の間に合わせになる
This will do for a shift―serve as a makeshift.
間に合わせ普請だ
It is a makeshift (of a) building.
(何でも)一時の間に合わせにこしらえる
to patch up anything
この教科書は一時の間に合わせに作ったものらしい
The text-book seems to have been patched up for the occasion.
間に合わせ細工
a patchwork
間に合わせを言う
to make a temporary excuse―make evasions―give evasive answers―use subterfuges
そんな間に合わせを言ったって駄目だ
Such excuses won't do.

content:
まにあわせる〔間に合わせる〕
〈自動〉(=用を足りさす)to make (anything) do; to manage with (anything); to put up with (anything); to make shift with (anything):(収入でなら)to make both ends meet

content.content: 一時この金で間に合わせよう
I will make the sum do―manage with the sum―make shift with the sum―for a time.
これでとっさの間に合わせよう
I will make it do for the moment.
この品でお間に合わせ下さることができましょうか
Could you manage with the article?―put up with the article?―make shift with the article?
(月給で暮らせるかと問われても)どうかこうか間に合わせる
I can make both ends meet.
どうでもこうでも間に合わせていけりゃ結構だ
If you can make both ends meet, it is well.

content: 〈他動〉(=調える)to have (anything) ready

content.content: 大金のことですから即座にはお間に合わせかねます
As it is such a big sum of money, I can not have it ready at a moment's notice.
明晩までにはきっとお間に合わせます
I will not fail to have it ready by tomorrow evening.

content:
まにまに
〈副〉As one pleases; at one's pleasure

content.content: 御意のまにまに
Do as you please!
去るも留まる御意のまにまに
You may go or stay at your pleasure―at your sweet pleasure.
御意のまにまにご処分下さい
Deal with me as you think fit!
船は風波のまにまに漂った
The ship drifted at the mercy of the wind and waves.

content:
まにんげん〔真人間〕
〈名〉A true man:(気違いに対しては)a sane man; a man in his right mind; a man is his senses

content.content: これは真人間の仕業とは思われぬ
It can not be the doing of a man in his senses.
真人間とは思われぬ、真人間ではあるまいと思う
I doubt his sanity.
これから心を入れ換えて真人間になります
I will turn over a new leaf, and be a new man.
心を入れ換えて真人間になるなら赦してやる
If you will amend, I will pardon you.
あの道楽者に意見して真人間のしてやろう
I will speak to the libertine, and try to reclaim him.
彼は真人間になる見込が無い
He is beyond reclaim―past reclaim―past praying for.

content:
まぬかれる〔免れる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=遁れる)to escape; to miss; to get off

content.content: 厄を免れる
to escape a calamity
けがを免れる
to escape an accident―miss an accident
鉄道椿事でけがを免れた者は少ない
Few escaped accidents in the railway disaster.
危ないところを免れた
He had a narrow escape―It was a close shave.
僅に身をもって免れた
I escaped with bare life.

content: 2. (=助かる)to be saved from, save oneself from (ruin); to be rescued from (drowning); to be delivered from (danger)

content.content: 危難を免れる
to escape danger―be delivered from a danger
死を免れる
to escape death―save oneself from death―save one's life―save one's neck
万死を免れる
to be snatched from the jaws of death
彼は溺死を免れた
He was rescued from drowning.
お蔭をもって当家も滅亡を免れました
You have saved the house from ruin.

content: 3. (=免除される)to be freed from, free oneself from (an obligation); to be excused from, excuse oneself from (a task); to be exempted from (military service); to be released from (a promise); to be discharged from (obligations); to be relieved of (trouble); to be rid of, get rid of, rid oneself of (trouble); to be free from (faults); to be exempt from (censure); to be immune from (a disease)

content.content: 兵役を免れる
to be exempted from military service―miss being a soldier
身体不合格のため徴兵を免れた
He was exempted from military service owing to disqualification―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Physical disqualification exempted him from military service.
困難を免れる
to escape a difficulty―get rid of difficulty
この煩いを免れたならありがたい
I should be thankful to be rid of this trouble―to be relieved of this trouble.
ご免こうむってこの仕事を免れた
I have excused myself from the task.
言い訳をして責めを免れる
to excuse oneself from blame
欠点を免れる人は無い
No man is free from faults.
彼は不取締りの非難を免れぬ
He is not exempt from the censure of mismanagement―open to the charge of mismanagement.
この病を免れる人がある
Some people are immune from this disease.
債券を免れる
to be discharged from one's liabilities

content: 4. (=避ける)to avoid; to evade; to elude; to shirk

content.content: 義務を免れる
to evade one's duty―shirk one's duty―be freed from obligations―be discharged from one's obligations
責任を免れる
to shirk one's responsibility―shuffle off one's responsibility
罪を免れる
to elude punishment―escape punishment―get off―go scot free
この場合は戦争は免れられぬ
War is not to be avoided―inevitable.
死は免れられぬ
Death is inevitable.

content:
5. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 訴訟を起こせば多少の入費は免れぬ
A lawsuit involves more or less expense.
戦争をすれば国債は免れぬ
A war involves national debt.
この手術は多少の危険を免れぬ
The operation involves some danger.
そうすれば日本は戦争を免れぬ
Then Japan would be involved in war―(他動詞構文にすれば)―That would involve Japan in war.
生あるものは死を免れず
Life is subject to death.
船は沈没を免れぬ
The ship can not be saved from sinking―The ship must go down.
船長は両船間の衝突を免れないと見た
The captain saw that a collision must take place between the two ships.
彼は滅亡を免れぬ
He can not escape ruin―He must be ruined.
この法則は免れられぬ
This law is fatal.
法律を免れる
to keep out of the clutches of the law
彼らはいわゆる免れて恥無きの徒である
They are what we call men who know not shame if they keep out of the meshes of the law.
彼の処置は緩慢の非難を免れぬ
His conduct is open to the charge of laxity.

content:
まぬけ〔間抜け〕
〈名〉A stupid fellow; a gawk; a blockhead:(=た) stupid

content.content: こんなわかりきった間違いを見落とすとはどうした間抜けだ
How stupid of you to overlook such an obvious mistake!
彼は絵草紙屋を眺めていて懐中物を掏られるとはずいぶん間抜けだ
It is very stupid of him to have his pocket picked while staring at a shop-window.
そんな間抜けた話しがあるものか
What a stupid idea!
間抜け面
a stupid face―a stupid look
間抜けな面をして突立っている
He stand with a stupid look.
なんだって間抜けな面をして突立っているんだ
Why do you stand like a gawk?
間抜けめ
You gawk!―Damn you!
気を付けろい間抜けめ
Have a care, you gawk!

content:
まぬるい〔間緩い〕
〈形〉Slow; tardy

content.content: そんなやり方は間ぬるい
You go about it too slowly.

content:
まね〔真似〕
〈名〉
1. (=模倣)imitation; mimicry:(=る、=する) to imitate (one's manner); to mimic (people); to copy (one's manners); to ape (one's betters); to play (the master); to follow one's example; to be influenced by one's example; to take a leaf out of one's book

content.content: 西洋風を真似る
to imitate foreign manners
猿が人の真似をする
A monkey will mimic man.
オウムが人の真似をする
A parrot will imitate human speech―learn to talk.
彼は人真似が上手だ
He mimics people to a hair―He is a good mimic.
あの娘は虚栄心が強くて人真似が好きだ
She is vain, and likes to ape her betters.
あのような人を真似るがよい、ああいうふうを真似るがよい
You ought to copy such men―copy after such manners.
(主人の不在に)下男が主人の真似をする(狂言をする)
The servant plays the master.
子どもらが医者の真似をして遊んでいる
The children are playing (at) doctor.
あの庭は東海道を真似て作ってある
The garden is laid out in imitation of the Tokaido.
ちょっと君の真似をしてみたのさ
I only followed your example―took a leaf out of your book.
彼は誰かの真似をしたのだろう
He must have been influenced by some example.
僕の真似をすることは無い
Let not my example influence you!

content: 2. (=振り)pretence; feint; simulation:(=する) to pretend (to be ill); to feign (illness); to sham (illness); to make believe (that one is ill); to make a feint of (illness); to simulate (insanity); to dissemble (madness); to counterfeit (virtue, etc.)

content.content: 死んだ真似をする
to pretend to be dead―feign death―sham death―make believe that one is dead
彼は眠った真似をしているのだ
He makes believe that he is asleep―pretends to be asleep―feigns sleep―shams sleep.
病気の真似をする
to pretend to be ill―feign illness―sham illness
彼は自害する真似をしたのだ
He made a feint of committing suicide.
気違いの真似をする
to dissemble madness―simulate insanity
偽善者は善人の真似をする
A hypocrite simulates virtue―counterfeits virtue.

content: 3. (=挙動)behaviour:(=する) to behave

content.content: そんな真似をするな
Do not behave so!
いやらしい真似をするな
Do not behave horribly!
気違いじみた真似をするな
Do not behave like a madman!
ばかの真似をする
to play the fool
ばかな真似をするな
Don't make an ass of yourself!
彼は勝手な真似をする
He will have everything his own way.
ふざけた真似
foolery―tomfoolery
ふざけた真似は止せ
None of your tomfooleries!

content:
まねき〔招き〕
〈名〉Invitation

content.content: お招きに預って有難う存じます
Thank you for your kind invitation―I am delighted to accept your invitation.
招きに応ずる
to accept an invitation
招きを断る
to decline an invitation
先約が有りますからせっかくのお招きですがお断り致します
Previous engagement compels me to decline your kind invitation.
お招きによって参ったのです
I came at your invitation―by your invitation―on your invitation.

まねきねこ〔招き猫〕
〈名〉(A figure of) a beckoning cat

content:
まねく〔招く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=手招きする)to beckon (to one)
2. (=招待する)to invite (one to dinner); to ask (one to tea); to bid (one to a wedding)

content.content: 園遊会に招かれた
I am invited to a garden-party―I have received an invitation to a garden party.
よそへ招かれることはめったに無い
I am not asked out every day.
婚礼へ招かれて行って来た
I have been bidden to a wedding―I have been at a wedding―I have been a guest at a wedding.
彼一人招かれなかった
He alone was not invited―He was left out of the invitation.

content: 3. (=招聘する)to engage (a professional); to call in (a doctor); to send for (the doctor)

content.content: 医師を招いた
The doctor was sent for―A doctor was called in.
礼を厚くして人を招く
to engage a man on liberal terms
妓を招く
to engage singing-girls (for a drinking party)

content: 4. (=来す)to incur (one's displeasure); to court (danger); to expose oneself to (ridicule); to lay oneself open to (censure); to draw (the wrath of Heaven) on oneself; to bring (ruin) on oneself; to bring down (shame) on one's head

content.content: 彼は命に背いて主人の怒りを招いた
He incurred his master's displeasure by disobeying orders.
非難を招く
to incur blame―draw censure on oneself―lay oneself open to censure
そんなことをすると世間の非難を招く
If you do such a thing, you will lay yourself open to public-censure―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Such conduct will lay you open to public censure.
君の行為は非難を招く
Your conduct lies open to censure―lays you open to censure.
嘲弄を招く
to expose oneself to ridicule―get laughed at
そんなことをすると笑いを招くばかりだ
You will only get laughed at for your pains―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Such conduct will expose you to ridicule.
身の破滅を招く
to draw ruin on oneself―bring ruin on oneself―bring down ruin on one's head
天罰を招く
to draw the wrath of Heaven on oneself―bring down Heaven's vengeance on one's head
恥辱を招く
to bring down shame on one's head
危険を招く
to incur danger―court danger―fly in the face of Providence
疑いを招く
to incur suspicion―excite suspicion
彼は急に金持ちになって世の疑いを招いた
He incurred suspicion by suddenly growing rich.
疑いを招かないように別々に行った
We went each by himself so as not to excite suspicion―to disarm suspicion.
彼は小敵と侮って敗北を招いた
He brought defeat on himself by despising a small enemy.
誤解を招く
to be misunderstood
彼は不注意なために人の誤解を招く
He is misunderstood owing to his carelessness―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His carelessness causes him to be misunderstood.
君は弁明しないと世の誤解を招く
If you do not explain your conduct, people will view it in a false light―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Your silence will place your conduct in an unfavourable light.
禍を招く
to bring a calamity on oneself
それは自ら招いた禍だ
You have brought the calamity on yourself.
君が自ら招いた失敗だからしかたがない
You must thank yourself for your failure―You have no one but yourself to thank for your failure.
そんなことをすると後難を招くおそれがある
Such a step may be attended with serious consequences.
病を招く
to bring a disease on oneself―contract a disease
死を招く
to court death

content:
まねごと〔真似事〕
〈名〉Mockery; mummery

content.content: 裁判の真似事をした
They made a mockery of trial.
三々九度の真似事をやった
They went through a mummery of marriage ceremony.

content:
まのあたり〔目のあたり〕
〈副〉
1. (=目前に、直接に)with one's own eyes; face to face; oneself

content.content: 目のあたり見たのだから間違い無い
There can be no mistake, for I saw it with my own eyes―for these eyes have seen it―for I was eye-witness of the affair.
目のあたりその人に会ったのだ
I saw him face to face.
目のあたり彼に逢ったのだからこれほど確かな事は無い
Nothing can be more certain, for I met him myself.

content: 2. (=眼前に)before one's eyes

content.content: 彼の将来の大成を目のあたり見るようだ
I see his future greatness before my eyes.
彼の話しを聞いているとその場が目のあたり見えるようだ
When I listen to him I see the actual scene before my eyes.

content:
まばたき〔瞬き〕
〈名〉Blinking; winking:(一回なら)a wink:(=する) to blink; to wink

content.content: 瞬きする間に
in a twinkling―in the twinkling of an eye
この手術は瞬きする間にすんでしまう
The operation is over in a twinkling―It is the work of a moment.
瞬きもせずに眺めている
He gazes without winking―without blinking.
星が瞬きするように光る
The stars twinkle.
灯火が瞬きする
A light flickers.
灯火が風に瞬きする
A light flickers in the wind.

content:
まばゆい〔目映い〕
〈形〉Dazzling (light); glaring (light); blinding (flash, etc.):(動詞に用いれば)to dazzle; to glare

content.content: 明かりがまばゆい
The light is dazzling―The light dazzles.
まばゆい光り
a dazzling light―a glaring light―a blinding glare
鉱山を出ると日光がまばゆい
The daylight dazzles―The daylight glares―after the darkness of the mine.
まばゆい電光が閃いた
There was a blinding flash (of lightning).
山上の雪原はまばゆい
The snowfield is dazzling white.
まばゆいほど美しい女だ
She is a woman of dazzling beauty.

content:
まばら〔疎〕
〈形〉Sparse (population); thin (hair); scattered (cottages); straggling (houses); loose (texture, etc.)

content.content: 人家がまばらにある
There are some straggling houses―some scattered cottages.
原野にはまばらに人がいる
The plain is sparsely populated.
聴衆はまばらだった
The meeting was thinly attended.
背中にはまばらに毛が生えている
The back is thinly covered with hair.
織目がまばらだ
It is a loose texture.

content:
まひ〔麻痺〕
〈名〉Paralysis; palsy:(一時のは)numbness:(薬を用いてのは)anaesthesia:(精神のは)stupor; stupefaction:(=する) to become paralyzed; to become palsied:(一時なら)to be benumbed; to go numb:(薬に用いてなら)to be anaesthetized:(精神なら)to be stupefied:(=せしむ) to paralyze; to palsy:(一時なら)to benumb; to numb:(薬を用いてなら)to anaesthetize:(精神なら)to stupefy:(=せる) paralyzed; palsied; benumbed; numb; stupefied; dead (to something)

content.content: 半身麻痺している
One half of the body is paralyzed.
寒くて手足が麻痺している
My hands and feet are benumbed with cold―numb with cold.
彼は良心が麻痺している
His conscience is benumbed.
廉恥心が麻痺している
He is dead to shame―lost to virtue.
洪水で交通が麻痺する
A flood paralyzes the traffic.
薬を用いて局部を麻痺させる
to anaesthetize locally
局部麻痺
local anaesthesia
麻痺薬
an anaesthetic
心臓麻痺
paralysis of the heart―heart failure
小児麻痺病
infantile paralysis

まびさし〔目庇〕
〈名〉The peak (of a cap); the visor (of a cap or a helmet); a shade (to tie over the eye)

まひる〔真昼〕
〈名〉High noon; broad daylight

content:
まびれる〔塗れる〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: まみれる〔塗れる〕

content:
まぶ〔間夫〕
〈名〉A paramour:(娼妓などの間夫は)a fancy-man

content.content: 女が間夫をこしらえる
A woman deceives her husband.
間夫は退{ひ}け過ぎ
The fancy-man comes in after the night's business is done―Business first, pleasure afterward.

content:
まぶかに〔目深に〕
〈副〉Over one's eyes

content.content: 帽子を目深にかぶる
to pull one's hat over one's eyes
議員の中には帽子を目深にかぶっていた者もあった
Some of the members sat with their hats pulled over their eyes.

content:
まぶしい
〈形〉→『

content.content: まばゆい〔目映い〕

content:
まふたつに〔真二つに〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: まっぷたつに〔真二つに〕

content:
まぶれる〔塗れる〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: まみれる〔塗れる〕

content:
まほ〔真帆〕
〈名〉A sail before the wind

content.content: 真帆を揚げた船
The ship is sailing before the wind.

content:
まほう〔魔法〕
〈名〉Magic; sorcery; witchcraft; the black art; the occult art

content.content: 魔法を使う
to deal in magic―deal with the devil―deal with the Evil One―practise sorcery―conjure
人に魔法をかける
to cast a spell over one―lay one under a spell
魔法を解く
to break the spell
魔法で病を治す
to cure a disease by magic―conjure away an illness
これは魔法に近い、まるで魔法のようだ
It borders on magic.
病人が治ったのはまるで魔法のようだ
He has recovered as if by magic.

まほうつかい〔魔法使い〕
〈名〉A magician; a sorcerer; a wizard:(女は)a witch

content:
まぼろし〔幻〕
〈名〉A phantom; an apparition; a vision

content.content: 幻を追う
to pursue phantoms
名利に奔走するのは幻を追うのである
To toil for wealth or fame is to pursue phantoms.
彼は幻の如くに出没する
He appears and disappears like an apparition.
栄枯は夢か幻か
Is Fortune's smile a dream or a vision?
君はのぼせているからそんな幻が見えるのだ
That is the vision of a heated imagination.
人生は幻の如し
Life is transient.
幻の世
transient life

content:
まま
〈接続詞〉As

content.content: お仕立物は出来仕候まま明日お届け可申候
As the work is ready, I shall send it home tomorrow.
舎弟事只今帰宅致候まま今晩伺はせ可申候
As my brother is just home, he shall call on you in the evening.

content:
まま〔間々〕
〈副〉Often; frequently

content.content: そんな事は間々有る
Such things will often happen―That is often the case―That is of frequent occurrence.
それは間々ある間違いだ
The mistake is of frequent occurrence―It is a mistake of frequent occurrence.
彼が遅刻することは間々ある
It frequently happens that he is late―He is often late.

まま〔飯〕
〈名〉(A child's name for) boiled rice; (or) a meal

content:
まま〔儘〕
〈副〉
1. (=そのまま)as one is; as it is

content.content: そのままで結構です
I like it as it is―I don't wish it otherwise.
そのままにしておけ
Leave it as it is―Leave it as you found it―(は物、事件なら)―Let the matter rest there―Let the matter drop.
あの事はあのままになっている
The matter remains as it was―The matter rests there.
あの事はあのままにしておいた
I have left the matter as it was.
この事はこのままにしておかれぬ
We can not leave the matter as it is―We can not let the matter rest here―The matter must not rest here―We can not allow things to go on in this way―Things must not go on in this way.
この顔をこのままに画け
Paint me as I am!
このままここに居てよろしいか
May I stay where I am?
そのままそこに居れ
Stay where you are!
家はそのままで一万円に売れる
The house will sell for 100,000 yen as it stands.
家は元のままになっている
The house is still standing.
家を元のままにしておいた
We have left the house standing.
家は倒れたままになっている
The house remains as it fell.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: どうぞそのまま(立つに及ばぬ)
Please keep seated!―Please keep your seat!―(送り出そうとする人を止めてなら)―Not a step!―Not a step farther!
そのまま立っておれ
Keep standing!
資本を手に付けずにそのままにしておけ
Keep the capital intact―Leave the capital intact.
窓を(締めずに)そのまま明けておけ
Leave the window open―Keep the window open.
窓を明けたままで寝る
I sleep with my window open.
ランプを消さずにそのままつけておけ
Leave the lamp burning―Keep the lamp burning.
ランプをつけたままで寝た
I slept with the lamp burning.
外套を(脱ぐことはない)そのまま着ておれ
Keep your overcoat on!
靴を(脱ぐに及ばぬ)そのままはいておれ
Keep your shoes on!
靴をはいたままでお上がり
You may enter with your shoes on―in your shoes.
土足のままで入る
to enter a house with one's foot-gear on―with one's shoes on―in one's shoes
着のみ着のままで
in one's clothes―in the clothes one stands up in―with only the clothes on one's back
その夜は着のみ着のままで寝た
That night I slept in my clothes.
急に思い立って着のみ着のままで立った
I suddenly thought of going, and started in the clothes I stood up in.
彼は焼け出されて着のみ着のままで逃げた
He was burnt out, and escaped with only the clothes on his back.
ふだんのままで来た
I came in my everyday clothes.
彼は寝衣{ねまき}のままで出て来た
He appeared in his night-shirt―in his night-clothes.
兵は武装のまま一夜を明かした
The men slept on their rifles.
ありのまま
the simple truth―the plain truth―the downright truth―the unvarnished truth
ありのままの話
a plain statement―a straightforward story―an unvarnished tale
ありのままに言う
to speak the plain truth
事実をありのままに述べて後は各自の判断に任せる
I will speak the facts as they are, and leave you to judge for yourselves.
見たままを話そう
I will tell you exactly what I saw.
見たまま
an eye-witness's account
聞いたままを話そう
I will tell you exactly what I heard―tell the story as I heard it.
聞いたまま
a word-for-word report―a verbatim report
彼は親父そっくりそのままだ
He is the very image of his father―the very picture of his father―the very moral of his father―his father all over―a chip of the old block.
目鼻立ちはお母さんそっくりそのままだ
His features are his mother's to a hair―to a tittle.
彼の人真似は本人そっくりそのままだ
He mimics people to a hair.
似たとはおろか、そっくりそのまま
Like is no name for it; he is her very image.
この肖像は本人そっくりそのままだ
The portrait is the man to the life―drawn to the life.
彼の文章は先生そっくりそのままだ
His style is an exact copy of his teacher's.
本は原稿のままです
The book is in manuscript.
これが原文のままです
This is the text itself.
下手な翻訳をするよりは原文のままで味わう
Rather than murder it in the translation, we shall appreciate it in the original.
現状のままにしておいた方がよい
It is better to leave the matter in status quo.

content: 2. (=心のままに)as one pleases; as one thinks fit

content.content: 去るも留るもお心のままになさい
You may go or stay as you please―at your pleasure.
君のよいと思うままにし給え
You may do as you think fit―You may act at your discretion.
御意のままにご処分下さい
Deal with me as you think fit!
意のままにする、欲するままにする
to do as one pleases―do as one likes―have one's way
彼にしたいままにさしておけ
Let him do as he pleases!―Let him have his own way!
浮世がままになるならば世に学校の種を絶やさん
If I had my way, there should be no school in the world.
浮世がままならぬ
“Life is full of vexations.”
浮世がままにならぬので腹が立つ
I am vexed with the world.
ままにならぬは浮世の習い
“If wishes were horses, beggars would ride”―“The course of true love never did run smooth.”
言いたいままに言う
to say what one pleases―say what one likes―give rein to one's tongue―give a loose to one's tongue
言いたいままに言わしておけ
Let them say what they like!―Let people talk!
心にあるままを意ってご覧
Say whatever is uppermost in your mind!
足の行くままに行く
to go as fancy leads
己が意のままに人を引き廻す
to lead people by the nose

content: 3. (=人にせられるままになる)to suffer oneself to be (ill-treated, etc.)

content.content: 導かるるままに行った
I suffered myself to be led.
勧めらるるままに承知した
I suffered myself to be persuaded.
彼は縛らるるままに縛られておった(神妙に縄にかかった)
He suffered himself to be bound.
僕は命ぜらるるままにしたのみだ
I only did his bidding.
命ぜらるるままに入った
I entered as I was bidden―at his bidding.
命ぜらるるままに飲んだ
I drank at his bidding.

content: 〈前置詞相当〉According to; in accordance with

content.content: 命令のままに物品を処分した
The goods were disposed of according to orders.
貴命のままに上京仕る可く候
I shall come to town in accordance with your wishes.

content: 〈接続詞〉

content.content: (何々すると)そのまま(何々する)
as soon as―no sooner... than―scarcely... when...
枕をつけるとそのまま眠る
I fall asleep as soon as I lie down―I no sooner lie down than I fall asleep―I scarcely lie down when I fall asleep.
来るとそのままつまみ食い
She no sooner comes in than she begins eating with her fingers.

content:
ままこ〔継子〕
〈名〉A stepchild:(男なら)a stepson:(女なら)a stepdaughter

content.content: 継子扱いにする
to neglect one―leave one to take care of oneself
我々は継子扱いされている
We are left to take care of ourselves.
継子根性を出すのが悪い
You ought not to show the stepchild.

content:
ままごと〔飯事〕
〈名〉Playing at housekeeping; playing house:(=する) to play at housekeeping

content.content: 若夫婦はままごとをやっているようなものだ
The young couple play at housekeeping.
元はままごとをして遊んだ幼な馴染みだ
They are child-lovers, who played at housekeeping once.

content:
ままはは〔継母〕
〈名〉A stepmother

content.content: 彼は幼い時に母に死に別かれて継母の手にかかった
He lost his mother in his infancy, and was handed over to the tender mercies of a stepmother.

content:
ままよ〔儘よ〕
〈間投詞〉Never mind!; I don't care

content.content: ええままよ、なるようになる
Never mind! things will take their course.
ええままよ、毒を食うなら皿までだ
Never mind! in for a penny, in for a pound.
酒が一升
What wine costs I care not―
千両しよと儘よ
A thousand ryo, by Jove!
主の寝酒を
Your nightly sleeping draught
切らしゃせぬ
I'll never run out of.

content: 〈接続詞〉No matter (if, who, what, when, where, etc.)

content.content: 一度や二度は失敗しようとままよ、今にきっと成功してみせる
No matter if I fail once or twice, I shall be sure to succeed in time.
誰が来ようとままよ、何も悪いことをしているんじゃなし
No matter who may come―Let any one come,―we are not doing wrong.

content: 〈命令法〉Let (him do so)

content.content: 誰が来ようとままよ
Let any one come!
どうなろうとままよ
Let anything happen!
人が来ようとままよ
Let them come!

まみ〔真猯〕
〈名〉A kind of badger

content:
まみえる〔見える〕
〈他動〉
1. (=拝謁する)to have an audience of (a king); to have an interview with (a superior)
2. (=仕える)to serve (a master); to marry (a husband)

content.content: 貞女両夫に見えず
A faithful wife does not marry a second husband.

content:
まみれる〔塗れる〕
〈自動〉To be smeared with (blood); to be covered with (mud or sand)

content.content: 血にまみれた死骸
a gory corpse
血にまみれて倒れていた
He lay a gory corpse.
泥にまみれた靴
muddy boots
土俵の砂にまみれる
to lick the dust
一敗地にまみれる
to suffer a crushing defeat―be humbled in the dust

content:
まむき〔真向き〕
〈副詞、前置詞相当〉Over against; right opposite

content.content: 二人は真向きに座っている
They sit right opposite each other.
真向きの顔
a full face

content:

content:
4. 
〈その他〉

content:

〈副〉Soon; presently; before long

content.content: 間も無く機会があった
Soon an opportunity presented itself―It was not long before an opportunity occurred―An opportunity was not long in presenting itself.
間も無く来るだろう
He will be here presently―It will not be long before he comes.
間も無く全快しましょう
I shall be well before long―It will not be long before I am well.

content: 〈接続詞〉Soon after; not long after

The cat is an uncanny animal.
女は魔物だ
Woman is a charmer.

content:

国の守りを固める

content: 2. (=護符)a charm; an amulet; a talisman

content.content: 肌の守り
an amulet worn next the skin

a charm against bullets

a charm against temptations

content:
まもる〔守る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=守護する)to protect (one from harm); to defend (one against attack); to guard (the entrance); to watch over (one's rights); to look after (one's interests); to hold (a position); to keep (the door); to tend (the shop)

content.content: 国を守るは国民の義務
It is the duty of the citizen to defend the country.
敵を防いで国を守る
to defend the country against the enemy
神々は御国を守らせ給う
The gods watch over the land.
城を守る
to defend the castle (against the attacks of the enemy)
要害を守る、持場を守る
to hold a position―hold a post
皆倒れて一人になるまで持場を守れ
Hold the post to the last man!
守るにやすく攻むるに難き要害なり
It is a position which one man can hold against a hundred.
人を守る
to protect a man (from harm)
天、汝の身を守らんことを祈る
May Heaven protect you!
身を守る
to protect oneself from harm―defend oneself against attack
権利を守る
to protect one's rights―watch over one's rights―look after one's rights
各自己が利益を守るべし
Let each man protect his own interests!―watch over his own interests!―look after his own interests!
門を守る
to keep the door―guard the entrance
店を守る
to tend the shop―(は英、米は)―mind the store

content: 2. (=遵奉する)to observe (the rule); to obey (the law); to keep (a secret); to adhere to (one's principles); to keep to (a custom); to stick to (one thing); to attend to (one's duties, etc.)

content.content: 法律を守る
to obey the laws―observe the laws―keep the laws
規則を守る
to observe the rules―keep the regulations
命令を守る
to obey orders
命を守れ
Obey orders!―Mind the word!
ご命令を堅く守ります
I will obey your orders to the letter―Your word shall be law to me.
秘密を守る
to keep a secret―(自分の秘密なら)―keep one's own counsel
沈黙を守る
to observe silence―keep silence―hold one's tongue―hold one's peace
主義を守る
to adhere to one's principles―stick to one's colours
中立を守る
to observe neutrality
中庸を守る
to observe moderation
教えを守る
to observe one's teachings―live up to one's faith
田舎では古風を守っている
Country people keep to old customs.
各自本業を守るべし
Let each man keep to his own business―“Let the cobbler stick to his last.”
一人の夫を守る、一人の妻を守る(浮気をせぬ)
to stick to one husband―cleave to one wife
安息日を守る
to observe the Sabbath―keep the Sabbath
怠らず職務を守れ
Attend to your duties!
任を守る
to be true to one's trust
分際(分限)を守れ
You should keep your place―keep your distance―know your station.
時間を守る
to be punctual
彼は厳重に時間を守る
He is punctual to the minute.
期日を守る
to keep one's day

content: 3. (=履行する)to fulfil (one's promise); to keep (one's word); to keep to (one's agreement); to hold to (one's agreement); to stand to (one's engagement); to abide by (one's agreement); to adhere to, act up to (one's resolution)

content.content: 約束を守る
to fulfil one's promise―keep one's promise―keep one's word―abide by one's promise
あれは約束を堅く守る人だ
He is faithful to his promise―true to his word―as good as his word―a man of his word.
誓いを守る
to keep a vow
信義を守る
to keep faith with one
契約を守ってくれなくては困る
You must keep to your agreement―hold to your agreement―stand to your engagement―abide by your agreement―I will hold you to your agreement.
(どこまでも)決心を守る
I will adhere to my resolution―act up to my resolution.

〈名〉The eyebrow

content.content: 花の顔月の眉
a blooming face and crescent brows
眉をしかめる
to knit one's brow―bend one's brow―contract one's brow―frown
眉を開く
to feel relieved―show signs of relief
(驚いて)眉を上げる
to raise one's eyebrows
眉を引く
to paint the eyebrows
眉に唾をつける
to look sharp about one―have all one's wits about one
あの男と取引する時は眉に唾をつけてかからないとだまされる
You must have all your wits about you in dealing with that man.
あの人の話は眉に唾をつけて聞かなければならぬ(眉唾もの)
His story must be taken with a grain of salt―taken with some grains of allowance.
彼は泰然として眉も動かさない
He is calm, and will not turn a hair.

thick eyebrows―bushy eyebrows

A silkworm spins a cocoon.
繭から糸を取る
to reel silk off cocoons

〈名〉The eyebrow

content.content: 眉毛を落とす
to shave off one's eyebrows
人の眉毛を読む
to read one's mind
眉毛を読まれる
to have one's mind read

content:
まよい〔迷い〕
〈名〉
1. (=当惑)perplexity
2. (=迷想)delusion; illusion; fancy

content.content: そりゃ気の迷いだ
It is only a fancy of yours.
気の迷いかも知れんが今度の医者にかかって好いような気がする
It may be fancy, but I feel the better for my new doctor's treatment.
迷いを解く
to undeceive a man
迷いがさめる
to be disillusioned―awake from illusion―come to one's senses
(まだ目がさめぬなら)俺が迷いをさましてやる
I will bring him to his senses.
青年の迷いをさます
to disillusion the young from their day-dreams

content:
3. (=迷信)superstition
4. (=惑溺)infatuation (with a woman)

まよう〔迷う〕
〈自動〉
1. (路に迷う)to stray; to go astray; to lose one's way:(迷子になる) to lose oneself; to get lost

content.content: 私は路に迷いました
I have lost my way―lost myself.
恋の闇路に迷う
to lose oneself in the maze of love
五里霧中に迷う
to lose one's bearings
彼は五里霧中に迷っている
He is bewildered―in a fog―in a cloud―in a maze―all abroad―utterly at fault―wholly at sea.
路頭に迷う
to be turned adrift―turned into the streets―reduced to beggary
失業者は路頭に迷っている
The unemployed are reduced to beggary.
地位は(受け手が無いため)宙に迷った
The position has gone a-begging.
迷った盃
a cup which has gone a-begging
迷える羊
a stray sheep―a lost lamb

content: 2. (=正道を踏み迷う)to go astray; to stray from the path of virtue; to wander from the path of right; to err from the path of duty; to drift into error

content.content: 人はあの年になると迷わぬ
At his age, a man will not go astray.
青年は迷いやすい
Youth is apt to drift into error.
女が迷うと操を破る
A girl will stray from the path of virtue.
男が迷うと人たるの道を忘れる
A man will err from the path of duty.
若い者が迷うと堕落する
A young man will fall into error―drift into error.

content: 3. (=当惑する)to be perplexed; to be puzzled; to be at a loss (how to act); to be in doubt (which to take); to be in two minds, be of two minds (about doing anything)

content.content: 処置に迷った
I am at a loss how to act.
どちらにしようかと迷っている
I am in doubt which to take.
やってみようか止そうかと気が迷っている
I am in two minds―of two minds―about trying.
局に当たる者は迷う
“Men are blind in their own cause”―“No man is wise in his own affairs.”

content: 4. (=躊躇逡巡する)to waver; to vacillate, fluctuate, oscillate, balance (between two courses); to be irresolute; to be undecided

content.content: 選択に迷う
I waver in my choice.
いずれの方針を取って好いかと迷う
to vacillate between two courses―fluctuate between two courses―oscillate between two courses―balance between two courses
英文学と造船学のいずれにしようかと迷った
I vacillated between English literature and naval architecture.
とやかくと迷った末英文学と決めた
After a great deal of vacillation, I decided on English literature.
この問題には久しく迷いました
I remained long irresolute―undecided―on this question.

content: 5. (=迷想する)to be deluded; to labour under a delusion; to deceive oneself; to be deceived

content.content: 彼は自分の才能に迷っていたから迷いを解いてやった
He was deceived about his own abilities, so I undeceived him.
君は息子が偉いと思って迷っている
You deceive yourself―labour under a delusion―about your son's greatness.
僕は地位が安全なつもりで迷っていた
I deceived myself about the security of my position.

content: 6. (=惑溺する)to be infatuated with (a woman); to be taken with (a woman); to be gone on (a woman)

content.content: 彼はあの女に迷っているから人が何を言っても耳にも入れぬ
He will give no heed to warning or advice, for he is infatuated with the girl―taken with the girl―gone on the girl.
女の色香に迷っている
He is smitten with her charms.

content: 7. (=誘惑される)to be tempted (to do wrong); to be seduced (into doing wrong)

content.content: 彼は金に迷って曲ったことをするような人でない
He is not the man to be tempted by money to do wrong.
慾に迷うと人はどんなことでもする
A man will be seduced by love of gold into doing anything.
目前の利に迷う
to be tempted by the prospect of immediate gain

content: 8. (=迷信する)to be superstitious; to be bigoted

content.content: 彼はキリスト教に迷っている
He is a bigoted Christian.

content: 9. (=成仏しかねる)to walk the earth

content.content: 幽霊がこの世に迷っている
A ghost walks the earth.
迷うな、成仏せよ
May thy soul rest in peace!
浮かびかねて迷える魂
a restless soul―a disconsolately wandering spirit

content:
まよけ〔魔除け〕
〈名〉A charm against evil influence; a protection from harm; a talisman; an amulet

content.content: このお守りを持っていると魔除けになる
The amulet will protect you from harm.
魔除けの守り
a talisman against evil influence―a charm against temptations

content:
まよなか〔真夜中〕
〈名〉The middle of the night; the dead of night

content.content: 真夜中に目をさました

content:
まよわす〔迷わす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=当惑させる)to puzzle; to perplex

content.content: これは人を迷わす問題だ(難問)
This is a puzzling question―a perplexing problem.

content: 2. (=瞞す、誤らせる)to delude; to mislead; to misguide

content.content: 愚民を迷わす

ある作者のように青年を迷わすのは罪悪である
It is a sin, like some writers, to mislead young minds.
未熟な批評は世を迷わすのみである
Immature criticism tends only to mislead the public.

content: 3. (=邪道に導く、誘惑する)to lead (one) astray; to lead (one) into error; to tempt (one to do wrong); to seduce (one into doing wrong); to debauch (one's mind)

content.content: 彼は金に迷わされて曲ったことをするような人でない
He is not the man to be tempted by money to do wrong.
慾に迷わされると人はどんなことでもする
A man will be seduced by love of gold into doing anything.
未熟の批評は作者の心を迷わすのみである
Immature criticism serves only to debauch the mind of the writer.

content: 4. (=女が男を惑溺せしむ)to infatuate (a man)

content.content: 来てはちらちら迷わせる
She comes fluttering to steal away my heart.

A twenty-mile Marathon.

content.content: 鞠を投げる

content:
まりょく〔魔力〕

content.content: あの女の目には魔力がある
There is a charm―a glamour―a fascination―in her eyes.
魔力ある女だ
She is a charmer―an enchantress.
あの女がニッコリ笑うと魔力がある
She smiles a charming smile―an enchanting smile―a bewitching smile―a captivating smile―a fascinating smile.

She captivates men―fascinates men―casts a glamour over men.

〈名〉

content:

content.content: 丸木橋

content:
まるく〔円く〕
〈副〉
1. (=円形に)in a circle

content.content: 円くなって坐る
