A husband is a husband if he be a log.
丸太小屋
a log-cabin

content:
まるだし〔丸出し〕
〈形〉Wholly exposed; undisguised; broad

content.content: 隠し処を丸出しにして寝ておった
He lay with his nakedness wholly exposed.
女は勝負ごとをすると慾を丸出しにする
When a woman engages in a game, she can not disguise her avarice.
彼は田舎弁丸出しだ
He speaks a broad provincial dialect.

content:
まるっきり〔丸っきり〕
〈副〉
1. →『

content.content: まるで〔丸で〕

content:
』
2. (=絶対的に)absolutely (none)

content.content: そんな物はまるっきり無い
There are absolutely none.
これとあれとはまるっきり関係が無い
This has absolutely nothing to do with that.
彼はまるっきり世間を見ておらぬ
He has seen absolutely nothing of life.
まるっきり嘘でもない
It is not altogether false.

content:
まるつぶれ〔丸潰れ〕
〈名〉An utter failure; a dead failure; a collapse

content.content: 事業が丸潰れになった
The enterprise has ended in a dead failure―collapsed―The enterprise is a dead failure―a collapse.

content:
まるで〔丸で〕
〈副〉Quite; just; completely; perfectly; entirely; totally; utterly; wholly; clean; for all the world (like); (not) at all:(形容詞に用いれば)perfect (fright); complete (failure); utter (stranger); downright (swindle); sheer (waste of money); pure (fabrication); mere (child)

content.content: 英語を教えるとなるとまるで別だ
When you come to teach English, that's quite another thing―quite another pair of shoes.
あの人のやり方はまるで女だ
He is quite a woman in his ways.
君の言うことはまるで間違っている
You are entirely wrong―totally wrong―as wrong as wrong can be.
あの人の顔はまるで猿だ
His face is just like a monkey's―His face is for all the world, like a monkey's.
僕はその事件をまるで知らない
I am completely in the dark―utterly in the dark―wholly in the dark―about the affair.
その家はまるで影も形もない
The house is clean gone.
彼は英語をまるで知らないのだ
He does not know English at all―He does not know a word of English.
あの女はまるでお化けだ
She is a perfect fright.
彼は教師としてはまるで駄目だ
As a teacher, he is a complete failure―an utter failure―a dead failure.
そりゃまるで詐欺だ
It is a downright swindle.
まるで銭を溝へ捨てるようなものだ
It is a sheer waste of money.
日本人はロシア人と並ぶとまるで子どもだ
The Japanese is a mere boy by the side of the Russian giant.
そりゃまるで作り事だ
It is a pure fabrication―a lie out of the whole cloth.
あの人の英語を聞くとまるで西洋人だ
To hear him speak English, one would take him for a foreigner.

まるてんじょう〔円天井〕
〈名〉A dome; a cupola

content:
まるどり〔丸取り〕
〈名〉Monopoly:(=する) to monopolize; to take all to oneself

content.content: 主人が利益を丸取りする
The master takes all the profits to himself―monopolizes the profits.

content:
まるのみ〔丸呑み〕
〈名〉
1. Swallowing whole

content.content: 蛇が蛙を丸呑みにする
A snake swallows a frog whole.

content: 2. (=理解せず暗記すること)cramming

content.content: 試験準備に一学科を丸呑みにする
to cram a subject for an examination

まるばしら〔丸柱〕
〈名〉A column

content:
まるはだか〔丸裸〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: まっぱだか〔丸裸〕

content.content: まるぽちゃ〔丸ぽちゃ〕

まるぽちゃ〔丸ぽちゃ〕
〈形〉Buxom (girl)

まるまけ〔丸負け〕
〈名〉A complete defeat

content:
まるまげ〔丸髷〕
〈名〉A married woman's coiffure

content.content: 丸髷に結う
to assume a married woman's garb

まるまど〔円窓〕
〈名〉A round window

content:
まるまる〔○○〕
〈名〉Blank(---)

content.content: ○○会社は破産に瀕している
The―company is on the brink of bankruptcy.

content:
まるまる〔丸々〕
〈形〉Round; plump

content.content: 丸々太った娘
a plump girl
あの娘は丸々太っている
She is as plump as a partridge.
この子は丸々太っている
The child as plump as a dumpling.
丸々太った顔をしている
He has a chubby face.

content: 〈副〉(=まるで、まるっきり)→『

content.content: まるで〔丸で〕
まるっきり〔丸っきり〕

content:
まるめこむ〔丸め込む〕
〈他動〉To coax; to cajole; to wheedle; to get round (one); to turn or twist (a person) round one's little finger

content.content: 女が男を丸め込んでいる
She turns him round her little finger―She twists him round her little finger―She has got round him.
彼女は彼を丸め込んで何でも好きな事をさせる
She coaxes him―cajoles him―wheedles him―into doing anything she likes.
丸め込んで大金をせしめた
She coaxed him out of a large sum―cajoled him out of a large sum―cajoled a large sum out of him―wheedled a large sum out of him wheedled him out of a large sum.

content:
まるめる〔丸める〕
〈他動〉
1. To round; to make (anything) round; to make (anything) into a ball

content.content: 書類を丸めて紙屑籠へほうり込んだ
I crumpled the papers into a ball, and threw them into the waste-paper basket.
団子を丸める
to make dumplings
丸薬を丸める
to make pills
雪を丸める
to make snow into balls―make snow-balls
頭を丸める
to take the tonsure

content: 2. (=丸め込む、籠絡する)→『

content.content: まるめこむ〔丸め込む〕
ろうらく〔籠絡〕

まるもうけ〔丸儲け〕
〈名〉A clear gain

content:
まるやき〔丸焼き〕
〈名〉Roasting whole

content.content: 牛を丸焼きにする
to roast an ox whole

content:
まるやけ〔丸焼け〕
〈名〉Total destruction by fire

content.content: 建物は丸焼けになった
The building was totally destroyed by fire―(煉瓦造りなら)―completely gutted.
丸焼けは半焼けより始末が好い
Total destruction is better than partial destruction.
全市丸焼けになった
The fire made a clean sweep of the city―It was a holocaust of the whole city.

まるやね〔円屋根〕
〈名〉A dome; a cupola

content:
まれ〔稀〕
〈形〉Rare; uncommon; unusual; scarce; few; rarely to be met with; few and far between; not every:(副詞に用いれば) rarely; seldom; scarcely ever; hardly ever; not every day:(=には) on rare occasions

content.content: そういう人は稀だ
Such men are rare―uncommon―scarce―There are few such men.
百まで生きる人は稀だ
Few people live to be a hundred―People rarely live to be a hundred.
人生七十古来稀
“Threescore and ten is the age of man,” and few have attained it.
あんな学者は実に稀だ
Such scholars are very rare―rarely to be met with.
あんな学者は稀にはある
Such scholars are to found on rare occasions.
これは稀な出来事だ
This is a rare occurrence―an uncommon occurrence―an unusual occurrence.
彼は稀に見る立派な人格の人だ
He is a man of rare character.
彼がでかけることは稀だ
He rarely goes out―He seldom goes out―He scarcely ever goes out.
彼は本を開くことはたとえあっても稀だ
He rarely, if ever, opens a book―seldom, if ever, opens a book.
あんな学者はたとえあっても稀だ
There are few, if any, such scholars.
真の詩人は稀だ
True poets are rare―Every man is not a poet―Not every man is a poet.
似合った夫婦は稀だ
Well-matched couples are rare―“Every couple is not a pair”
こんな機会は稀だ
Such opportunities do not occur every day.
そんな果報は極めて稀だ
Such angel-visits are few and far between.
あれは稀な天才だ
He is a rare genius―a phenomenal genius.
この動物は人跡稀なる深山に棲む
The animal is found in mountain recesses far from the haunts of men.

content:
まれー〔馬来<マレー>〕
〈固名〉Malay

content.content: マレー人
a Malay
マレー人種
the Malayan race
マレー語
Malay―Malayan.
マレー半島
the Malay Peninsula
マレー群島
the Malay Archipelago

content:
まれー〔馬来<マレー>〕
〈固名〉Malay

content.content: マレー人
a Malay
マレー人種
the Malayan race
マレー語
Malay―Malayan.
マレー半島
the Malay Peninsula
マレー群島
the Malay Archipelago

まろびね〔転寝〕
〈名〉A nap:(=する) to take a nap

content:
まわし〔廻し〕
〈名〉
1. (=相撲の廻し)an apron (worn by a wrestler on the ring)

content.content: 化粧まわし
an ornamental apron

content: 2. (=女郎の廻し)(a prostitute's) extra-guest

content.content: 女郎がまわしを取る
A prostitute has more than one guests.
まわし部屋
a room for an extra-guest

content: 3. (=用意)preparation

content.content: 出発のまわしをせよ
Prepare for departure!

まわしがっぱ〔廻し合羽〕
〈名〉A mantle; an inverness

まわしぎり〔廻し錐〕
〈名〉An auger; a centre-bit

まわしもの〔廻し者〕
〈名〉A secret agent; an emissary; a spy

content:
まわす〔廻す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=回転する)to turn; to spin

content.content: 車を回す
to turn a wheel
ハンドルを回す
to turn the handle
コマを回す
to spin a top
輪を回す
to trundle a hoop

content: 2. (=順廻しにする)to pass (round); to send round; to hand round; to hand on; to pass on

content.content: 盃をまわせ
Pass the cup!―(飲みまわしなら)―Hand round the cup!―Pass round the cup!
徳利をまわせ
Pass the bottle!
帽子をまわして人のために寄付金を募る
to pass round the hat for some one
回状をまわす
to send round a circular
標本をまわして見せる
to hand round a specimen for inspection
菓子を皆にまわせ
Hand round the cakes!―Let the cakes be handed round!
読んだら順にまわせ
Read it, and pass it on―hand it on.
品物を順にまわして見て下さい
Please hand on the article.
その品を順にまわして見た
We passed the article from hand to hand―The article was passed from hand to hand.
次へまわせ
Pass it on to the next!

content: 3. (=転送する)to forward (something to some one); to send round (something to some one); to bring round, take round (something to some place)

content.content: 出先へまわす
to forward anything to one's place of sojourn
手紙が来たら出先へまわして貰ひたい
I wish to have all letters forwarded to me.
宛名人左記へ転居致候に付同方へお廻し被下度候
As the addressee has removed to the following address, please forward the letter to the same.
書類は係りへまわして下さい
Please send round the papers to the man in charge.
船を品川へまわす
to bring round the ship to Shinagawa
お靴は玄関へまわしました
I have taken your shoes to the door.
その人を幹事の方へまわしてやった
I have referred the man to my manager.
犯人を軍法会議へまわす
to commit a culprit for trial by the court-martial

content: 4. (=転任さす)to transfer (a person to another post)

content.content: 今年学務課の方へまわされました
I have been transferred to the Educational Section.

content: 5. (=編入する)to assign (a conscript to the infantry or cavalry)

content.content: 彼は徴兵に取られて騎兵の方へまわされた
He was taken up for military service, and assigned to the cavalry.
金をまわす
to lend money at interest―invest money in something
その金をもっと有利な事業にまわしたがよい
You had better invest the money in some more profitable enterprise―invest the money more profitably.
木の根をまわす
to dig round the roots of a tree (to fit it for removal)
目をまわす
(卒倒するの意味なら)to faint―swoon―be stunned―(びっくりするの意味なら)―be bewildered―be dumfounded―be flabbergasted
彼は頭を打たれて目をまわした
A blow on the head stunned him.
田舎者は初めて東京へ出ると目をまわす
A countryman is bewildered on his first visit to Tokyo.
目をまわすような混雑だ
There is a bewildering confusion.
その値段を聞いてたいがいの人は目をまわす
Most people are dumfounded―flabbergasted―at the price.
手をまわす
to send out emissaries―use spies―resort to espionage
手をまわして探ってみるとそうのようだ
We have spied out that such in the case.
気をまわす
to suspect―be suspicious
あなたは悪い方へばかり気をまわすからいけない
You attach a double meaning to innocent remarks―You have a dirty mind―an impure mind―sinful thoughts.

content:
まわた〔真綿〕
〈名〉Floss-silk

content.content: 真綿に針を包む
to conceal sharp claws in a velvet paw―gild a pill
真綿で頸を締める
to use the velvet paw
真綿で頸の強意見
velvet-pawed admonition
真綿で頸の強意見をされた
He talked to me like a Dutch uncle.

content:
まわり〔廻り〕
〈名〉
1. (=周囲)circumference:(前置詞に訳せば) around (a place); about (a person)

content.content: 湖水のまわりが十マイルある
The lake is ten miles in circumference―The lake is ten miles round.
家のまわりを巡査が護衛している
Policemen stand on guard around the house.
外人のまわりに人が寄ってたかった
People crowded about the stranger.
まわりに目を配る、まわりの様子を見る
to look about one

content: 2. (=居廻り、環境)one's surroundings; the environs:(前置詞に訳せば) around (a place); about (a place)

content.content: 身の廻り
one's surroundings
彼は身のまわりを綺麗にしておくことが好きだ
He likes to keep himself neat.
東京のまわり
the environs of Tokyo
東京のまわりは言葉が悪い
People speak a bad dialect in the country about Tokyo.
名古屋のまわりは土地が豊饒だ
The country about Nagoya is very fertile.
家のまわりに樹木があるか
Are there any trees around the house?

content: 3. (=一周)a round; a turn; a tour

content.content: 公園をひと回りまわって来よう
Let us take a turn in the park.
世界をひと回りする
to make a tour round the world
あの島を一回りした
I have made a tour of the island.
お天道様まわり
to go round with the sun―go round through the buttonhole
泥棒まわり
to go round against the sun

content: 4. (=廻転)revolution; rotation

content.content: 地球は二十四時間で一回りする
The earth rotates on its axis―turns on its axis―once in twenty-four hours.
地球は一年で太陽のまわりを一回りする
The earth revolves round the sun―goes round the sun―moves round the sun―once a year.

content: 5. (=循環)circulation

content.content: 血のまわり
the circulation of blood
金のまわり
one's pecuniary position
彼は金まわりが好いと見える
He seems to be well off for money―flush of money.
僕は金まわりが悪くて困る
I am badly off for money―scant of money.

content: 6. (=巡回)one's rounds

content.content: 医者が病家まわりをする
A doctor goes his rounds―makes his rounds―makes a round of visits to his patients.
医者は病家を一回りしてから寄ると言った
The doctor said he would look in after making his rounds.
年首まわりをする
to make a round of New Year's calls

content: 7. (=巡業)a tour

content.content: 鶴治一座は田舎まわりをしている
Tsuruji and his company are making a provincial tour―on a provincial tour.
田舎廻り連
a strolling company

content: 8. (=廻り路)a round about way; a circuitous route; a circuit; a compass; a d?tour

content.content: まわり路をする
to make a circuit―make a d?tour―fetch a compass―go out of one's way
帰りに寄り給え、大してまわりにもならないから
Won't you look in on your way home? It won't be going much out of your way.
たいへんまわりになる
I shall go very much out of my way―I should go a long way about―It is a long way about.
電車は九段まわりだ
The car goes by way of Kudan.

content: 9. (=大きさ)a size

content.content: こちらがひとまわり大きい
This is a size larger.

content:
まわりあわせ〔廻り合せ〕
〈名〉Fortune; luck

content.content: 運の回り合わせが好い
One is fortunate―lucky―in luck―at the top of Fortune's wheel.
回り合わせが悪い
One is unfortunate―unlucky―out of luck―at the bottom of Fortune's wheel.
回り合わせが好いと何事もとんとん拍子に行くものだ
When one is in luck, he will get on swimmingly in anything.
回り合わせが悪いと何事もうまくいかないものだ
When one is out of luck, nothing will go well with one.

content:
まわりくどい〔廻りくどい〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: まわりどおい〔廻り遠い〕

まわりどうろう〔廻り灯籠〕
〈名〉A revolving lantern

content:
まわりどおい〔廻り遠い〕
〈形〉Roundabout (way); circuitous (way); circumlocutory (speech); periphrastic (expression); rambling (talk); indirect (means, etc.)

content.content: まわり遠いことを言う
to talk in a roundabout way―beat about the bush
まわり遠いことを言わずに早く言い給え
Tell me without circumlocution―Come to the point!
まわり遠い話は止してすぐに話そう
I will come straight to the point―go straight to the point.
あの先生の説明はまわり遠い
His explanations are not to the point.
あの人のまわり遠い話はまっぴらだ
I bless myself from his rambling talk.
君のやり方はまわり遠い
You go about it in a roundabout way.

まわりばしご〔廻り梯子〕
〈名〉A winding staircase; spiral stairs

content:
まわりばんに〔廻り番に〕
〈副〉By turns; in turn

content.content: まわり番に夜番をする
They keep watch―(二人でなら)―by turns―(大勢でなら)―in turn.
兄弟がまわり番に親の看護をした
The brothers sat up with their father by turns―The brothers took turns in sitting up with their father.

まわりぶたい〔廻り舞台〕
〈名〉A revolving stage

content:
まわりみち〔廻り路〕
〈名〉A circuitous route; a circuit; a compass; a d?tour

content.content: まわり路をする
to make a circuit―make a d?tour―fetch a compass―go out of one's way
帰りに寄り給え、大したまわり路にもならないから
Won't you look in on your way home? It won't be going much out of your way.
たいへんなまわり路だ
I shall go very much out of my way.
そこをまた通らないようにまわり路をして帰った
I returned by a circuitous route to avoid the place.

content:
まわりもち〔廻り持ち〕
〈名〉Doing anything by turns

content.content: 炊事はまわり持ちだ
We do the cooking by turns.
天下はまわり持ち
The world may be yours today and mine tomorrow―The world belongs to no one.
浮世はまわり持ち
The world is a wheel.

content:
まわる〔廻る〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=一周する)to revolve; to go round

content.content: 地球が太陽の周りをまわる
The earth revolves round the sun―moves round the sun―goes round the sun.
池の周りをまわろうじゃないか
Let us walk round the pond.
ご馳走は一回りまわるだけある
There is enough good cheer to go round.

content: 2. (=回転する)to rotate; to turn; to spin; to circle; to wheel

content.content: 地球が回る
The earth rotates on its axis―turns on its axis.
車が(ぐるぐる)回る
A wheel turns―A wheels turns round―A wheel turns round and round.
舞台が回る
The stage revolves―The stage turns.
コマが回る
A top spins.
雁がまわって下りる
Wild-geese circle round the spot where they are going to alight.
横隊がまわる
A line wheels.
船が鼻をまわる
A ship doubles a cape.
風が西へまわった
The wind has veered to the west.
火が裏へまわった
The fire has spread to the rear.
まわれ右
Right about turn!―Right about face!
まわれ右をする
to turn about―face about
右へまわれ、左へまわれ
Right wheel!―Left wheel!

content: 3. (=廻遊する)to make a round; to make a tour; to take a turn

content.content: 公園を一回りまわって来よう
Let us take a turn in the park.
世界を一回りまわる
to make a tour round the world
あの島を一回りまわってみた
I have made a tour of the island.
教育視察のため学校をまわってみた
I made a round of the schools by way of educational inspection.

content: 4. (=循環する)to circulate

content.content: 血がまわる
Blood circulates.
毒がまわる
Poison takes effect.
酒がまわる
Wine takes effect.
皆だいぶ酒がまわっている
They are quite drunk.
盃がまわる
The cup circles―passes from hand to hand.
この骨董はずいぶん諸方をまわったものらしい
The curio seems to have passed through many hands.
回状がまわって来た
A circular has come round.
お鉢がまわって来た
My turn has come.
お爺さんだいぶ焼きがまわって来た
Age is telling on the old man.
大男総身に智慧がまわりかね
“Big man, big fool.”

content: 5. (=巡回する)to go one's rounds; to make one's rounds

content.content: 医者が病家をまわる
A doctor goes his rounds―makes his rounds―makes a round of visits to his patients.
郵便脚夫が配達にまわる
A postman goes his rounds―makes his rounds.
巡査が持場をまわる
A policeman paces on his beat.
巡査がまわっている
The policeman is on his beat.
衛兵が市街をまわる
A guard patrols the town.

content: 6. (=巡業する)to make a tour

content.content: 鶴治一座は田舎をまわっている
Tsuruji and his company are touring the provinces―making a provincial tour―on a provincial tour.

content: 7. (=迂回する)to make a circuit; to make a d?tour; to fetch a compass; to go out of one's way

content.content: だいぶまわった
We have gone very much out of our way.
勝手の方へおまわり
Come round to the kitchen.
急がばまわれ
“Make haste slowly”―“More haste, less speed.”

content: 8. (=寄り路する)to go round

content.content: 上野をまわって行こう
Let us go round by Ueno.
上野をまわって帰ろう
Let us go home by way of Ueno.
銀行へまわって行かにゃならぬ
I must go round to the bank.
もう一軒まわる家がある
I have another house to call at.
彼の帰りの遅いのはどこかへまわったのだろう
He is a long time gone. He must have gone round somewhere.

content: 9. (=過ぎる)to pass

content.content: もう十二時をまわっている
It is past twelve.
よく手がまわる
They attend to everything―They leave nothing undone.
あの旅館ではよく手がまわる
They are attentive to the wants of the guests at that hotel.
忙がしくて手がまわらぬ
We are hampered by business―hampered by press of business.
そこまでは手がまわらない
We can not attend to such details.
もう手がまわっている
We are watched.
後へ手がまわる
to be arrested―be apprehended
目がまわる
My eyes dance―My head swing―I feel dizzy―I feel giddy.
目のまわるような高い処
a dizzy height―a giddy height
見ると目がまわるようだ
The sight is bewildering.
目のまわるほど忙しい
We are in a whirl of business.
あれは気はしのまわる男だ
He has a quick perception―He is quick of perception―He is quick in anticipating your wishes.
筆がまわる
He writes well.
子どもは舌がまわらぬ
A child lisps.
酒に酔うと舌がまわらぬ
A drunken man has a thick utterance.
彼は舌がまわらないから酔っている
He is drunk, for he has a thick voice.
彼は借金で首がまわらぬ
He is deeply in debt―over head and ears in debt.
蔭にまわる
to get behind the scenes
蔭にまわってみると意外なことがあるものだ
I find strange facts behind the scenes.
彼は猫をかぶっているが蔭へまわっていたずらする
He looks demure, but he will do mischief on the sly.
面前で人を賞める者に限って蔭に廻って悪口を言う
A man who praises you to your face is sure to speak ill of you behind your back.
まわりまわった従兄弟
cousins of the fortieth remove

content:
まわれみぎ〔廻れ右〕
〈号令〉Right about turn! Right about face!

content.content: 廻れ右をする
to turn about―face about

content:
まん〔万〕
〈名〉Ten thousand; a myriad

content.content: そんなことのあるのは万に一のことだ
It is one chance in ten thousand―one to ten thousand―that such a thing should happen.
万が一にも失敗したならどうしようか
It, by any chance, I should fail, what should I do?
死者は万をもって算す
The slain were counted by tens of thousands―(より)―They were slain by tens of thousands.
一をもって万を知る
to infer the whole from one
何万という星
myriads of stars
何万という収入
an income of five figures
何十万
hundreds of thousands
何十万という収入
an income of six figures

content:
まん〔満〕
〈名〉(弓の満)a full-drawn bow:(盃の満)a full cup

content.content: 満を引く
(弓なら)to draw a bow to the full―(盃なら)―drain a full cup at a draught
満を持して放たず
He keeps his bow bent to the full―(より)―He watches for his chance.

content: 〈副〉Full; whole

content.content: 満二十歳
He is full twenty years old.
この四月で満二十歳になる
I shall be twenty next April.
国を出てから満四年になる
It is full four years―four whole years―four years to a day―since I left home.

content:
まんいち〔万一〕
〈名〉One chance in ten thousand:(の事)a chance occurrence; a possible event; a possibility; a contingency; an emergency; an eventuality; an accident; chance:(=の) possible; contingent; accidental

content.content: 万一に備える
to provide against emergencies―provide against accidents
万一の必要に備えるために貯金をすべしだ
You ought to provide against possible needs―lay by against a rainy day.
万一を僥倖せん
I will take my chance―take the chances―take the risks―risk it―chance it.
万一を頼むよりほかは無い
We must trust to chance―trust to luck―trust to the chapter of accidents.
万一を頼んでやってみよう
I will try on the off chance of success.
彼女は万一を期して待っている
She keeps waiting, hoping against hope.
(彼は死にはせぬかと)万一を気づかっている
I fear for his life―tremble for his life.
(医者が病人の家族に向かって)万一の覚悟をして下さい
You must be prepared for the worst.
君の身に万一のことがあったら家族はどうするか
If anything should happen to you, what would become of your family?
万一の場合には命を棄てる覚悟だ
I am ready to lay down my life in case of emergency.

content: 〈副〉(Should) by any chance; (may) possibly, be some possibility:(=にも) (can not) possibly by any possibility

content.content: 万一失敗したらどうしようか
If,by any chance, I should fail, what should I do?
万一この山がはずれたらもとの商売に帰るまでのことさ
If,by any chance, my speculation should fail, I can but fall back on my old business.
これが万一にも本当かしら
Can it possibly be true?―Can it by any possibility be true?
万一そうでないとも限らぬ
It may possibly be so―It may by some possibility be so.
戦争のことだから日本が万一負けぬとも限らぬ
As it is the fortune of war, Japan may possibly―by some possibility―be defeated.
そんなことは万一にも(間違っても)あるはずが無い
Such a thing can not possibly happen―can not by any possibility happen.

content: 〈接続詞〉In case; for fear; lest

content.content: 万一失敗した時の予備があるか
Have you anything to fall back upon in case you fail?―in case of failure?
万一雨が降ると悪いから傘をお持ちなさい
Take an umbrella with you lest it should rain―for fear it may rain―for fear of its raining.

content:
まんいん〔満員〕
〈名〉(芝居などから)a full house:(電車なら)a full car

content.content: 芝居は満員です
The house is full―The house is filled to capacity―crowded to capacity.
芝居は毎日満員です
The play draws a full house every day―The theatre is playing to a full house every day.
電車が満員だ
The car is full.
電車は満員の札を掲げている
She has a full-car notice up.
病院は満員で入院を断っている
The hospital is full, and declines to take in new patients.
学校は目下満員です
The classes are full―There is no vacancy in any of the classes.
満員
(掲示)Full―(芝居なら)―House full―(電車なら)―Car full

content:
まんえん〔蔓延〕
〈名〉Spread; propagation:(=する) to spread; to be propagated

content.content: 疫病蔓延の兆あり
There are signs of the epidemic spreading.
トラホームは全国に蔓延している
Trachoma has spread all over the country.
疫病の蔓延を予防する
to prevent the spread of an epidemic
危険思想は学生間に蔓延せんとしている
Dangerous thoughts are being propagated among the students.
危険思想の蔓延を防ぐ
to prevent the propagation of dangerous thoughts
庭に雑草が蔓延している
The garden is overgrown with weeds―overrun with weeds.

content:
まんが〔馬鍬〕
〈名〉A harrow

content.content: 馬鍬で土地をならす
to harrow land

まんが〔漫画〕
〈名〉A cartoon; a caricature

content.content: 戦争漫画
war cartoons
漫画家
a cartoonist―a caricaturist

content:
まんかい〔満開〕
〈形〉(木の花なら)in full blossom:(草花なら)in full bloom; in full flower:(単花なら)full blown

content.content: 桜は満開だ
The cherry-trees are in full blossom―The cherry blossoms are at their best.
菊はまだ満開とはいかぬ
The chrysanthemums are not quite in full bloom―in full flower.
満開の薔薇
a full-blown rose
満開の牡丹
a full-blown peony

content:
まんがく〔満額〕
〈名〉The full amount

content.content: 満額に達した
The full amount has been reached.

content:
まんかん〔満干〕
〈名〉The ebb and flow, the flux and reflux (of the tide)

content.content: 潮の満干は月の引力による
The tides are caused by the gravitation of the moon.

content:
まんがん〔満俺<マンガン>〕
〈名〉Manganese

content.content: マンガン酸
manganic acid.

content:
まんがん〔満俺<マンガン>〕
〈名〉Manganese

content.content: マンガン酸
manganic acid.

content:
まんがん〔満願〕
〈名〉Expiration of a term of worship at a shrine

content.content: 満願の当日彼が参詣の帰途に仇敵にめぐり逢った
On the very day when his term of worship expired, he came across his father's enemy on his way home from the shrine.

content:
まんかんしょく〔満艦飾〕
〈名〉Dressing ship

content.content: 満艦飾を施す
to dress ship
艦隊は満艦飾を施した
The squadron dressed ship.
港内の船舶は満艦飾をしている
The ships in port are dressed with flags―decked with bunting.

content:
まんき〔満期〕
〈名〉
1. (=任期の満期)expiry; expiration of one's term

content.content: 任期が満期になる
One's term of office expires―One's term runs out.
重役が満期になった
The director's term of office has expired.
大統領は今年満期になる
His presidency expires this year.
満期になって再選された
At the expiration of his term of office, he was re-elected.

content: 2. (=兵役、懲役の満期)completion of one's term

content.content: 兵役の満期
the completion of military service
懲兵が満期になる
A conscript completes his term of service―serves out his time―serves his full term.
満期服役する
to serve out one's time―serve one's full time
彼は満期服役して来たのだ
He has served his time.
君はいつ満期になるか
When do you serve out your time?
もう満期になった
I have served out my time―served my full time―served my time.
満期兵
a time-expired soldier
懲役が満期になる
A convict serves his sentence―serves time.
懲役が満期放免になる
A convict is discharged after serving time.

content: 3. (=手形の満期)maturity

content.content: 手形が満期になる
A bill matures―becomes due―falls due.
債券は五年で満期になる
The bonds matures in five years.
手形はいつ満期になるか
When does the bill fall due?
三カ月満期の手形だ
The note is due in three months.
この手形は満期が過ぎている
The bill is overdue.
満期手形
a mature bill
満期日
the day of maturity

まんくう〔満腔〕

content.content: まんこう〔満腔〕

content:

〈名〉A full moon

content.content: 今夜は満月だ

A full moon is shining.

content.content: 時事漫言
rambling comments on the times

content:
まんこう〔満腔〕
〈名〉All one's heart; one's whole heart:(=の) whole-hearted; full-hearted; hearty; full; deep

content.content: 満腔の賀辞を呈す
I offer hearty congratulations.
満腔の謝意を表した
I returned whole-hearted thanks―expressed my deep gratitude.
満腔の同情

彼は満腔の同情を寄せる
I fully sympathize with him.
かかる人がもしあるならば満腔の熱心をもって彼を歓迎せん

content.content: 万劫末代
for ever

content.content: 彼は満座の中で恥辱を受けた

彼は満座をどっと笑わせる

まんさい〔満載〕
〈名〉A full load:(=する) to be fully laden; to be loaded to her full capacity; to be loaded to capacity; to have a full load:(船なら)to carry a full cargo:(記事なら)to be full of news

content.content: 船は貨物を満載している
The ship is fully laden with merchandize―carrying a full cargo―carrying a capacity cargo―loaded to her full capacity―loaded to capacity.
船は乗客を満載している
The steamer is carrying her full complement of passengers―crowded with passengers―alive with passengers.
軍隊を満載した汽船
The steamer is carrying troops to her full capacity.
各新聞は事件を満載している
The papers are full of the news of the affair.

〈名〉A sort of mummer (who comes round at the New Year)

まんさく〔金縷梅〕
〈名〉A kind of witch-hazel

content:
まんさく〔満作〕
〈名〉A full crop; an abundant harvest

content.content: 米は満作だ
We have a full rice-crop―an abundant harvest of rice.

content:
まんざら
〈副〉(Not) altogether; (not) entirely; (not) wholly

content.content: (女を評して)まんざらでもないね
She is not altogether amiss.
支那料理もまんざらでもないね
Chinese cooking is not altogether bad.
まんざらばかでもない
He is not altogether a fool.
まんざら他人でもない
We are not entire strangers.
彼は貧乏の味をまんざら知らないわけでもない
He is no entire stranger to poverty.
彼はまんざらいやでもないらしい
He seems not wholly averse to it.
まんざら捨てた口でもない
The offer is not at all bad―not to be sneezed at.
惚れられてまんざら悪い気の人もあるまい
No man will feel altogether displeased at being loved.

content:
まんさん〔蹣跚〕
〈名〉Reeling; staggering

content.content: 酔歩蹣跚
One reels under the influence of wine.

content:
まんざん〔満山〕
〈名〉The whole hill

content.content: 満山燃ゆるが如き紅葉
The whole hills are ablaze with autumnal tints.

content:
まんじ〔卍〕
〈名〉A fylfot; gammadion; a swastika

content.content: 雪は卍巴と降りしきる
The snow falls thick and fast―dances and whirls.
敵味方卍巴と入り乱る
Friend and foe mingled pell-mell.

content:
まんしゅう〔満洲〕
〈名〉Manchuria:(=の) Manchurian

content.content: 満洲人
a Manchu
満洲鉄道
the Manchurian railway
南満洲鉄道会社
the South Manchurian Railway Company

まんじゅう〔饅頭〕
〈名〉A sort of bun stuffed with an

まんじゅうがさ〔饅頭笠〕
〈名〉A wicker hat

まんじゅうやま〔饅頭山〕
〈名〉A knoll; a mamelon

content:
まんじょう〔満場〕
〈名〉The whole house

content.content: 満場水を打ったよう
The house is hushed―A pin might be heard to drop.
満場鼎の沸くのが如き騒ぎ
The house was in an uproar.
満場の聴衆が拍手喝釆した
The entire audience applauded.

content:
まんじょういっち〔満場一致〕
〈名〉Unanimous consent; universal consent:(=の) unanimous

content.content: 満場一致にて
unanimously―with one consent―without a dissentient voice―nem. diss. (=nemine dissentiente)―nem. con. (=nemine contradicente)
議案は満場一致にて可決した
The bill was passed unanimously―passed by unanimous vote―passed with one consent.
満場一致にて否決した
The bill was rejected without a dissentient voice.
満場一致投票
a unanimous vote―a solid vote

content:
まんじり
〈副〉

content.content: 昨夜はまんじりともしなかった
I did not sleep a wink―I did not get a wink of sleep―last night.

content:
まんしん〔慢心〕
〈名〉Conceit; egotism:(=する) to be conceited; to be egotistic; to be puffed up

content.content: あの男が慢心している
He is conceited―self-conceited.
自分ばかり偉いつもりで慢心している
He is puffed up with a sense of his own importance.
少し学問をすると慢心する
A little learning puffs up.

content:
まんしん〔満身〕
〈名〉One's whole body

content.content: 満身の力をこめて
with all one's strength―with all one's might
満身の力をこめて働く
I work with all my might.
満身の力をこめて引張った
I tugged with all my strength.

まんずる〔慢ずる〕
〈自他動〉To be proud (of anything)

content:
まんせい〔万世〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ばんせい〔万世〕

content:
まんせい〔慢性〕
〈形〉Chronic

content.content: 慢性病
a chronic disease
彼は慢性胃病で苦しんでいる
He suffers from chronic dyspepsia.
急性病が慢性病になる
An acute disease passes into a chronic state.
慢性病患者
a chronic invalid
あの人の酒は慢性だ
He is a confirmed drinker―an inveterate drinker.

content:
まんぜん〔漫然〕
〈副〉
1. (=とりとめない)ramblingly; discursively; aimlessly:(=たる) rambling; discursive; aimless

content.content: 彼は漫然と書を読む
He is a discursive reader.
時には漫然と話すのも面白い
A rambling talk is good at times.
漫然とさまよう
to wander about aimlessly
漫然と旅行に出かけた
I started on a journey without any definite object.
漫然たる文体
a rambling style―a discursive style

content: 2. (=心に留めず)heedlessly; casually:(=たる) heedless; casual

content.content: 漫然と言う
to remark casually
漫然と言ったことがお気にさわった
A casual remark of mine offended him.

content:
まんぞく〔満足〕
〈名〉Satisfaction; contentment; gratification; pleasure:(=する) to be satisfied (with the result); to content oneself, be contented, be content (with one's lot); to be gratified (with a person or a thing―at a circumstance); to be pleased (with a person or thing―at a circumstance):(=させる) to satisfy; to give (one) satisfaction; to content; to gratify (one's desire); to please; to afford (one) pleasure

content.content: 彼はその条件で満足すると言った
He says he is satisfied with the terms―He has expressed himself satisfied with the terms.
その条件に満足を表した
He expressed his satisfaction with the terms.
僕はそんな答弁では満足せぬ
I am not satisfied with such an answer.
僕はいくら働いても主人が満足せぬ(主人を満足させることができぬ)
I work all I can, but I can not satisfy my master―give him satisfaction.
それで満足しろ
Let that satisfy you!―Let that content you!
皆が満足するように事件が解決した
That matter is settled to the satisfaction of everybody.
彼はさも満足そうにでき上がった作を眺めいた
He gazed at the finished work with evident satisfaction.
彼は今の地位に満足している
He is contented with his present position.
君はよくそればかりの給料で満足するね
How can you content yourself with such a small salary?
僕は間に合うだけあれば満足する
I am contented―content―if I can make both ends meet.
彼は満足しているから幸福だ
He is happy, because he is contented with his lot.
幸福は満足に在り
Happiness consists in contentment.
この結果なら僕も満足する
I am satisfied with the result―gratified at the result―pleased at the result.
僕もそれを聞いて満足した
I am gratified to hear it―pleased to hear it.
あっぱれな手際だ、余も満足に思うぞ
Your performance has my approbation.

content:
〈形〉
1. (=な)(=申し分無き) satisfactory:(=に) satisfactorily; properly

content.content: 満足な解決
a satisfactory solution
双方に満足な解決を得ました
We have arrived at a solution satisfactory to both parties.
満足な返答をした者は一人も無い
Not one of them could give a satisfactory answer.
兄弟中に満足な奴は一人も無い
Not one of the brothers is what he should be.
彼は満足に仕事ができない
He can not do his work properly.
手紙一本満足に書けない
He can not write a letter properly.

content: 2. (=無疵)whole

content.content: 火事で満足に残ったものが一つも無い
The fire has left nothing whole.
地震で満足に残った皿が一枚も無い
The earthquake has not left a plate whole.

content:
まんだい〔万代〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ばんだい〔万代〕

まんだらげ〔曼陀羅華〕
〈名〉The mandrake

content:
まんちゃく〔瞞着〕
〈名〉Imposture; dupery:(=する) to dupe; to impose upon (one)

content.content: 彼らは世間を瞞着する奴らだ
They impose upon the public―They are imposters.
君は彼に瞞着されたのだ
You have been imposed upon―You are his dupe.

content:
まんちょう〔満潮〕
〈名〉Flood-tide; high tide; high water

content.content: 今は満潮だ
It is high tide―The tide is at the full.
満潮には暗礁が見えぬ
The rocks are invisible at high tide―at high water.
満潮を利用して擱坐した船を曳き下ろした
The stranded vessel was towed off at high water.
満潮になると船が暗礁がら下りる
The high tide will float the ship off the rocks.
満潮標
the high-water mark

content:
まんてん〔満天〕
〈名〉The whole heavens; the whole sky

content.content: 満天にわかにかき曇る
The whole sky suddenly became with clouds.
満天の星
the starry heavens

content:
まんてん〔満点〕
〈名〉Full marks

content.content: 満点を取る
to obtain full marks
この手際なら満点だ

content:
まんてんか〔満天下〕
〈名〉The whole realm; the whole world

content.content: 雷名満天下に轟く
His fame rings throughout the whole world―(より第二構文の方が普通)―The whole world rings with his fame.
彼の偉業は満天下の耳目を聳動した
His achievements startled the whole world.

content.content: 彼は茶気満々だ
He is full of mischief―full of fun.
市場は活気満々だ
The market is full of life―very lively.
彼は勢力満々だ
He is full of energy―energetic.
覇気満々だ
He is full of ambition―very ambitious.
覇気満々たる太刀
a pretentious blade
彼は不平満々でいる
He is filled with discontent.
天地生気満々たり
The universe is instinct with life.―The universe is bursting into life.
盃に満々と酒を注ぐ
to fill a cup to the brim
盃に酒が満々と注いである
The cup is full to the brim.
満々たる酒盃

喜色満面室内に入る

世界漫遊者

content:
み〔実〕
〈名〉
1. (=果実)fruit

content.content: 木に実が生る、木は実を結ぶ
Trees bear fruit.
この木はもう実が生ります
The tree bears already.
この木はよく実が生る
The tree is a good bearer―a good fruiter.
実を見て木の善悪を知れ
A tree is known by its fruit.
稲に実が入る
The rice-plant fills.
話に実が入る
to warm to one's subject
花多ければ実少し
Good flowerers are poor fruiters―Elegance and utility do not go together.
花も実もある
to be both elegant and useful―both interesting and instructive
七重八重花は
Its seven or eightfold flower heaves
咲けども山吹の
The golden blossom coy;
実の一つだに
Yet what a pity that it gives
無きぞ悲しき
Of fruit no goodly joy!

content: 2. (=実質)substance; matter; solidity

content.content: 実のある食物、実の無い食物
substantial food―unsubstantial food
実のある講義、実の無い講義

実のある話し、実の無い話し
instructive talk―empty talk
実のある読物だ
It is substantial reading―solid reading.
彼の演説は実がある
His speeches are rich in matter.
実のある仕事をする
to do solid work

content:
み〔身〕
〈名〉
1. (=身体)the body; one's person

content.content: 身に滲みる

身二つ
parturition
身二つになる
to be delivered of a child［注意］熟語は14)を見よ。

content: 2. (=我が身)oneself

content.content: 苦しい時は身一つ
“Everybody for himself, and God for us all”―“Everybody for himself and devil take the hindmost.”
身自ら招いて人之に乗ず
to give a handle to one's enemies［注意］熟語は14)を見よ。

content: 3. (=身の上)(one's) life, state, condition, plight, predicament, lot, welfare, fortunes, circumstances

content.content: 彼は安楽な身だ
He is in easy circumstances―He lives at his ease.
寡婦は哀れな身だ
The window is in a sorry plight―in a sad predicament―in a bad way.
彼は職を辞して散閑の身だ
He has resigned his office, and is now a man of leisure.
あれは身寄り頼りも無いはかない身だ
He is a poor orphan without kith or kin.
今にも別るるはかない身
We are poor lovers that must part.
彼は日蔭の身だ
He is under a cloud―under an eclipse―in disgrace―A cloud hangs over his name.
俺は老い先の短い身だ
I have not long to live―I am not only for this world.
彼は人まじわりのできない身だ

囚われの身だ
He is a prisoner―a convict.
刑余の身だ
He is a returned convict―an ex-convict.
妻帯の身
(the holy estate of) matrimony
彼は妻帯の身だ
He is a married man.
妻帯の身になる
to change one's condition
独り身

彼(女)は一人身だ
He is a bachelor―She is a spinster.
自由の身だ
I am my own master―my own man.
自由の身になる
to get free―be set free―be set at liberty
僕は三時から自由の身だ
I am free―master of my own time―after three.
女は二十一歳になると自由の身だ
A woman is mistress of her own actions at twenty-one.［注意］熟語は14)を見よ。

content: 4. (=心)one's heart; one's mind; one's soul

content.content: 仕事に身を入れる
to put one's heart in one's work［注意］熟語は14)を見よ。

content.content: 身を捨てる

content: 7. (=人格)one's character

to be out of keeping with one's character［注意］熟語は14)を見よ。

袖の干ぬのは女の身

content: 9. (=力)one's power

content.content: 新身{あらみ}

content: 12. (=中身)contents

content:
13. (=汁の身)vegetables (put in Japanese bean-soup)
14. 
〈熟語〉
《a》(身が)

content.content: 身が立つ
to be saved from ruin
お蔭で身が立ちます
You have saved me from ruin.
それでは僕の身が立たぬ
Then I shall be ruined.
身が立つようにしてやる
I will save you from ruin.
身が立たぬようにしてやる
I will ruin him.
彼は身が持てない
He can not keep straight.
女に可愛がられる色男は身が持てない
It is hard for an Adonis to keep straight.
彼は仕事に身が入らぬ
He has no heart for his work.
身が縮まるほど寒い
It is cold enough to huddle one up.

content: 《b》(身も)

content.content: 身も世もあられぬ思い
overwhelming emotion―agonizing feeling
身も世もあられぬ思いをした
I was overwhelmed with emotion―in agony.
身も世もあられぬ悲み
overwhelming sorrow―agonizing grief

content: 《c》(身に)

content.content: 身に付ける
to keep anything on one's person―have anything about one's person
この守りを身に付けて離すな
Keep this amulet on your person!
悪銭身に付かず
“Ill-got, ill-spent”―“Ill-gotten wealth does not prosper.”
あぶく銭は身に付かぬ
Lightly come, lightly go.
身に覚え無し
I am innocent (of the crime).
大難が身に降りかかる
A danger impends over one―hangs over one's head.
人の身になり代る
to put oneself in the place of others
僕の身になって見給え
Put yourself in my place!
あの人の身になりたくない
I would not stand in his shoes for the world.
(人の難儀を)我が身に引き比べる
to enter into another's troubles
身に余る光栄です
The honour is more than I deserve―above my deserts.
身に故障絶えず
He is always in some trouble or other―always ill.
僕の身にとっては酒は薬だ
Wine is a medicine in my case―with me.
貧窮は武士の身にとっては恥でない
Poverty is no shame in the case of a samurai―with a samurai.
身に換えて御守護仕らん
I will protect you at the peril of my life.
身に添わぬ
to be out of keeping with one's character
そんな地位は身に添わぬ
The position is out of keeping with my character―too good for me.
魂も身に添わぬ
(嬉しくてなら)to be beside oneself with joy―in raptures―in ecstasies―(悲しくてなら)―beside oneself with grief
身に叶うことなら何でも致します
I will do anything in my power.
彼を救うことは身に叶わぬ
It is beyond my power to save him.
身に及ぶだけ尽します
I will do all I can―do the best in my power―do my best―do my utmost.
身になる
to nourish one―do one good
珍味は身にならぬ
Delicacies do not nourish.
気がねしながら食っては身にならぬ
Food taken under constraint does not fill.
あのような教えは身にならぬ
Such teaching do you no good.
身に浸みる
to pierce the body―penetrate the body
北風が身に浸みる
The north wind cuts the skin.
寒さが身に浸みる
The cold penetrates to the bone.
身に浸みる寒さ
biting cold
身に染みる
to sink deep into one's mind―come home to one's heart
彼の言葉が身に染みた
His words sank deep into my mind―came home to my heart.
彼の親切が身に染みた
His kindness sank into my inmost soul―touched my heart―touched me to the heart.
ご教訓は身に染みました
Your teachings have come home to my heart.
この経験が身に染みた
The experience has pierced me to the quick.
身に染みてありがたい
I am deeply thankful.
身に染み渡る鶴のひと声
Your gracious words thrill through me―send a thrill through my veins.
あの唄を聞くと身につまされる
The song appeals to my heart.

content: 《d》(身の)

content.content: 身の置き所が無い
I do not know what to do with myself.
腹も身の内
Be careful what you put in your belly.
身の始末もできぬ
He can not take care of his own welfare.
身の明りを立てる
to clear oneself―justify oneself―establish one's innocence―vindicate one's character
身の光栄と存じます
I appreciate the honour.
身の行末
one's future
身の行末が案じられる
I am concerned about my future.
身の行末はどうなることか
What will become of me?
身の詰まり
one's ruin
惚れられたのが身の詰まり
He was beloved to his ruin.
ちょいとなめたが身の詰まり
A taste of pleasure was my ruin.
金は身の仇
Money brings one evil.
芸は身の仇
Accomplishments prove one's ruin.
身の不幸をかこつ
to repine at one's misfortune―curse the day of one's birth
彼女に逢ったのが身の不幸
I met her in an evil hour.
身の宝は朽ちぬ
The treasures of the mind do not decay.
身の安全を図る
to provide for one's safety―look to one's own safety―save one's life→『みのうえ〔身の上〕』→『みのけ〔身の毛〕』→『みのふりかた〔身の振方〕』→『みのほど〔身の程〕』→『みのまわり〔身の廻り〕』

content: 《e》(身は)

content.content: 心二つに身は一つ
One can not be in two places at the same time.
(義は泰山よりも重く)身は鴻毛よりも軽し
I hold my life at nothing as compared with my cause.
身は任しても心は任せぬ
I am yours in body, but not in heart.

content: 《f》(身を)

content.content: 我が身をつねって人の痛さを知れ
Judge of other's feelings by your own.
夢でないかと身をつねってみる
I doubt the evidence of my senses―I can not realize my situation.
身をつねって思い出す
to refresh one's memory―jog one's memory―fillip one's memory
身を潜める、身を忍ばせる
to conceal oneself―hide (oneself)
一人の男が木の蔭に身を忍ばせておった
A man was concealed―hiding―behind some trees.
身をかわす、身を開く
to dodge
身を開いて打ち込む太刀を除けた
I dodged the falling blow.
身を投げる
to throw oneself into a river―drown oneself in a river―commit suicide
身を投ずる
(事業になら)to embark in an enterprise―launch forth on an enterprise―(投機になら)―venture on a speculation―(政界になら)―plunge into politics―launch into politics
身を切るような北風
a cutting north-wind
身を切るような寒さ
biting cold
身を切られるよりも辛かった
It was more than flesh and blood could bear.
そう言われるのは身を切られるようだった
His words cut me to the heart.
身を粉にして働く
to fag oneself to death―drudge oneself to death―slave oneself to death
身を落とす
to degrade oneself
身を屈する、身を屈して賤しいことをする
to stoop to meanness―descend to baseness
身を屈して人のご機嫌を取った
He stooped to flattery.
身を屈して乞食までもした
He stooped to beggary.
身を売る
to sell one's chastity―prostitute oneself
身を持て余している
I do not know what to do with myself.
我が身を省る
to reflect on oneself
身を委する
(英語研究になら)to devote oneself to the study of English―(教育事業になら)―commit oneself to the cause of education
君に仕えて身を致す
to devote oneself to one's lord
彼は身を厭わぬ
He spares no pains―He is unsparing of himself.
身を捨てる
to lay down one's life―sacrifice oneself
身を捨ててこそ浮かぶ瀬もあれ
“Risk all and gain all.”
身を軍籍に置く
to profess arms
川竹に身を沈める
to lead a life of shame―live in open sin
芸は身を助く
Art brings bread.
芸が身を助くる不幸せ
She is so unfortunate that her art must win her daily bread.
身で身を苦める
to torment oneself
身で身を食う
to ruin oneself―bring ruin on oneself
粋は身を食う
Fashion is ruin to some people.
人に身を任せる
to place oneself in another's power
女が男に身を任せる
A woman surrenders her chastity to a man―gives herself to a man.
身を寄せる
to go to some one for assistance―become a dependent on one
身を立てる
to advance in life―get on in life―establish oneself in life
身を固める
to settle down (to some business)
彼は女房を持って身を固めた
He got married and settled down―settled down to a married life.
卑賤より身を起こす
to rise from obscurity
一兵卒より身を起こして大将になった
He rose from the ranks to be a general.
身を誤る
to fall into error―go astray
女学生は監督が無いと往々身を誤る
School-girls, if left to themselves, will drift into error.
大才子は徳を磨かないと往々身を誤る
Great wits are often wrecked on the rock of immorality.
身を持ちくずす
to go to the bad
身を亡ぼす
to ruin oneself
身をやつす
to disguise oneself
彼は山伏に身をやつした
He disguised himself as a monk.
山伏に身をやつして逃げた
He fled under the guise of a monk.
仕事に身を入れる
to put one's heart into one's work
彼は仕事に身を入れない
He has no heart for his work.
彼は今度の計画にたいそう身を入れている
He goes, heart and soul, into the scheme.
学問に身を入れる
to devote oneself to one's studies
人の事に身を入れる
to interest oneself in others' affairs
身を入れて働く
They work with a will.
身を全うする
to save one's life―save one's bacon―save oneself
僅かに身をもって免れた
He escaped with bare life.
身を修める
to order one's life―lead a virtuous life―live a noble life―cultivate moral excellence―attain moral excellence
身を尽す
to do all one can―do the best in one's power―do one's best―do one's utmost
身を退く
to resign (one's post)
身を処す
to conduct oneself

content:
み〔味〕
〈接尾詞〉
1. (あじなら)flavour:(色なら)tint; tinge

content.content: 甘味
a sweet flavour
赤味
a reddish tint
青味
a bluish tint
赤味を帯びた、青味を帯びた
reddish―bluish
おかし味のある話
a story tinged with humour

content: 2. (=幾味の味、成分)an ingredient

content.content: 七味
seven ingredients

content:
み〔巳〕
〈名〉The serpent (one of the twelve zodiacal signs)

content.content: 巳の年
the year of the Serpent

content:
み〔箕〕
〈名〉A winnow; a fan

content.content: 箕をあおる
to winnow the chaff―fan away the chaff

content:
みあい〔見合い〕
〈名〉An interview of the parties to a marriage:(=する) to have an interview with (a prospective bride or bridegroom); to see each other with a view to marriage

content.content: 見合いもせずに貰ったのだ
He married her without ever having seen her.
一人娘が大勢と見合いをしてこれならばと婿に合格したのが即ち彼
The heiress saw many suitors, and it was he who was found eligible for the post of husband to her.

content:
みあきる〔見飽きる〕
〈他動〉To tire of looking at (anything)

content.content: 幾度見ても見飽きない景色だ
I never tire of looking at his view.
芝居は見飽きた
I have had enough of plays.
面白いものを見飽きるくらい見た
I have fed fat on wonders.

content:
みあげる〔見上げる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=上を見る)to look up (at anything)

content.content: 人の顔を見上げる
to look up in one's face
見上げるような大男だ
He is a giant―a colossus―a towering figure―a soaring figure.

content: 2. (=嘆賞する)to admire

content.content: 実に見上げた精神だ、あっぱれ見上げた精神だ
I admire your spirit―What a noble spirit!
実に見上げたものだ
Admirable man!―Wonderful man!

content:
みあたる〔見当る〕
〈自動〉To find; to come across (something)

content.content: 本物が見当たったら教えてくれ給え
If you come across a genuine article, please let me know.
一人ずつ顔を見たけれどもその人が見当たらなかった
I saw their faces, one by one, but could not find him.

content:
みあやまる〔見誤る〕
〈他動〉To mistake, misjudge, form a wrong estimate of (a person or thing)

content.content: 相手を見誤ったことが無い
I never mistook my man.

content:
みあらわす〔見露す〕
〈他動〉To detect (a crime); to expose (a villainy); to see through (a design)

content.content: 化物の正体を見あらわす
to unmask a ghost―expose an apparition
あの男の正体を見あらわしてやる
I will expose his true character.

content:
みあわす〔見合す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=互に見る)to look at each other

content.content: 驚いて顔を見合わした
We looked at each other in surprise.
二人は顔を見合わして目配せをした
They exchanged glances―exchanged a look of intelligence.
偶然互いに顔を見合わしてびっくりした
Our eyes met, and we started.
またもや見合わす顔と顔
Once more shall I see her face to face!

content: 2. (=見合わせる)→『

content.content: みあわせ〔見合せ〕

content:
みあわせ〔見合せ〕
〈名〉Postponement; deferment; abandonment:(=る) to postpone; to defer; to put off; to shelve (a bill); to put (a bill) on the shelf; to table (a bill); to lay (a bill) on the table; to pigeon-hole (a bill); to abandon, give up, lay aside, shunt (a project, etc.)

content.content: 雨が降ったら出発を見合わせる
If it rains, I shall put off my departure.
戦争のため事を見合わせた
We deferred matters―shelved the matter―owing to the war.
金が出ないから洋行を見合わせた
I have abandoned the idea of going abroad―given up the idea of going abroad―for want of funds.
計画を見合わせる
to abandon a project―give up a project―lay aside a project―shunt a project

content:
みいず〔御稜威〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: みいつ〔御稜威〕

content:
みいだす〔見出す〕
〈他動〉To find; to find out; to discover

content.content: この本に誤りを見出した
I have found out mistakes in this book.

content:
みいつ〔御稜威〕
〈名〉August virtues, glorious virtues (of the Emperor)

content.content: 日本の大将は勝利を天皇の御稜威に帰す
Japanese generals attribute their victories to the glorious virtues of their Emperor.

content:
みいら〔木乃伊<ミイラ>〕
〈名〉A mummy

content.content: ミイラにする
to mummify a body―embalm a corpse
ミイラ取りがミイラになる
to “go for wool and come back shorn”―“The biter is bit”

content:
みいら〔木乃伊<ミイラ>〕
〈名〉A mummy

content.content: ミイラにする
to mummify a body―embalm a corpse
ミイラ取りがミイラになる
to “go for wool and come back shorn”―“The biter is bit”

content:
みいり〔実入り〕
〈名〉
1. (=実入り工合)(good or bad) harvest, crop
2. (=収入、収益)an income; incomings; earnings; profits

content.content: この商売は実入りがある
The business pays.
泥水商売は実入りがあるから止められぬ
They can not quit a life of shame, for it pays well.
実入りのある商売
a profitable business―a lucrative business―a paying business

content:
みいる〔見入る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=見詰める)to gaze at (anything); to fix one's eyes on (anything)

content.content: 人の顔を見入る
to gaze in one's face

content: 2. (=魅する)to charm; to bewitch; to enchant; to captivate; to fascinate; to possess

content.content: 彼は女に見入られている
He is bewitched by the girl―fascinated by the girl―captivated by the girl.

content:
みうけ〔身受け〕
〈名〉Redemption; ransom:(=する) to redeem (a slave); to ransom (a prisoner, etc.)

content.content: 女郎を身受けする
to ransom a prostitute
身受金
a ransom

content:
みうける〔見受ける〕
〈他動〉
1. To see (a person)

content.content: あの人は時々電車で見受ける
I often see him the cars.
ちょいちょい見受ける
I see him every now and then.
もう夏帽子をかぶっている人を見受ける
I see people wearing straw-hats already.

content: 2. (=身受けたところどんな様子)to look; to appear

content.content: お見受け申したところではたいそうお丈夫なようです
You look very strong.
彼は困っているように見受けた
He appeared to be in straitened circumstances.
お見受け申したところではまだお若いようだ
You look quite young.
彼は見受けたところでは別に変わったところは無いようだ
There is nothing peculiar about his appearance.

content:
みうごき〔身動き〕
〈名〉Moving

content.content: 電車が込んでいて身動きもならなかった
The car was so crowded that I could not move in it.
(彼は驚いて)突立ったまま動きもしなかった
He stood transfixed to the ground―stood rooted to the spot.
あまりの怖さに身動きもならなかった
I was petrified with terror.
狭くて身動きもならない
There is no room to swing a cat.

content:
みうしなう〔見失う〕
〈他動〉To lose sight of (anything)

content.content: 見え隠れに後をつけたが角を曲る時にその姿を見失った
I followed him at a distance, but lost sight of him in turning a corner.

content:
みうち〔身内〕
〈名〉
1. (=親類)a relative; a relation; a connection; a kinsman

content.content: 身内の者
one's relatives―relations―connections
他人より身内
“Blood is thicker than water.”
身内の争い
a family dispute
身内びいき
nepotism

content: 2. (=博徒の子分)(a gambler's) follower

みうちびいき〔身内贔屓〕
〈名〉Nepotism

content:
みえ〔見え〕
〈名〉Appearance; show; display; parade; effect; ostentation

content.content: 僕は見えに英語を学ぶのではない
I do not learn English for show.
あの人の慈善は見えにするのだ
He practices charity for effect.
英国人は見えに(体裁に)教会へ行く
The English go to church for appearance' sake.
学問を見えにする(見せびらかす)
to make a display of one's learning―parade one's scholarship
見えを張る、見えを切る、見えを飾る
to show off―make a show―make a display―cut a dash―be ostentatious
あの人は見えを張ることが好きだ
(男なら)He is fond of show―fond of display―(女なら)―She is a dashing woman.
彼は見えにはいっこうかまわない
He is careless about appearance.

content:
みえがくれに〔見え隠れに〕
〈副〉Now in sight, now out of sight

content.content: 見え隠れに彼の跡をつけた
I followed him at a distance.

content:
みえすく〔見え透く〕
〈自動〉To be easily seen through; to be transparent

content.content: 心が見え透いている
I can see through his heart.
見え透いた口実だ
It is a transparent pretext―a thin pretext.
底が見え透いている
That's too thin.
心の底が見え透いている
His motive is apparent.

content:
みえなくなる〔見えなくなる〕
〈自動〉To go out of sight; to disappear from view; to vanish out of one's sight

content.content: 彼はたちまち沈んで見えなくなった
He soon sank out of sight.
霧が晴れるとその船が見えなくなった
When the fog cleared, the ship was out of sight.
(汽車が走る中に)山が見えなくなった
The mountain passed out of right―passed from my view.
その人の姿が遠くなって見えなくなった
His form disappeared into the distance―melted into the distance.
姿が暗闇に吸い込まれて見えなくなった
His form disappeared into the darkness.
日が暮れてあたりが見えなくなる
The night shuts out the view―Night closes upon the scene.
彼の姿が見えなくなるまで見送った
I watched him out of sight.

content:
みえばる〔見え張る〕
〈自動〉To show off; to make a show; to make a display; to cut a dash; to be ostentatious

content.content: 彼は見え張っているけれども内実は火の車だ
Though he makes a brave show, he is really in great straits.

content:
みえぼう〔見え坊〕
〈名〉One fond of show; one fond of display; an ostentatious person

content.content: 先生なかなか見え坊だ
He is very fond of display.

content:
みえる〔見える〕
〈自動〉
1. (=目が見える)can see

content.content: 僕が目が見える
I can see.
彼は目が見えぬ
He can not see―He is blind.
片目が見えぬ
He is blind of one eye.
右の目が見えぬ
He is blind in the right eye.
彼は目が見えなくなった
He has gone blind―lost his eyesight.
彼は年をとって目が見えなくなった
His eyesight fails him.
生まれたての小犬や小猫は目が見えぬ
A new-born puppy or kitten can not see.
梟は暗闇でも目が見える
An owl can see in the dark.
真暗で一寸先も見えぬ
It is too dark to see an inch before one.

content: 2. (=遠くの物が見える)(主観的に言えば)to see:(客観的に言えば)to be seen; to be visible; to be in sight

content.content: 富士山は西方に見える
We see Mt. Fuji to the west―Mt. Fuji is seen to the west.
遠方に灯火が見える
I see a light in the distance.
何が見えるか
What do you see?
船が見える
I see a ship―A ship is in sight.
(航海中見張番が言う)船が見えるよ
Sail, ho!
敵艦見ゆとの無線電信あり
It was wirelessed that the enemy was in sight.
(大洋の真中で)海と空のほかは何も見えぬ
Nothing is to be seen―visible―but sea and sky.
陸が見える
Land is in sight.
陸が見えてきた
Land comes in sight―heaves in sight.
陸の見える所へ来た(陸に接近した)
We have come in sight of land―We are in sight of land.
陸が見えない
Land is out of sight―invisible.→『みえなくなる〔見えなくなる〕』

content: 3. (=小さい物が見える)(主観的に言えば)to see:(客観的に言えば)to be visible

content.content: (小さい物が)はっきり見える
I can see it distinctly―It is distinctly visible.
肉眼に見える、肉眼に見えぬ
It is visible to the naked eye―invisible to the naked eye.
人の欠点は見えるものだ
One will see others' faults.

content: 4. (=初めて見える)to meet the eye; to greet the eye

content.content: 一足ごとに種々の物が見える
Various things meet the eye at every step.
船が日本に接近すると第一に見えるものは富士山である
As we near Japan, the first object that greets the eye is Mt. Fuji.
船が岬を廻ると港が見える
When you double the cape, the harbour bursts upon the view.

content: 5. (=かすかに見える)to show

content.content: 彼女の皮膚を通して血液が見える
The blood shows through her skin.
鳥が霞の中にぼんやり見える
The island shows dimly through the mist.
湖水が木の間からチラチラ見える
The lake shows fitfully through the trees.
青空が見えてきた
The blue sky is showing.

content: 6. (=どこから見える)to get a view of (anything); to command a view of (anything)

content.content: ここから舞台がよく見える
I can get a good view of the stage from here.
汽車がステーションを離れると海が見える
When we get clear of the station, you get a view of the sea.
二階から富士山がよく見える
The second story commands a good view of Mt. Fuji.
その家は木に隠れてここから見えぬ
The house is hidden from view by some trees.

content: 7. (=らしく見える)to look; to seem; to appear

content.content: 彼は年にしてふけて見える
He looks old for his age.
年にしては若く見える
He looks young for his age.
どういうわけで空が青く見えるか
How is it that the sky looks blue?
彼は正直らしく見える
He seems (to be) honest―(が実はの意味なら)―He appears (to be) honest.
夫婦仲が好いように見える
They seem to be happy together―(が実はの意味なら)―They appear to be happy together.
彼は若い時は放蕩をしたものと見える
It seems that he was wild in his youth―He seems to have been wild in his youth.
彼はなかなか学者であったと見える
It seems that he was a scholar―He seems to have been a scholar.
私はいくつと見えますか
How old do you take me for?
貴方は四十とは見えませんね
One would not take you for forty.
あの人は日本人とは見えない
One would not take him for a Japanese.

content:
8. 
〈打消〉(=見つからない)can not find; to miss:(客観的に言えば)to be missing

content.content: 僕の字書が見えない
I can not find my dictionary―My dictionary is missing.
朝起きてみると枕元の時計が見えない
When I awoke in the morning, I missed my watch―my watch was missing.
本が一冊見えない
I miss one volume―One volume is missing.
見えないのは何巻目か
Which is the missing volume?
見えない本を捜しておこう
I will look for the missing volume.
見えない物がある
Something is missing.
彼はどこを捜しても見えません
He is nowhere to be seen.

content: 9. (=鑑定する)to be a judge of (anything); to be a connoisseur of (anything)

content.content: 君は刀剣が見えるか
Are you a judge of swords?
あの人は書画が見える
He is a connoisseur of paintings―a good judge of paintings.
僕は書画などは見えない
I am no judge of paintings.
彼は人の長所が見える
He can see the good in others.

content: 10. (=来る)to come; to be here; to call; to turn up; to appear

content.content: 田中さんが見えた
Here is Mr. Tanaka.
彼はほど無くお見えになりましょう
He will be here presently.
お留守中高橋さんがお見えになりました
Mr. Takahashi called in your absence.
その人は来ると言って寄越したきりまだ見えない
The man wrote to say he was coming, but has not turned up yet.
追って見えるでしょう
He will appear―make his appearance―put in an appearance―in due time.
この頃佐藤がちっとも見えないがどうしたかしら
I have seen nothing of Sato lately. What can have become of him?

みお〔澪〕
〈名〉A water-way; a fairway

みおくり〔見送り〕
〈名〉Seeing one off; a send-off

content:
みおくりにん〔見送り人〕
〈名〉A sender-off

content.content: 見送り人がたくさんあった
These were many senders-off―Many people went to see him off.

content:
みおくる〔見送る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=送別する)to see (one) off; to send (one) off; to give (one) a send-off

content.content: 友人を見送りに停車場まで行って来た
I have been to the station to see a friend off.
出発の際はお見送り下され有難く御礼申上候
It was very kind of you to come and see me off at my departure.
彼を盛んに見送ろうではないか
Let us give him a rousing send-off!―give him a royal send-off!

content: 2. (=見送りする)to gaze after (one); to follow (one) with one's eyes

content.content: 彼が見えなくなるまで後姿を見送った
I gazed after him till he was out of sight―I watched him out of sight.
船が水平線以下に隠れるまで見送った
I followed the ship with my eyes till she disappeared below the horizon.

content: 3. (=送り届ける)to see (one) home

content.content: お宅までお見送りしましょう
I will see you home―see you to your door.
婦人を家まで見送って来た
I have seen her safe home―seen her to her door―left her at her door.
主人が玄関まで見送ってくれた
The host walked with me to the door.

content: 4. (=死ぬまで世話をする)to take care of (one) till one dies

content.content: 僕はもう両親を見送った
I have buried both my parents.

content:
みおさめ〔見納め〕
〈名〉The last sight (of a person or thing):(=する) to see the last of (a person or thing); to take a last look at (anything); to take a last view of (anything); to see (one) for the last time

content.content: これがこの世の見納めか
Do I now see the last of the world?―Do I now take a last look at the world?―Is this my farewell look at the world?
あれがあの人の見納めであった
That was the last I saw of him―That was my last sight of him―I saw him then for the last time.
これが故郷の見納めかと思うとなんとなく名残り惜しかった
As I took a last view of my beloved home, I could not but feel a pang of separation.

content:
みおとし〔見落し〕
〈名〉An oversight; an omission

content.content: 多少の見落しはしかたが無い
A few oversights are not to be helped.

content:
みおとす〔見落す〕
〈他動〉To overlook (a mistake); to pass over (a detail); to omit (a name); to miss seeing (a scene); to lose sight of (a fact); to leave (a fact) out of account; to let (anything) escape one's notice

content.content: こんなわかりきった誤りを見落すとはどうした間抜けだ
How stupid of you to overlook such an obvious mistake!
名前を見落しはしまいね
I hope you have not passed over―omitted―any of the names.
遅く行って二幕見落した
I was so late that I missed seeing the first two acts.
彼はまだほんの子どもだということを見落しては困る
You must not lose sight of the fact that he is a mere boy―You must not leave his youth out of account.
著者の名はうっかり見落した
The name of the author has escaped my notice.
彼は何事をも見落すということは無い
He never overlooks anything―Nothing ever escapes his notice.

content:
みおとりする〔見劣りする〕
〈自動〉To look to disadvantage

content.content: これを見ると他は見劣りする
This one makes the others look to disadvantage―This one outshines the others.
これはあれと比べると見劣りする
This compares unfavourably with that―This does not compare with that―This does not bear comparison with that.

content:
みおぼえ〔見覚え〕
〈名〉Recognition; remembrance; recollection:(=る) to recognize; to remember; to recollect; to know

content.content: あの人は見覚えがあるか
Do you recognize that man?―Do you remember that man?―Do you know that man?
君は通りで逢ったら見覚えが無いほど変った
I should not know you if I met you in the streets―You are changed beyond recognition.
その人を見たら見覚えがあるか
Shall you know him again?
あの顔は見覚えがある
I remember seeing that face―I remember that face.
あの顔は見覚えが無い
I have no recollection of having seen that face―I do not remember that face.
あれは見覚えのある顔だ、見覚えの無い顔だ
It is a familiar face―a strange face.
この筆蹟は見覚えがあるか
Do you know this handwriting?
この筆蹟は見覚えがある、見覚えが無い
This handwriting is familiar to me―strange to me.
生徒の顔を見覚えている
I know the students by sight.

content:
みおも〔身重〕
〈形〉Pregnant; gravid

content.content: 身重になる
to become pregnant―go with child
あの女は身重だ
She is pregnant―gravid―enceinte―with child―in the family way―in an interesting condition.
身重になって五カ月目だ
She is five months gone with child.

content:
みおろす〔見下ろす〕
〈他動〉To look down upon (one); to see (a place) below one's eyes; to overlook, look over, dominate over (the surrounding country); to take a bird's-eye view of (a place)

content.content: 人を眼下に見下ろす
to look down upon a man
日本では高貴な人を高い処から見下ろすのを不敬としている
It is considered disrespectful for a Japanese to look over a high personage.
飛行機に乗って全都を眼下に見下ろす
An aviator sees the whole city below his eyes.
我々は近隣を見下ろす高地を占めている
We hold an eminence which looks over the neighbourhood―dominates over the neighbourhood.
あの山の上からは全都を眼下に見下ろす
From the summit of that hill, you can take a bird's-eye view of the whole city―That hill commands a bird's-eye view of the whole city.

content:
みかい〔未開〕
〈形〉Uncivilized, barbarous, savage, rude (people); unreclaimed, uncleared, uncultivated, waste (land)

content.content: 未開の民
a savage people―a barbarous people

みかえし〔見返し〕
〈名〉The inside of the cover (of a book)

content:
みかえす〔見返す〕
〈自動〉
1. (=見返る)to look back
2. (=見直す)to change for the better; to rally; to improve
3. (=見捨てられた面当てに出世してみせる)to triumph over one's old enemy; to play the Johnson to one's Chesterfield

content.content: 人を恨むのは止して見返してやるが好い
Instead of being angry with him, you ought to seek for future triumph.

みかえりひん〔見帰り品〕
〈名〉Returned goods

みかえりひん〔見返り品〕
〈名〉Collateral security

みかえる〔見返る〕
〈自動〉To look back; to look over one's shoulder

content:
みがき〔磨き〕
〈名〉Polish; burnishment

content.content: 磨きをかける
to burnish gold―polish wood―give wood a polish

content:
みかぎる〔見限る〕
〈他動〉To give up, give over, throw over abandon, forsake, desert, turn one's back upon (an old friend, etc.)

content.content: 彼は困っている人を見限るような人ではない
He is not the man to turn his back upon a friend in trouble.
この頃はすっかりお見限りで
You are quite a stranger.

content:
みかく〔味覚〕
〈名〉(The sense of) taste; gustation

content.content: 味覚神経
the gustatory nerve

content:
みがく〔磨く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=光を出す)to polish (wood); to burnish (gold); to scour (metal); to sharpen (a sword); to brighten, rub up (silver-ware, etc.)

content.content: 玉を磨く
to cut a gem
玉の光を磨きだす
to fetch out the beauty of a gem
磨かぬ玉
an uncut gem
磨かぬ金剛石
a rough diamond―a diamond in the rough
玉磨かざれば光無し
An uncut gem does not sparkle―Without education, man is a savage.
他山の石もって玉を磨くべし
One should learn by other's examples.
瓦は磨いても玉にならぬ
One can not “make a silk purse out of a sow's ear.”
歯を磨く
to clean one's teeth―brush one's teeth
靴を磨く
to polish boots―clean boots―black boots
剣を磨く
to sharpen a sword
磨き上げる
to polish up―finish up
水道の水で磨き上げる
to give one a town polish
あの娘は磨くと好くなる
A town polish will improve the girl.
磨きたてる
to polish up one's appearance―polish oneself up
あのご面相ではいくら磨いても駄目だ
With that face of hers, no amount of polishing would do her good.

content: 2. (=錬磨する)to cultivate (knowledge); to improve (one's skill); to refine (one's mind)

content.content: 知識を磨く
to cultivate one's knowledge―improve one's mind
智慧を磨く
to sharpen one's wits
智徳を磨く
to cultivate wisdom and virtue―attain intellectual and moral excellence
智を磨き徳を積め
Seek truth and do good.
心を磨く
to refine one's mind
腕を磨く
to improve one's skill―improve one's ability
腕を磨いて千載一遇の機会を待て
Prepare yourself for a golden opportunity.
男を磨く
to build up a character

content:
みかけ〔見掛け〕
〈名〉Outward appearance; appearances; show; look:(人の見掛け)one's looks

content.content: 見かけは正直らしい
To all appearance, he is honest.
見かけはやさしそうだ
It is apparently easy.
彼女は見かけはおとなしい
She is outwardly modest.
見かけは当てにならぬ
Appearances are delusive―Appearances are deceptive.
人は見かけによらぬもの
Do not judge of a man by his looks―Do not judge by appearances.
あの女は見かけによらぬ悪党だ
She is more wicked than she looks―She is a wicked woman, though she does not look it.
あの人の慈善は見かけばかりだ
His charity is a mere show―He is charitable only in outward appearance.

content:
みかけだおし〔見掛け倒し〕
〈名〉Deceptive appearance; a mere show:(=の) showy but worthless; gimcrack; trumpery; flashy

content.content: 彼は強そうだが見かけ倒しだ
He looks strong, but it is a mere show―but his looks belie him.
店は綺麗に飾りたてているが見かけ倒しの品ばかりだ
The shops make a fine appearance, but they only sell gimcracks―trumperies―gewgaws.

content:
みかける〔見掛ける〕
〈他動〉To see, meet with, come across (a person or thing)

content.content: あの人は時々会で見かける
I often see him at the meeting.
そんな品はめったに見かけぬ
I seldom come across such articles―Such articles are rarely to be met with.

content:
みかさ〔水嵩〕
〈名〉The volume of water

content.content: 水嵩が増した
The river has risen.

content:
みかた〔見方〕
〈名〉The way of looking at anything; view; aspect

content.content: 君の見方が間違っている
That is a wrong way of looking at the matter―You take a wrong view of the matter.
僕の見方は違う
I do not view the matter in that light―I view the matter in a different light.
その見方は公平だ
That is a just view of the matter.
見方次第でこの問題は重大になる
Viewed in certain aspects, the question is of grave importance.

content:
みかた〔味方〕
〈名〉A friend; an ally; a supporter; one's side:(=する) to side with (one); to take one's side; to take the side of (the weaker party); to take sides with (a power); to take one's part; to take part with (the weaker party); to range oneself on the side of (the Liberals); to espouse the cause of (the suffragettes); to champion the cause of (the revolutionists); to support (a party)

content.content: 敵味方
friend and foe
彼は敵味方の区別をも知らぬ
He does not know friend from foe.
彼は味方として頼むべく敵として恐るべし
He is a powerful ally and a formidable foe.
彼はこちらの味方だ
He is our friend―He is on our side.
味方の戦況いかに
How goes the day with us?
僕は弱いほうに味方する主義だ
I make it a rule to side with the weaker party―take part with the weaker party.
彼は義理にも恩人に味方をせにゃならぬ
He is in duty bound to take part with his benefactor―take sides with his benefactor.
孫は革命軍に味方した
Sun espoused the cause of―championed the cause of―the revolutionists.
暫く日和見をしておったイタリアは連合軍側に味方することになった
Italy, which had been sitting on the fence for some time, came down on the side of the Allies.
イタリアは連合軍に味方して戦争に参加した
Italy entered the war on the side of the Allies.
教員が生徒に味方して校長を攻撃した(源平相和して第三者に当たる)
The teachers made common cause with the students against the principal.
彼は害された方なので世間は彼に味方した
As he was the injured party, public sympathy was on his side―public opinion was in his favour.
彼に逢った時は百万の味方を得たような心地がした
When I met him, I felt as if the gods were on my side.
あのような人を味方にしておくがよい
You ought to make a friend of such a man.
人を味方につける、味方に引き入れる
to gain over a man―win over a man
あの人を味方に引き入れることはできないか
Can't we win him over to our side?
彼は味方についた
He has come over to our side―joined our party.
彼はあちらへ味方した
He has gone over to the other party.

content:
みかづき〔三日月〕
〈名〉The new moon; the crescent (moon)

content.content: 三日月形
a crescent
三日月眉
arched eyebrows

content:
みがって〔身勝手〕
〈名〉One's own convenience; selfishness:(=な) selfish; self-willed; self-seeking

content.content: 彼は身勝手なことばかりする
He only consults his own convenience―He will have everything his own way.
人は身勝手なものだ
People are selfish.
そんなことをすれば身勝手の非難を受けてもしようがない
Such conduct is open to the censure of selfishness.
身勝手なことを申してすみませんがちょうど百円にして下さいませんか
Will you make it a round hundred if you don't mind?

みかど〔御門〕
〈名〉The Mikado; the Emperor of Japan

content:
みかねる〔見兼ねる〕
〈他動〉To be impatient at (any sight); to be unable to remain a mere spectator

content.content: その狂態を見るに見かねて口を出した
Impatient at his scandalous behaviour, I interfered.
彼はけんかを見かねて飛び込んだ
He could not remain an idle spectator of the quarrel and dashed in.

content:
みがまえ〔身構え〕
〈名〉Attitude of defence; posture of defence:(=する) to put oneself in a posture of defence; to throw oneself into a defensive attitude; to assume a defensive attitude; to stand ready; to stand on guard; to place oneself on one's guard; to gather oneself up (for an effort); to pull oneself together (for an effort); to brace oneself (for a fight); to square oneself (to fight)

content.content: さあ来いと身構えをした
I put myself in a posture of defence―threw myself into a defensive attitude.
打ち込んで来る太刀を受ける身構えをした
I stood on guard―placed myself on my guard.
格闘をする身構えをした
I braced myself for a fight―squared myself to fight.
ここひと奮発と身構えした
I gathered myself up for an effort―pulled myself together for an effort.
どんなことがあろうともと覚悟の身構えをした
I stood ready for anything that might happen.
寄らば斬ろうと身構えした
I stood ready to cut him down.
射撃には身構えが最も大事だ
Posture is the main thing in shooting.

content:
みがる〔身軽〕
〈形〉Light; agile; nimble; spry

content.content: 女優は身軽に舞踏する
Actresses are agile dancers.
舞踏の身軽な動作
the agile movements of the dance
身軽な出立ち
a light equipment―a light outfit
登山者は身軽な出立ちだ
The mountain-climbers are lightly equipped.
旅行には身軽な出立ちに限る
There is nothing like a light outfit for travelling.
身軽になる
(荷を下ろしてなら)to be eased of a load―(重荷を下ろしてなら)―be relieved of a burden―(産をしてなら)―be delivered of a child
(心配の重荷を下ろして)身軽になったような気がする
A weight is off my mind―A load is taken off my mind.

content:
みかわす〔見交わす〕
〈自動〉To look at each other

content.content: 互いに見交わす顔と顔
Our eyes met.

content:
みがわり〔身代り〕
〈名〉A substitute; a scapegoat; a whipping-boy; a vicarious sacrifice

content.content: 身代りに立つ
to act as a substitute―take one's place―die in place of another―die in one's stead
彼は主人の身代りに立った
He died in place of his master―He saved his master at the price of his own life.
身代りに立てる
to use some one as one's substitute―put some one in one's place―make a scapegoat of some one
僕は人の身代りになって罰を受けた
I was made a scapegoat of―made a whipping-boy of―made a vicarious sacrifice.

みかん〔味官〕
〈名〉The organ of taste; the tongue; the palate

content:
みかん〔味感〕
〈名〉(The sense of) taste; gustation

content.content: 味感神経
the gustatory nerve

content:
みかん〔未完〕
〈形〉Incomplete; unfinished

content.content: (書き物の終わりに)未完
To be continued―To be concluded.

content:
みかん〔蜜柑〕
〈名〉The orange

content.content: 蜜柑の皮をむく
to peel an orange
蜜柑の皮
orange-peel

みき〔幹〕
〈名〉The trunk, the stock, the stem (of a tree)

みき〔神酒〕
〈名〉Wine offered to a god; a drink-offering; a libation

content:
みぎ〔右〕
〈名〉
1. The right:(=の) right

content.content: 右の手
the right hand
彼は亭主役の右に座った
He sat on the right of the host.
僕のに右に居たのが田中だ
The man on my right was Tanaka.
その家は通りの右側だ
The house is on the right of the street―on the right-hand side of the street.
道路の右に当たって立派な家がある
There stands a fine building (to the) right of the road.
右へ曲る
to turn to the right―take the turning on the right
廻れ右
Right about turn!―Right about face!
廻れ右をする
to turn about―face about
右向け右
Right turn!
右へならえ
Eyes right!―Right dress!
右の耳から入って左の耳から出てしまう
to come in at one ear and go out at the other
右の通り
as above
右の通り相違御座無く候
I affirm the above to be correct in every particular―(に相当するは)―E. &. O. E. (=Errors and Omissions Excepted―誤謬脱漏此限に非ず)
右に出る
to surpass―exceed―excel―the other
学問では彼の右に出る者は無い
No one surpasses him in scholarship―No one can compare with him in scholarship―He has no equal in scholarship.
日本刀の右に出る刀剣は無い
No sword can compare with the Japanese sword―The Japanese sword has no equal.
右から左へ
easily―with ease
大金のことだから右から左へというわけにはいかない
I can not have such a large sum ready so easily.
彼は右から左へ融通が利く
He has easy credit.

content:
みきき〔見聞き〕
〈名〉Seeing and hearing; information; experience:(=する) to see and hear; to experience

content.content: 子どもは見聞きして覚える
A child learns from its surroundings.

content:
みきり〔見切り〕
〈名〉
1. (=放棄)abandonment

content.content: 見切りをつける
to abandon the attempt―give up the attempt―give up all hope of success―give up a man as hopeless
幾度やっても駄目だからもう見切りをつけた
All my attempts have been in vain, and I have given it up in despair―given it up as a bad job.
あの男には見切りをつけた
I have given him up as hopeless―I will have nothing more to do with him―I have done with him.
もう見切り時だ
It is time to give up.

content: 2. (=最小限)minimum

content.content: なーに危ないことはありません、見切りをつけています
I minimize the danger.

content: 3. (=果断)decision; resolution

content.content: 彼は見切りが好い
He is decisive―resolute.
見切りが悪い
He is indecisive―irresolute―He lacks decision―He never knows his own mind.
もう見切り時だ
It is time to decide―It is high time you should make up your mind.

content:
みぎり〔砌〕
〈名〉Time; occasion:(接続詞に用いれば)when:(前置詞に用いれば)in; at

content.content: 上京のみぎりに逢ったことがある
I once met him when I was in town.
大地震のみぎりたいそう働いた
He rendered great service at the Great Earthquake.

content:
みきりうり〔見切売り〕
〈名〉Bargain sale; sacrifice sale; slaughter sale; clearance sale:(=する) to sell at a bargain; to sell at a sacrifice; to clear off (goods)

content.content: 閉店につき見切大安売り
Great bargains offered at final riddance sale.

みきりもの〔見切物〕
〈名〉A bargain; clearance goods

content:
みきる〔見切る〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=見切りをつける)to abandon (the attempt); to give up (the attempt); to give up (the attempt) in despair; to give up (the attempt) as a bad job; to give up (a man) as hopeless; to give up all hope (of success); to wash one's hands of (an affair)

content.content: 幾度やっても駄目だからもう見切った
All my attempts have been in vain, and I have given it up in despair―given it up as a bad job.
あの男はもう見切った
I have given him up as hopeless―I have done with him.
この事件は全く見切った
I wash my hands of the whole business.
そう見切ったものじゃない
You need not give up all hope―He is not so hopeless as you think―There is yet hope.

content:
2. (=見切売りする)to sell at a bargain; to sell at a sacrifice; to clear off (goods)
3. (=果断な処置をする)to take decisive measures; to decide; to make up one's mind

みぎわ〔汀〕
〈名〉The water's edge; the beach

content:
みきわめる〔見極める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=確かめる)to ascertain (a fact); to make sure of (a fact); to convince oneself of (a fact); to assure oneself of (a fact); to satisfy oneself of (a fact)

content.content: 真偽を見極めなければならぬ
I must ascertain the truth―make sure of the truth―convince oneself of the truth.
彼の改心を見極めた
I am sure of―am assured of―am convinced of―am satisfied of―his repentance.
犯人はおおよそ見極めがついた
We are pretty sure of the culprit―pretty sure who is the culprit.

content: 2. (=奥義を極める)to see into the heart of (things); to be initiated into the mysteries of (an art)

みくじ〔御籤〕
〈名〉A written oracle

content.content: 御籤を引く
to consult the divine oracle

content:
みくだす〔見下す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=上から見下ろす)to look down upon (a place); to take a bird's-eye view of (a place)

content.content: 山の上から全市を見下す
The hill looks down upon the city―commands a bird's-eye view of the whole city.

content: 2. (=軽蔑する)to look down upon (one); to despise

content.content: 彼は人を眼下に見下す
He looks down upon people.
彼らは彼を食客のように見下している
They look down upon him as a sort of dependant.

みくだりはん〔三行半〕
〈名〉A letter of divorce

content:
みくに〔御国〕
〈名〉Our country

content.content: 御国の光り
the glory of the country
御国魂
the Yamato spirit
御国風{ぶり}
manners and customs of Japan―Japanese literature

content:
みくびる〔見くびる〕
〈他動〉To underrate; underestimate; to undervalue; to despise; to hold (one) in contempt; to hold (one) cheap; to think meanly of (one); to make light of (anything)

content.content: 人を見くびるものでない
You should not hold people cheap.
敵を見くびるよりも買いかぶる方が安全だ
It is safer to overrate than to underrate your enemy.
君は相手を子どもだと思って見くびって掛かったのが失策だ
You made a mistake in despising your opponent as a mere boy.
人の支度が悪いとて見くびるものでない
You should not think the worse of a man because he is poorly dressed.
彼は病気をこれしきのことと見くびっているうちに手後れになった
He made light of his illness, till it was too late.

みくら〔御座〕
〈名〉The Imperial Throne

content:
みくらべる〔見比べる〕
〈他動〉To compare (two things) with the eye

content.content: 彼は二人の顔を見比べた
He looked from one to the other.
